original: gang zhig mi nyan pa de ni bsod nams kyi las kyi rkyen gyis bde 'gro nyid du'o //üîΩ@190b yang gang zhig dam pa ma yin pa dag la bstan par bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang zhig mi nyan pa de ni bsod nams kyi las kyi rkyen gyis bde 'gro nyid du'o // @190b yang gang zhig dam pa ma yin pa dag la bstan par bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: One who does not listen to it is reborn in the happy realms due to the condition of meritorious karma.üîΩAgain, what is this ‚Äúselflessness‚Äù that should not be taught to those who are not vessels,

original: dam pa dag la bstan par bya ba bdag med pa zhes bya ba 'di yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: dam pa dag la bstan par bya ba bdag med pa zhes bya ba 'di yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: and that should be taught to those who are vessels?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to teach that, it is said:

original: zhi sgo gnyis pa med pa dang // lta ba ngan rnams 'jig byed cing //
analyzed: zhi sgo gnyis pa med pa dang // lta ba ngan rnams 'jig byed cing //
translated: The door to peace is not dual, it destroys bad views,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi yul gyur la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi yul gyur la //
translated: and is the domain of all buddhas.

original: bdag med ces ni bya bar brjod //
analyzed: bdag med ces ni bya bar brjod //
translated: It is called ‚Äúselflessness.‚Äù

original: gang zhig zhi ba'i sgo gnyis pa med pa ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig zhi ba'i sgo gnyis pa med pa ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: The door to peace that is not dual is selflessness.

original: gang zhig lta ba ngan pa rnams 'jig par byed pa de ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig lta ba ngan pa rnams 'jig par byed pa de ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: That which destroys bad views is selflessness.

original: gang zhig sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul du gyur pa de ni bdag med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul du gyur pa de ni bdag med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the domain of all buddhas is called ‚Äúselflessness.‚Äù

original: de la bdag ces bya ba ni gang zhig dngos po rnams kyi gzhan la rag ma las pa'i ngo bo rang bzhin te de med pa ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag ces bya ba ni gang zhig dngos po rnams kyi gzhan la rag ma las pa'i ngo bo rang bzhin te de med pa ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: Here, the so-called self is the intrinsic reality of things, which is not dependent on another. The absence of that is selflessness.

original: de ni chos dang gang zag gi dbye bas gnyis su rtogs te chos kyi bdag med pa dang / gang zag gi bdag med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni chos dang gang zag gi dbye bas gnyis su rtogs te chos kyi bdag med pa dang / gang zag gi bdag med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is understood as twofold by way of the distinction of things and persons, called the selflessness of things and the selflessness of persons.

original: de la gang zag ces bya ba ni gang phung po lnga la brten nas brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de la gang zag ces bya ba ni gang phung po lnga la brten nas brtags pa ste /
translated: Here, the so-called person is that which is imputed in dependence on the five aggregates.

original: de ni phung po dag la rnam pa lngas btsal ba ni mi srid do //
analyzed: de ni phung po dag la rnam pa lngas btsal ba ni mi srid do //
translated: That is not possible to seek in five ways in the aggregates.

original: chos ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched ces bya ba'i dngos po rnams so //
analyzed: chos ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched ces bya ba'i dngos po rnams so //
translated: Things are the entities called aggregates, elements, and media.

original: de'i phyir chos de rnams dang gang zag la bdag nyid ji lta ba'i rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir chos de rnams dang gang zag la bdag nyid ji lta ba'i rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te ;
translated: Therefore, those things and the person are dependent on causes and conditions in accordance with their own natures.

original: skye ba'i phyir dang brtan nas brtags pa'i phyir bdag gi rang gi ngo bo rang la rag las shing gzhan la rag ma las pa yod pa ma yin pas gang zag dang chos rnams rang bzhin med par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir dang brtan nas brtags pa'i phyir bdag gi rang gi ngo bo rang la rag las shing gzhan la rag ma las pa yod pa ma yin pas gang zag dang chos rnams rang bzhin med par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Because it is produced and because it is examined after it has endured, the self does not exist inherently, depending on itself and not on another. Therefore, persons and things are established as lacking intrinsic reality.

original: don gang zhig la rang gi ngo bos grub pa yod pa ma yin pa de bdag nyid gzhan gang zhig gis 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: don gang zhig la rang gi ngo bos grub pa yod pa ma yin pa de bdag nyid gzhan gang zhig gis 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: How could that object which does not exist by way of its own nature be established by any other nature?

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnam pa thams cad du rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ma grub pa bstan nas sam nye bar blangs nas slu ba'i bdag nyid du 'byung ba rnams ni blo blun pa'i chags pa'i gzhir 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnam pa thams cad du rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ma grub pa bstan nas sam nye bar blangs nas slu ba'i bdag nyid du 'byung ba rnams ni blo blun pa'i chags pa'i gzhir 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, having taught or having taken up the fact that things are not established by their own characteristics in any way, those who appear to have a deceptive nature are the basis of the attachment of fools.

original: rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par mthong ba rnams kyis bsgoms pa na chos dang gang zag gnyis la chags pa yongs su zad pa 'dren par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par mthong ba rnams kyis bsgoms pa na chos dang gang zag gnyis la chags pa yongs su zad pa 'dren par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, when those who see things as they are in reality meditate on this, they bring about the complete cessation of attachment to persons and phenomena.

original: chags pa yongs su zad pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: chags pa yongs su zad pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: The complete exhaustion of attachment is the cause of attaining nirvana.

original: rang bzhin med par lta ba las ma gtogs pa'i chos 'ga' zhig de ltar @191a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par lta ba las ma gtogs pa'i chos 'ga' zhig de ltar @191a * //
translated: And there is no other dharma apart from the view of essencelessness

original: chags pa yongs su zad pa'i rgyu yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chags pa yongs su zad pa'i rgyu yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: that is the cause of the complete exhaustion of attachment.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bdag med pa 'di ni zhi ba'i sgo gnyis pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bdag med pa 'di ni zhi ba'i sgo gnyis pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, this selflessness, which is characterized by essencelessness, is the door of peace, for there is no second.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'jug par bya ba la 'di gcig pu kho na zla med pa'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'jug par bya ba la 'di gcig pu kho na zla med pa'i sgo yin no //
translated: It is the sole, incomparable door for entering the city of nirvana.

original: gal te yang stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa zhes bya ba rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa zhes bya ba rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum yod mod kyi /
translated: Even though there are three doors of liberation called ‚Äúemptiness,‚Äù ‚Äúsignlessness,‚Äù and ‚Äúwishlessness,‚Äù

original: de lta na yang bdag med par lta ba kho na gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang bdag med par lta ba kho na gtso bo yin te /
translated: the view of selflessness is the most important.

original: chos ma lus pa bdag med par rig cing dngos po thams cad la chags pa ma lus pa zad pa la 'gar yang 'ga' zhig don du gnyer ba'am mtshan mar dmigs pa ga la yod /
analyzed: chos ma lus pa bdag med par rig cing dngos po thams cad la chags pa ma lus pa zad pa la 'gar yang 'ga' zhig don du gnyer ba'am mtshan mar dmigs pa ga la yod /
translated: How could there be any pursuit of anything or observation of a sign in the complete knowledge of selflessness of all phenomena and the exhaustion of all attachment to things?

original: de'i phyir bdag med pa 'di ni zhi ba'i sgo gnyis pa med pa kho na zhig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med pa 'di ni zhi ba'i sgo gnyis pa med pa kho na zhig go //
translated: Therefore, this selflessness is the sole, nondual door of peace.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub kyi tshogs las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub kyi tshogs las /
translated: Thus, the Accumulation of the Factors of Awakening says:

original: rang bzhin med pas stong la stong pa ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pas stong la stong pa ni //
translated: Since it is essenceless, it is empty.

original: yin dang mtshan mas ci zhig byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: yin dang mtshan mas ci zhig byed par 'gyur //
translated: What could emptiness do with signs?

original: mtshan ma thams cad log par 'gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad log par 'gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: Since all signs are reversed,

original: mkhas pas ci ste smon lam 'debs par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad do //üîΩ'di ni lta ba ngan pa rnams 'jig par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mkhas pas ci ste smon lam 'debs par 'gyur // zhes bshad do // 'di ni lta ba ngan pa rnams 'jig par byed pa ste /
translated: why would the wise make a prayer?üîΩThis is the destroyer of bad views.

original: lta ba ngan pa ni ngan par brtses pa'i lta ba dag go //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa ni ngan par brtses pa'i lta ba dag go //
translated: Bad views are bad, contemptible views.

original: bdag med pa yin na ni dngos po rnams rnam pa thams cad du ma dmigs pas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su brtags pa'i rten can lta ba ngan pa rnams gtan nas 'jig par mthong ba'i phyir bdag med pa 'di ni 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa yin na ni dngos po rnams rnam pa thams cad du ma dmigs pas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su brtags pa'i rten can lta ba ngan pa rnams gtan nas 'jig par mthong ba'i phyir bdag med pa 'di ni 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: If there were no self, since things would not be apprehended in any way, the bad views which have the nature of things as their basis would be completely destroyed, and so this selflessness is a destroyer.

original: bdag med pa ni sangs rgyas kun gyi yul te sangs rgyas kun gyi zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni sangs rgyas kun gyi yul te sangs rgyas kun gyi zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi'o //
translated: The domain of all the Buddhas, of all the Hearers and Self-Buddhas, and of the unsurpassed, perfect, complete Buddhas.

original: ye shes kyi khyad par gyi yul nyid du gnas pa'i phyir na sangs rgyas kun gyi yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi khyad par gyi yul nyid du gnas pa'i phyir na sangs rgyas kun gyi yul zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the domain of all the Buddhas because it is the domain of the special knowledge of all the Buddhas.

original: yang na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku las tha mi dad par bzhugs pa thams cad kyi yin par bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kun gyi zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku las tha mi dad par bzhugs pa thams cad kyi yin par bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kun gyi zhes bshad do //
translated: Or else, it is explained as the domain of all the Buddhas in order to teach that it is the domain of all those who dwell without distinction from the Dharma Body of the perfect, complete Buddha.

original: khyad par gyi phreng gis ni slob dpon gyis chos thams cad bdag med par gsungs so //
analyzed: khyad par gyi phreng gis ni slob dpon gyis chos thams cad bdag med par gsungs so //
translated: The garland of distinctions shows that the Master has taught the selflessness of all things.

original: bdag med pa 'di ni dam pas skye bo blo zhan pa la bstan par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa 'di ni dam pas skye bo blo zhan pa la bstan par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: This selflessness is not to be taught to the weak-minded, because

original: gang @191b gi phyir /
analyzed: gang @191b gi phyir /
translated: for what reason?

original: chos 'di yi ni ming las kyang //
analyzed: chos 'di yi ni ming las kyang //
translated: Even from the name of this teaching,

original: dam pa min pa 'jigs pa skye //
analyzed: dam pa min pa 'jigs pa skye //
translated: the non-noble become frightened.

original: dam pa ma yin pa ni chos 'di gting thug par dka' zhing zab pa'i phyir bdag med pa'i sgra thos pa las kyang 'jigs pa skye'o //üîΩ'di ltar / gzhan la 'jigs pa mi skyed pa'i //
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa ni chos 'di gting thug par dka' zhing zab pa'i phyir bdag med pa'i sgra thos pa las kyang 'jigs pa skye'o // 'di ltar / gzhan la 'jigs pa mi skyed pa'i //
translated: The non-noble become frightened even from hearing the word ‚Äúselflessness‚Äù because this teaching is profound, difficult to cross over.üîΩIn this way:

original: stobs ldan zhes bya gang zhig mthong //
analyzed: stobs ldan zhes bya gang zhig mthong //
translated: Who is seen as powerful, not frightening others?

original: bdag med par lta ba ni stobs dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag med par lta ba ni stobs dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The view of selflessness is powerful,

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i lta ba thams cad drungs 'byin par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i lta ba thams cad drungs 'byin par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is able to uproot all non-noble views.

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i lta ba ni stobs chung ba ste drungs dbyung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i lta ba ni stobs chung ba ste drungs dbyung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-noble views are weak, because they are to be uprooted.

original: gang stobs dang ldan pa la stobs chung ba 'jigs so zhes bya ba 'di ni nges pa yang yin no //üîΩde'i phyir stobs chung zhing lta ba ngan pas sems kyi rgyud bdag gir byas pa la chos 'di bstan par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gang stobs dang ldan pa la stobs chung ba 'jigs so zhes bya ba 'di ni nges pa yang yin no // de'i phyir stobs chung zhing lta ba ngan pas sems kyi rgyud bdag gir byas pa la chos 'di bstan par mi bya ste /
translated: It is certain that the weak fear the strong.

original: 'jigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, this teaching should not be taught to those who are weak and have inferior views, because it would be a cause for fear.

original: gal te lta ba ngan pa ril 'joms pa'i phyir chos 'di bstan par bya ba ma yin nam ;
analyzed: gal te lta ba ngan pa ril 'joms pa'i phyir chos 'di bstan par bya ba ma yin nam ;
translated: If this teaching is not taught in order to destroy all inferior views,

original: 'di ltar phas kyi rgol ba rnams ni gdon mi za bar chos dang mthun par tshar gcad par bya ba zhig ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar phas kyi rgol ba rnams ni gdon mi za bar chos dang mthun par tshar gcad par bya ba zhig ste /
translated: then surely the opponents must be defeated in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir rtsod pa don du gnyer zhing gzhan gyi lugs pham par bya bar 'dod par gyur bas chos 'di snod dag la nye bar bstan par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtsod pa don du gnyer zhing gzhan gyi lugs pham par bya bar 'dod par gyur bas chos 'di snod dag la nye bar bstan par bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, those who seek debate and wish to defeat others should teach this doctrine to suitable candidates.

original: bshad par bya ste 'di ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste 'di ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: We reply: This is not so.

original: 'di ltar / chos 'di de bzhin gshegs rnams kyis //
analyzed: 'di ltar / chos 'di de bzhin gshegs rnams kyis //
translated: The TathƒÅgatas did not teach this doctrine

original: rtsod pa'i ched du ma gsungs te //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i ched du ma gsungs te //
translated: For the sake of debate.

original: gal te chos 'di rtsod pa'i ched du bstan par 'gyur na ni 'di de ltar 'gyur ba zhig dang / 'di ni rtsod pa'i don du bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te chos 'di rtsod pa'i ched du bstan par 'gyur na ni 'di de ltar 'gyur ba zhig dang / 'di ni rtsod pa'i don du bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not taught for the sake of debate,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught as the door of liberation.

original: gal te yang de lta yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang de lta yin mod kyi /
translated: And even if it were so,

original: de lta'ang 'dis ni gzhan smra rnams //
analyzed: de lta'ang 'dis ni gzhan smra rnams //
translated: this doctrine burns up the doctrines of others,

original: bsreg ste me yis bud shing bzhin //
analyzed: bsreg ste me yis bud shing bzhin //
translated: like fire burns up sticks.

original: rtsod pa'i don du ma bstan yang chos 'di ni pha rol po'i smra ba sel bar byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i don du ma bstan yang chos 'di ni pha rol po'i smra ba sel bar byed pa kho na'o //
translated: Even though it is not taught for the sake of debate, this doctrine burns up the doctrines of others.

original: me nye bar len pa ni btso ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'i don du yin la bud shing bsreg pa'i don du ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: me nye bar len pa ni btso ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'i don du yin la bud shing bsreg pa'i don du ma yin mod kyi /
translated: The fire is taken up for the sake of cooking and other such activities, not for the sake of burning fuel.

original: de lta na yang sreg par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas 'dod pa'i bya ba rjes su sgrub cing bud shing yang sreg par byed do //
analyzed: de lta na yang sreg par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas 'dod pa'i bya ba rjes su sgrub cing bud shing yang sreg par byed do //
translated: Nevertheless, because it has the nature of burning, it accomplishes the desired activity and also burns the fuel.

original: me ji lta ba bzhin du chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis bdag med par shes pa yang dad pa @192a * //
analyzed: me ji lta ba bzhin du chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis bdag med par shes pa yang dad pa @192a * //
translated: Just as with fire, all phenomena are understood to be essentially devoid of self.üîΩ

original: can gyi rgyud la nye bar skye ba na de ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: can gyi rgyud la nye bar skye ba na de ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: Just as fire, likewise, one should understand that all phenomena are naturally selfless when they arise in the mindstream of the faithful.

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba thams cad sreg par byed pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba thams cad sreg par byed pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have the nature of burning up all the bonds of affliction.

original: yang ji ltar chos 'di dad pa can gyi rgyud la nye bar skye ba na pha rol po'i smra ba dag sreg par 'gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: yang ji ltar chos 'di dad pa can gyi rgyud la nye bar skye ba na pha rol po'i smra ba dag sreg par 'gyur zhe na ;
translated: Moreover, how is it that when this Dharma arises in the mindstream of the faithful, the arguments of others are burned up?üîΩIt is said:

original: bshad pa / chos 'di gang gis shes gyur pa //
analyzed: bshad pa / chos 'di gang gis shes gyur pa //
translated: One who knows this Dharma

original: de ni gzhan pa mi dga' ste //
analyzed: de ni gzhan pa mi dga' ste //
translated: does not delight in others.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdud rtsi myangs pa ni de las gzhan pa'i lta ba'i rol mnog  med par byed pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i lta ba thams cad la de mi dga'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdud rtsi myangs pa ni de las gzhan pa'i lta ba'i rol mnog  med par byed pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i lta ba thams cad la de mi dga'o //
translated: One who has tasted the nectar of seeing the reality of the supreme Dharma makes all other views tasteless, so they do not delight in any other views.

original: slob dpon dam pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi'i ro myangs pa lta bur gyur te skye bo blo dang ldan pa'i yid tshim par byed pa'i tshig gsung ba /
analyzed: slob dpon dam pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi'i ro myangs pa lta bur gyur te skye bo blo dang ldan pa'i yid tshim par byed pa'i tshig gsung ba /
translated: The Master, like one who has tasted the nectar of the holy Dharma, speaks words that satisfy the minds of the wise.

original: des na bdag la chos 'di ni //
analyzed: des na bdag la chos 'di ni //
translated: Therefore, this Dharma appears to me

original: 'jig pa'i sgo dang 'dra bar snang //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i sgo dang 'dra bar snang //
translated: like a door to destruction.

original: slar mi skye bas 'jig pa mthong ba'i phyir chos 'di ni bdag med pa'i chos rtogs pa'i rgyud la dam pa ma yin pa'i lta ba thams cad 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no snyam du slob dpon la snang ngo //
analyzed: slar mi skye bas 'jig pa mthong ba'i phyir chos 'di ni bdag med pa'i chos rtogs pa'i rgyud la dam pa ma yin pa'i lta ba thams cad 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no snyam du slob dpon la snang ngo //
translated: The Master sees this Dharma as the cause for the destruction of all non-Buddhist views in the mindstream that realizes the Dharma of selflessness, because it is seen to destroy by not arising again.

original: 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig yang 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pas 'jig pa'i sgo dang 'dra bar zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig yang 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pas 'jig pa'i sgo dang 'dra bar zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained as ‚Äúlike a door to destruction‚Äù because it is not the cause of destruction for anyone, since it has the nature of non-apprehension.

original: yang na bstan pa'i chos la dgongs nas 'jig pa'i sgo dang 'dra bar zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang na bstan pa'i chos la dgongs nas 'jig pa'i sgo dang 'dra bar zhes bshad do //
translated: Or it is explained as ‚Äúlike a door to destruction‚Äù with reference to the Dharma of teaching.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni gtan du ba'i 'jig pa yin la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni gtan du ba'i 'jig pa yin la /
translated: Nirvana is a permanent destruction.

original: der rjes su 'jug pa'i sgo ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin la bstan pa'i chos kyang slob dpon la de dang 'dra bar snang ste /
analyzed: der rjes su 'jug pa'i sgo ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin la bstan pa'i chos kyang slob dpon la de dang 'dra bar snang ste /
translated: The door of entry into that is the door of liberation, which has the nature of the realization of emptiness. The Dharma of the teaching appears to the master in the same way.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin thugs su chud par shes nas dad pa dang ldan pa lta ba gzhan mngon par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du lung gi chos rtogs pa yang gzhan la mi dga' snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin thugs su chud par shes nas dad pa dang ldan pa lta ba gzhan mngon par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du lung gi chos rtogs pa yang gzhan la mi dga' snyam du dgongs so //
translated: Just as one who has faith, knowing that the nature of the noble Dharma is to be realized in one's mind, does not desire any other view, so too one who has realized the Dharma of transmission does not delight in any other.

original: ci ste 'phags pa rnams la yang ci'i phyir 'di skrag pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'phags pa rnams la yang ci'i phyir 'di skrag pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But why would this not be a cause of fear for the noble ones?

original: bdag la chags pa log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have eliminated attachment to self.

original: gang la bdag la chags pa yod pa de dang rjes su mthun pa'i dngos po'i lta ba 'dod kyi de dang mi mthun pas bdag med par lta ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la bdag la chags pa yod pa de dang rjes su mthun pa'i dngos po'i lta ba 'dod kyi de dang mi mthun pas bdag med par lta ba ni ma yin no //
translated: One who has attachment to self desires a view of things that accords with that, not a view of selflessness that does not accord with it.

original: de nyid du bdag med snyam du //üîΩde ltar gang la dgongs @192b gnas pa //
analyzed: de nyid du bdag med snyam du //üîΩde ltar gang la dgongs @192b gnas pa //
translated: One thinks, I will not exist,üîΩand one thinks, I will be something other.

original: 'phags pa / de ni yod pas ga la dga' //
analyzed: 'phags pa / de ni yod pas ga la dga' //
translated: How can the noble one delight in existence?

original: med pas 'jig par gal 'gyur //
analyzed: med pas 'jig par gal 'gyur //
translated: How can he fear annihilation?

original: gang zhig la phyi dang nang gi dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'ga' yang rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin no snyam pa'i dgongs pa rnam par gnas pa de ni gang med par mthong ba las de
analyzed: gang zhig la phyi dang nang gi dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'ga' yang rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin no snyam pa'i dgongs pa rnam par gnas pa de ni gang med par mthong ba las de
translated: The noble one who is established in the thought that nothing exists by intrinsic nature, because he does not understand the intrinsic reality of internal and external things, how can he delight in existence, seeing that nothing exists?

original: bdag med pa la 'jigs par 'gyur pa yod par lta ba yod pas yongs su tshim par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag med pa la 'jigs par 'gyur pa yod par lta ba yod pas yongs su tshim par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How can he be satisfied by the view of existence, since he fears selflessness?

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gi rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang bral ba'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gi rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang bral ba'o zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said that he is free from attachment and aversion.

original: yod par lta ba la rjes su chags pa med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: yod par lta ba la rjes su chags pa med pa'i phyir la /
translated: He is free from attachment to the view of existence,

original: bdag med par lta ba la yang khong khro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med par lta ba la yang khong khro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and he is free from aversion to the view of selflessness.

original: de'i phyir gnyis la mi spyod cing rtsod pa med pa 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du bde blag tu 'gro ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis la mi spyod cing rtsod pa med pa 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du bde blag tu 'gro ste /
translated: Therefore, one who does not engage in duality and is free of dispute easily goes to the city of nirvana.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dam pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir na bdag med pa de de'i 'jigs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dam pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir na bdag med pa de de'i 'jigs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since nirvana is the highest state, selflessness is not the cause of fear for it.

original: dngos por lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i mu stegs can mya ngan las 'das pa la g-yang sar 'du shes pa rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa las 'jig rten gcod par byed cing skye bo sdug bsngal mtha' yas pa'i rgyu dngos por lta ba la sbyor
analyzed: dngos por lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i mu stegs can mya ngan las 'das pa la g-yang sar 'du shes pa rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa las 'jig rten gcod par byed cing skye bo sdug bsngal mtha' yas pa'i rgyu dngos por lta ba la sbyor
translated: The tirthikas, who are attached to the view of real entity, who perceive nirvana as a precipice, who cut themselves off from nirvana, who bind beings to the view of real entity, the cause of infinite suffering,

original: ba na 'gro ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal mu mtha' med pa'i sa bon du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: ba na 'gro ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal mu mtha' med pa'i sa bon du gyur pa yin no //
translated: are the seed of the infinite suffering of beings.

original: de'i phyir / don min sa bon gyur pa yi //
analyzed: de'i phyir / don min sa bon gyur pa yi //
translated: Therefore,

original: mu stegs can mang mthong nas ni //
analyzed: mu stegs can mang mthong nas ni //
translated: seeing the many tirthikas who are the seed of non-object,üîΩwho are the seed of infinite suffering for beings,

original: chos 'dod pa yi skye bo la //üîΩsu zhig snying mi brtse bar 'gyur //
analyzed: chos 'dod pa yi skye bo la //üîΩsu zhig snying mi brtse bar 'gyur //

original: 'jig rten 'di ni mu stegs byed kyi sbrul dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba dam pa ma yin pa'i tsher ma shin tu 'thebs po'i tshang tshing dang ldan pa rnams kyis lam bzang po nas bkug ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni mu stegs byed kyi sbrul dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba dam pa ma yin pa'i tsher ma shin tu 'thebs po'i tshang tshing dang ldan pa rnams kyis lam bzang po nas bkug ste /
translated: They lead people away from the good path,

original: lta ba'i tsher ma'i tshang tshing du bcug nas thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i srog gi dbang po bcad pa'i sgo nas nyin re zhing gsod par byed do ;üîΩ/ gang zhig ci zhig ltar skyes bu'i byed pas bdag nyid de las yongs su grol bar byas nas lam bzang po la brten pa de ni mdza' bshes tshegs che zhing yang bar phyin pa de las grol ba zhig sngar gyi rgyud pa'i gtam thos pas snying zhu
analyzed: lta ba'i tsher ma'i tshang tshing du bcug nas thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i srog gi dbang po bcad pa'i sgo nas nyin re zhing gsod par byed do ; / gang zhig ci zhig ltar skyes bu'i byed pas bdag nyid de las yongs su grol bar byas nas lam bzang po la brten pa de ni mdza' bshes tshegs che zhing yang bar phyin pa de las grol ba zhig sngar gyi rgyud pa'i gtam thos pas snying zhu
translated: and having made them enter the thicket of the brambles of views, they cut the life-faculty of the virtue that is conducive to liberation.üîΩIn this way, they kill people every day.

original: ba'i gnyen rnams kyis brtse bar bya ba yin pa de @193a * //
analyzed: ba'i gnyen rnams kyis brtse bar bya ba yin pa de @193a * //
translated: Whoever, by some means, is liberated from that by the activity of a person and relies on the good path, is one who is to be loved by the friends who are the stories of the former lives of the Victorious Ones, who are liberated from the difficult and arduous path of the tirthikas.

original: lta bu ste de dang 'dra bar rnam pa de lta bu'i skye bo rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can gang zhig snying brtse bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: lta bu ste de dang 'dra bar rnam pa de lta bu'i skye bo rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can gang zhig snying brtse bar mi 'gyur /
translated: How could a Bodhisattva not have compassion for such people?

original: snying brtse ba las kyang gus par byas te de la gang gis na 'dir slar yang mu stegs can gyi sbrul dag gis phrogs par mi 'gyur ba rang bzhin med ba'i lam nye bar bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: snying brtse ba las kyang gus par byas te de la gang gis na 'dir slar yang mu stegs can gyi sbrul dag gis phrogs par mi 'gyur ba rang bzhin med ba'i lam nye bar bstan par bya'o //
translated: And from compassion, he will teach them the path of selflessness, so that they will not be stolen away again by the snakes of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: yang ci'i phyir sems can rnams dge ba'i bsam pa can yin yang phal cher mu stegs can rnams kyi lugs dang rjes su 'brel gyi bde bar gshegs pa'i dang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir sems can rnams dge ba'i bsam pa can yin yang phal cher mu stegs can rnams kyi lugs dang rjes su 'brel gyi bde bar gshegs pa'i dang ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that, although sentient beings have virtuous intentions, they are mostly connected to the systems of the tƒ´rthikas and not to the Sugata‚Äôs system?

original: de ni phra ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar rags pa mthong zhing /
analyzed: de ni phra ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar rags pa mthong zhing /
translated: Because the latter is subtle.üîΩFor the tƒ´rthikas‚Äô systems are coarse,

original: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi gtsug lag khang dang kha zas dang chos gos la sogs pa mchog tu gyur pa dmigs nas lta ba phyin ci log pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyi don zab mo mkhas shing mdzangs pas rig par bya ba'i gting mi
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi gtsug lag khang dang kha zas dang chos gos la sogs pa mchog tu gyur pa dmigs nas lta ba phyin ci log pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyi don zab mo mkhas shing mdzangs pas rig par bya ba'i gting mi
translated: Seeing the excellent temples, food, Dharma robes, and so on of the sugatas, those with wrong views do not fathom the profound meaning of the scriptures of the TathƒÅgata, which is to be known by the wise and the intelligent.

original: dpogs shing mthong ba dang thos pa tsam gyis bslus pa na mu stegs can rnams kyi gzhung lugs dag la gus par byed do //
analyzed: dpogs shing mthong ba dang thos pa tsam gyis bslus pa na mu stegs can rnams kyi gzhung lugs dag la gus par byed do //
translated: Not understanding it merely by seeing and hearing, they are deceived and respect the scriptures of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: ji ltar bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi chos 'di phra ba nyid dang / de las gzhan pa rnams kyi rags pa nyid yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi chos 'di phra ba nyid dang / de las gzhan pa rnams kyi rags pa nyid yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate how the Dharma of the sugatas is subtle and that of others is coarse, it is said:

original: sh'akya gos med bram ze ste //
analyzed: sh'akya gos med bram ze ste //
translated: The ≈öƒÅkya, the naked, and the brahmin,üîΩThe Dharma of these three is grasped by the mind,

original: gsum po rnams kyi'ang chos yid dang // mig dang rna ba yis 'dzin pa //
analyzed: gsum po rnams kyi'ang chos yid dang // mig dang rna ba yis 'dzin pa //
translated: The eye, and the ear.

original: de'i phyir thub pa'i gzhung lugs phra //
analyzed: de'i phyir thub pa'i gzhung lugs phra //
translated: Therefore, the scriptures of the Sage are subtle.

original: bram ze rnams ni 'don pa snying por byed pa ste /
analyzed: bram ze rnams ni 'don pa snying por byed pa ste /
translated: The brahmins make recitation their essence.

original: de rnams kyi de ni rna ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi de ni rna ba'i yul lo //
translated: The object of the ear is sound.üîΩ

original: gcer bu pa dag ni gtsang sbrar spyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir lus dri  ba'i 'dam 'phel bzhin pas gos shing lus khrus ras dang bral ba grang ba dang rlung dang nyi ma dang skra 'bal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gzhir gyur pa rnams te
analyzed: gcer bu pa dag ni gtsang sbrar spyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir lus dri  ba'i 'dam 'phel bzhin pas gos shing lus khrus ras dang bral ba grang ba dang rlung dang nyi ma dang skra 'bal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gzhir gyur pa rnams te
translated: The naked ascetics are covered with mud, like a swamp, because they are devoid of cleanliness and good conduct. They are without clothes, without towels for bathing, and without blankets for the cold, wind, and sun. They are the basis for the suffering of hair-pulling, etc.

original: / de rnams kyi lugs de ni mthong bas go bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: / de rnams kyi lugs de ni mthong bas go bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Their system is to be understood by seeing.

original: de'i phyir de rnams kyi chos ni mig gi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams kyi chos ni mig gi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, their religion is to be known by visual consciousness.

original: sh'akya dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med par lta ba'i nyi mas sems kyi rgyud snang bar byas shing dam pa ma yin pa'i lta ba ma lus pas 'thibs shing tshang tshing du gyur pa'i ma rig pa'i mun pa @193b bcom pa /
analyzed: sh'akya dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med par lta ba'i nyi mas sems kyi rgyud snang bar byas shing dam pa ma yin pa'i lta ba ma lus pas 'thibs shing tshang tshing du gyur pa'i ma rig pa'i mun pa @193b bcom pa /
translated: The Sakya, by the sun of the view that all things are essenceless, illuminate the continuum of the mind and destroy the darkness of ignorance, which is thick and pervasive with all kinds of bad views.

original: 'dus byas rmi lam dang mig 'phrul dang sgyu ma'i na chung dang gzugs brnyan dang sprul pa dang mtshungs par mthong ba /
analyzed: 'dus byas rmi lam dang mig 'phrul dang sgyu ma'i na chung dang gzugs brnyan dang sprul pa dang mtshungs par mthong ba /
translated: They see compounded phenomena as being like a dream, an optical illusion, a magical creation, a young girl in a magical creation, a reflection, and an emanation.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma ma lus pa bsal bas sems kyi rgyud dri ma med par gyur pa rnams ni de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa dag kho nas nges par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma ma lus pa bsal bas sems kyi rgyud dri ma med par gyur pa rnams ni de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa dag kho nas nges par bya ba yin te /
translated: Those whose mental continuum has become stainless by the removal of all the stains of the afflictions are to be definitely instructed by means of meditative equipoise alone.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi dge ba'i bsam pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas go bar bya ba yin pas thub pa'i gzhung lugs phra ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi dge ba'i bsam pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas go bar bya ba yin pas thub pa'i gzhung lugs phra ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, their virtuous intention is to be understood by means of mental consciousness, and thus the scriptural tradition of the Sage is subtle.

original: de'i phyir ma nges pas bsod nams 'dod kyang skye bo bde bar gshegs pa'i chos la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma nges pas bsod nams 'dod kyang skye bo bde bar gshegs pa'i chos la mi 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, because it is uncertain, even though one desires merit, one does not engage in the Sugata‚Äôs Dharma.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:üîΩIf you engage in this system of the Sage by relying on the world, which has coarse intelligence, then you should also practice in accordance with the world in this system.

original: gal te blo rags pa'i phyir 'jig rten phyi rol pa la brten nas 'jug na 'o na 'dir yang de ltar rjes su sgrub par gyis shig / phyi rol pa'i bya ba rjes su mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gal te blo rags pa'i phyir 'jig rten phyi rol pa la brten nas 'jug na 'o na 'dir yang de ltar rjes su sgrub par gyis shig / phyi rol pa'i bya ba rjes su mi 'grub ste /
translated: The activity of the non-Buddhist is not established.

original: 'di ltar / ji ltar bram ze rnams la chos //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ji ltar bram ze rnams la chos //
translated: The Dharma of the Brahmins

original: phal cher phyi 'chos brjod pa ltar //
analyzed: phal cher phyi 'chos brjod pa ltar //
translated: is mostly a matter of external purification.

original: de bzhin gcer bu rnams la chos //
analyzed: de bzhin gcer bu rnams la chos //
translated: The Dharma of the Nirgranthas

original: phal cher blun pa brjod pa yin //
analyzed: phal cher blun pa brjod pa yin //
translated: is mostly a matter of foolishness.

original: bram ze rnams ni bzlas brjod dang sbyin sreg dang / bkra shis dang / 'gyod tshangs la sogs pa'i bya ba dag gis gzhan dag las rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la sogs pa 'dod pas phyi 'chos par 'dod do //
analyzed: bram ze rnams ni bzlas brjod dang sbyin sreg dang / bkra shis dang / 'gyod tshangs la sogs pa'i bya ba dag gis gzhan dag las rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la sogs pa 'dod pas phyi 'chos par 'dod do //
translated: The Brahmins desire external purification because they desire to obtain gifts, honors, etc. from others by means of their rites of recitation, burnt offerings, benedictions, expiation of sins, etc.

original: de dag gi chos ni phal cher phyi 'chos pa zhig ste /
analyzed: de dag gi chos ni phal cher phyi 'chos pa zhig ste /
translated: Their Dharma is mostly a matter of external purification.

original: phyi 'chos gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi 'chos gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that external purification is the most important thing.

original: chos 'di ni thar pa 'dod pa rnams la 'gal ba yin te //
analyzed: chos 'di ni thar pa 'dod pa rnams la 'gal ba yin te //
translated: This Dharma is contrary to those who desire liberation,

original: 'khor ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir la //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir la //
translated: because it is in conformity with cyclic existence.

original: ba gsag gis rjes su rig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mngon par 'phel ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sh'akya pa rnams la ma bstan to //
analyzed: ba gsag gis rjes su rig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mngon par 'phel ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sh'akya pa rnams la ma bstan to //
translated: It was not taught to the ≈öƒÅkyas, because it is the cause of the increase of the secondary mental afflictions, which have the nature of the accumulation of karma.

original: ji ltar thar pa'i bar du gcod par byed pa'i phyir bram ze rnams kyi chos phyi 'chos phal che ba thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis spyad par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du gcer bu rnams kyi chos sems blun pa nyid du byed pa'i rgyu yang
analyzed: ji ltar thar pa'i bar du gcod par byed pa'i phyir bram ze rnams kyi chos phyi 'chos phal che ba thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis spyad par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du gcer bu rnams kyi chos sems blun pa nyid du byed pa'i rgyu yang
translated: Just as the Brahmins‚Äô Dharma of external purification is not to be practiced by those who desire liberation because it obstructs liberation, in the same way, the Dharma of the Nirgranthas, which is the cause of making the mind stupid,

original: blun pa phal che ba'i phyir spyad par bya ba ma yin pas de ltar nye bar bstan pa rjes su mi sgrub po //
analyzed: blun pa phal che ba'i phyir spyad par bya ba ma yin pas de ltar nye bar bstan pa rjes su mi sgrub po //
translated: is not to be practiced because it is mostly stupid. Thus, they do not practice what they teach.

original: gang gi phyir bram ze 'di rnams kyi chos phyi 'chos phal che ba de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten phal cher /üîΩji ltar rig pa blangs pa las //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bram ze 'di rnams kyi chos phyi 'chos phal che ba de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten phal cher / ji ltar rig pa blangs pa las //
translated: Because the Brahmins‚Äô Dharma of external purification is mostly that, the world mostlyüîΩtakes up the Dharma of the Nirgranthas.üîΩJust as respect for the Brahmins

original: bram ze gus pa skye ba ltar //
analyzed: bram ze gus pa skye ba ltar //
translated: arises from taking up the Vedas,

original: de bzhin @194a * //üîΩnyon mongs blangs pa las //
analyzed: de bzhin @194a * // nyon mongs blangs pa las //
translated: in the same way,

original: gcer bu pa la brtse bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gcer bu pa la brtse bar 'gyur //
translated: compassion for the Nirgranthas arises from taking up the afflictions.

original: ji ltar 'don par byed pa tsam gyis sems rangs par gyur pa'i 'jig rten ni rig pa blangs pa las bram ze rnams la gus pa skye ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa blangs ba las te mgo 'bal pa la sogs pa lus yongs su dub pa rnams
analyzed: ji ltar 'don par byed pa tsam gyis sems rangs par gyur pa'i 'jig rten ni rig pa blangs pa las bram ze rnams la gus pa skye ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa blangs ba las te mgo 'bal pa la sogs pa lus yongs su dub pa rnams
translated: Just as the world is pleased by merely reciting the Vedas, and respect for Brahmins arises from the Vedas, in the same way, compassion arises for those who are naked from taking up the afflictions, from the exhaustion of the body through shaving the head and so on.

original: las gos med pa rnams la brtse ba skye'o //üîΩ'di rnams kyi lus yongs su nyon mongs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba ni chos kyi ched du 'gyur ba 'di ni mi srid de nyes pa spyad pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: las gos med pa rnams la brtse ba skye'o // 'di rnams kyi lus yongs su nyon mongs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba ni chos kyi ched du 'gyur ba 'di ni mi srid de nyes pa spyad pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: Compassion arises for those who are naked from taking up the afflictions, from the exhaustion of the body through shaving the head and so on.

original: sdug bsngal las kyi rnam smin phyir //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las kyi rnam smin phyir //
translated: To demonstrate that the experience of the suffering of physical affliction for these people is for the sake of the Dharma, because it is the result of the practice of faults, he says:

original: ji ltar chos su mi 'gyur ba //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar chos su mi 'gyur ba //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
translated: How can it be for the sake of the DharmaüîΩwhen suffering is the result of karma?

original: ji ltar sgren mos rgyu ba rnams kyi 'di ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba yang dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal gyi nyams su myong ba bzhin chos kyi ched du mi 'gyur ba ltar bram ze rnams kyi yang /üîΩde bzhin skye ba las kyi ni //
analyzed: ji ltar sgren mos rgyu ba rnams kyi 'di ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba yang dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal gyi nyams su myong ba bzhin chos kyi ched du mi 'gyur ba ltar bram ze rnams kyi yang / de bzhin skye ba las kyi ni //
translated: Just as those who go naked experience the suffering of cold, but not the suffering of the hells, likewise, the suffering of the brahmans is not the suffering of the hells.

original: rnam smin phyir na chos ma yin //
analyzed: rnam smin phyir na chos ma yin //
translated: Birth is not Dharma because

original: gal te las kyi rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te las kyi rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: it is the maturation of karma.

original: mig la sogs pa ltar sdug bsngal dang skye bo chos su mi 'gyur na 'o na chos gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ltar sdug bsngal dang skye bo chos su mi 'gyur na 'o na chos gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: If birth is not Dharma, like eyes, etc., because it is the maturation of karma, then what is Dharma?

original: bshad par bya ste /üîΩchos ni mdor na mi 'tshe bar //
analyzed: bshad par bya ste / chos ni mdor na mi 'tshe bar //
translated: We reply:üîΩThe TathƒÅgatas have said that Dharma

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs //
translated: in brief is nonviolence.

original: 'tshe ba ni gzhan la gnod par zhugs pa'i phyir sems can la gnod pa'i bsam pa dang / des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las yin la /
analyzed: 'tshe ba ni gzhan la gnod par zhugs pa'i phyir sems can la gnod pa'i bsam pa dang / des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las yin la /
translated: Violence is the intention to harm sentient beings and the physical and verbal karma motivated by that intention, because it is the entryway to harming others.

original: mi 'tshe ba ni de las bzlog pa'i sgo nas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mo //
analyzed: mi 'tshe ba ni de las bzlog pa'i sgo nas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mo //
translated: Nonviolence is the ten virtuous karmic paths that are the opposite of that.

original: gang yang cung zad gzhan la phan 'dogs pa de thams cad kyang mi 'tshe ba'i khongs su 'du ba yin no //
analyzed: gang yang cung zad gzhan la phan 'dogs pa de thams cad kyang mi 'tshe ba'i khongs su 'du ba yin no //
translated: And whatever little benefit there is for others, all of that is included in non-violence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos ni mdor bsdu na mi 'tshe ba de nyid yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos ni mdor bsdu na mi 'tshe ba de nyid yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: In brief, the Dharma of the Tathagatas is just that non-violence.

original: stong nyid mya ngan 'das par te //
analyzed: stong nyid mya ngan 'das par te //
translated: Emptiness is nirvana.

original: 'dir ni de gnyis 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: 'dir ni de gnyis 'ba' zhig go //
translated: Here, just those two.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid du gang bshad pa de nyid sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mya ngan las 'das par gsungs so /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid du gang bshad pa de nyid sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mya ngan las 'das par gsungs so /
translated: That which was explained as the emptiness of intrinsic nature, that the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, taught as nirvana.

original: sdug bsngal phung po lnga'i rang bzhin can gtan nye bar zhi ba gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal phung po lnga'i rang bzhin can gtan nye bar zhi ba gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: Nirvana is the complete pacification of the suffering that has the nature of the five aggregates.

original: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par mthong @194b ba'i dus su yang sdug bsngal rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par khong du chud pas phyin ci log zad pa yin dang de slar yang rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur bas yongs su brtag pa mi srid pa'i phyir sdug bsngal 'gags
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par mthong @194b ba'i dus su yang sdug bsngal rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par khong du chud pas phyin ci log zad pa yin dang de slar yang rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur bas yongs su brtag pa mi srid pa'i phyir sdug bsngal 'gags
translated: Since it is impossible for it to be otherwise, suffering ceases.

original: pa kho na'o snyam du dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du mthong ba nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bor slar mi skye bas mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bya bar
analyzed: pa kho na'o snyam du dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du mthong ba nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bor slar mi skye bas mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bya bar
translated: Thus, the TathƒÅgata said that seeing that things are empty of intrinsic existence is nirvana, but he did not say that nirvana is the nonarising of the essence of things.

original: ni ma yin te rang bzhin la ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni ma yin te rang bzhin la ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because essence cannot be reversed.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa mthong ba kho na mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa mthong ba kho na mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, seeing that things are not intrinsically produced is itself nirvana.

original: mi 'tshe ba dang stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni mtho ris dang byang grol thob par byed pa ste de'i phyir 'dir ni de gnyis 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: mi 'tshe ba dang stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni mtho ris dang byang grol thob par byed pa ste de'i phyir 'dir ni de gnyis 'ba' zhig go //
translated: These two dharmas, nonviolence and emptiness, are the means of attaining heaven and liberation. Therefore, these two alone are taught here.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Alone‚Äù means pure.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'di kho nar 'di gnyis ches yongs su dag par dmigs kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid la mtho ris dang byang grol gyi bde ba yang dag par skyed par 'dod pas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'di kho nar 'di gnyis ches yongs su dag par dmigs kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid la mtho ris dang byang grol gyi bde ba yang dag par skyed par 'dod pas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that these two are observed to be pure only in this teaching of the TathƒÅgata, not elsewhere. One who desires to generate the happiness of heaven and liberation in oneself and others should understand this.

original: yang ci'i phyir phyi rol pa 'di dag bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'di mthong bzhin du yang chos gnyis po 'di la mi gus she na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir phyi rol pa 'di dag bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'di mthong bzhin du yang chos gnyis po 'di la mi gus she na /
translated: Why do these non-Buddhists not respect these two dharmas, even though they see this teaching of the Sugata?

original: rang gi phyogs la chags pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar / rang phyogs 'jig rten thams cad la //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs la chags pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar / rang phyogs 'jig rten thams cad la //
translated: Because they are attached to their own position.üîΩThus:üîΩIf one‚Äôs own position is as dear to all the world

original: skye sa bzhin du sdug 'gyur na //
analyzed: skye sa bzhin du sdug 'gyur na //
translated: as one‚Äôs own birthplace,

original: de yi ldog par byed pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: de yi ldog par byed pa'i rgyu //
translated: What is the cause that turns you away from it?

original: khyod la gang gis sdug par 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod la gang gis sdug par 'gyur //
translated: What is it that you like about it?

original: rang gi phyogs la chags pa ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas goms pa zhig ste /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs la chags pa ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas goms pa zhig ste /
translated: Attachment to one‚Äôs own position is something that has been cultivated since beginningless cyclic existence.

original: rang gi skye ba'i gnas ltar 'jig rten gyis de yongs su gtang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: rang gi skye ba'i gnas ltar 'jig rten gyis de yongs su gtang bar mi nus te /
translated: Just like one‚Äôs birthplace, the world cannot give it up.

original: de'i phyir rang gi lta ba la mngon par zhen pas byis pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'di la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi lta ba la mngon par zhen pas byis pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'di la mi 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, because of their attachment to their own views, the childish do not enter into this teaching of the TathƒÅgata.

original: mkhas pas rang skye ba'i sa yin yang brgyud pa'i rgyur gyur pa la re ba spangs nas 'byor pa byed pa'i yul la brten par rigs la /
analyzed: mkhas pas rang skye ba'i sa yin yang brgyud pa'i rgyur gyur pa la re ba spangs nas 'byor pa byed pa'i yul la brten par rigs la /
translated: The wise, even if they are in their own country, should give up hope for a lineage and rely on a place that is conducive to prosperity.

original: 'di ji ltar yin pa de ltar rang gi phyogs la chags pa spangs nas gzhan gyi phyogs yin yang yon tan dang ldan pa la yid gzhug par @195a * //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar yin pa de ltar rang gi phyogs la chags pa spangs nas gzhan gyi phyogs yin yang yon tan dang ldan pa la yid gzhug par @195a * //
translated: Just as it is, they should give up attachment to their own position and, even if it is the position of others, they should focus their mind on those who have good qualities.

original: bya'o ; / de'i phyir de ltar phyogs su ltung ba med par gyur pas /
analyzed: bya'o ; / de'i phyir de ltar phyogs su ltung ba med par gyur pas /
translated: Therefore, in this way, those who are free from falling into positions

original: rigs pa'i don ni gzhan las kyang //
analyzed: rigs pa'i don ni gzhan las kyang //
translated: should understand the meaning of the scriptures

original: blo ldan legs pa 'dod pas blang //üîΩnyi ma sa stengs mig ldan la //
analyzed: blo ldan legs pa 'dod pas blang // nyi ma sa stengs mig ldan la //
translated: The wise who desire what is good should take it up.

original: kun gyi spyi mthun ma yin nam //
analyzed: kun gyi spyi mthun ma yin nam //
translated: Is not the sun common to all who have eyes on the earth?

original: blo gros dang ldan pa bdag nyid kyi yin pa lta bur sems pas gang la lar legs par bshad pa dmigs pa de de las blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: blo gros dang ldan pa bdag nyid kyi yin pa lta bur sems pas gang la lar legs par bshad pa dmigs pa de de las blang bar bya'o //
translated: The wise think that it is their own. Therefore, one should take up the good advice that is found anywhere.

original: chos 'di 'ga' zhig tu phrag dog gis gnas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos 'di 'ga' zhig tu phrag dog gis gnas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This Dharma is not held back by anyone out of jealousy,

original: thams cad du ngo bo mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du ngo bo mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the same for all.

original: dper na thams cad la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //üîΩnyi ma snang ba'i bya ba la mig dang ldan pa thams cad la thun mong ba yin pa de bzhin du chos 'di yang gal te bsgrubs pas rdzogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dper na thams cad la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro // nyi ma snang ba'i bya ba la mig dang ldan pa thams cad la thun mong ba yin pa de bzhin du chos 'di yang gal te bsgrubs pas rdzogs par 'gyur na /
translated: For example, the sun is common to all, because it is free of attachment and aversion.üîΩIf this Dharma is accomplished, it is helpful to all, to one‚Äôs own group and to others,

original: rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyi sde pa thams cad la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyi sde pa thams cad la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: just as the sun is common to all who have eyes, in the activity of illumination.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rig par byas nas gus ba dang ldan pas chos 'di bdag tu bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rig par byas nas gus ba dang ldan pas chos 'di bdag tu bya bar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, having understood it in this way, it is proper for the wise to take up this teaching with devotion.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bzhi brgya pa las lta bar byas pa dgag pa sgom pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bzhi brgya pa las lta bar byas pa dgag pa sgom pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the twelfth chapter, having thirty-two verses, called ‚Äúthe demonstration of the meditation that refutes the view.üîΩ‚Äù
Here,üîΩit was said:

original: rigs pa'i don ni gzhan las kyang //
analyzed: rigs pa'i don ni gzhan las kyang //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúreason‚Äù is also accepted

original: blo ldan legs par 'dod pas blang //üîΩzhes gang smras na /
analyzed: blo ldan legs par 'dod pas blang // zhes gang smras na /
translated: by the wise, who desire the good.

original: gang zhig blo dang ldan pas blang bar bya ba rigs pa'i don de yang gang zhig yin zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: gang zhig blo dang ldan pas blang bar bya ba rigs pa'i don de yang gang zhig yin zhes 'dzer to //
translated: Someone asks, ‚ÄúWhat is that meaning of ‚Äòreason‚Äô which the wise should accept?‚Äù

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad rang bzhin gyis bdag med par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad rang bzhin gyis bdag med par mthong ba'o //
translated: It is the vision that all outer and inner things are essentially selfless.

original: gal te dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid rtogs par mi nus te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid rtogs par mi nus te /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúThis statement ‚Äòall things are essenceless‚Äô cannot be understood,‚Äù

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i bong bu'i rva la sogs pa la ni mngon sum nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i bong bu'i rva la sogs pa la ni mngon sum nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the horns of a rabbit and so on, which do not exist, are not directly perceived.

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnams dang sngon po la sogs pa rnams ni mngon sum yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnams dang sngon po la sogs pa rnams ni mngon sum yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: But pots and so on and blue and so on are directly perceived.

original: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad rang bzhin dang bcas par yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad rang bzhin dang bcas par yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, all things such as pots exist only as having intrinsic nature.

original: 'di ni mi rigs te 'di ltar /üîΩgzugs mthong tshe na bum pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs te 'di ltar / gzugs mthong tshe na bum pa ni //
translated: This is not correct.

original: thams cad kho na mthong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad kho na mthong mi 'gyur //
translated: When one sees form, one does not see the pot at all.

original: bum pa mngon sum zhes bya @195b ba'ang //
analyzed: bum pa mngon sum zhes bya @195b ba'ang //
translated: And who would say that the pot is directly perceived

original: de nyid rig pa su zhig smra //
analyzed: de nyid rig pa su zhig smra //
translated: By one who knows reality?üîΩBy the word ‚Äúalso,‚Äù one should understand that the pot‚Äôs appropriated parts, such as blue, are also directly perceived.

original: 'ang gi sgras ni de'i nye bar len pa sngon po la sogs pa dag kyang mngon sum yin no zhes de kho na nyid shes pa su zhig smra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgras ni de'i nye bar len pa sngon po la sogs pa dag kyang mngon sum yin no zhes de kho na nyid shes pa su zhig smra bar 'gyur //
translated: But who would say that the pot is directly perceived by one who knows reality?

original: de la kha cig dag gis ni bum pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gsum yongs su 'gyur ba'i ngo bor rtogs la /
analyzed: de la kha cig dag gis ni bum pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gsum yongs su 'gyur ba'i ngo bor rtogs la /
translated: Some say that the pot is the nature of the transformation of the three properties.

original: yang gzhan dag gis ni bum pa zhes bya ba yan lag can gyi rdzas yan lag las tha dad pa mthong ba dang / reg pa'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin par rtogs te /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag gis ni bum pa zhes bya ba yan lag can gyi rdzas yan lag las tha dad pa mthong ba dang / reg pa'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin par rtogs te /
translated: Also, others see a vase, a substance that is an integral whole, as different from its parts, and they understand it to be something apprehended by the faculties of sight and touch.

original: de dag gi yang /üîΩdngos po rtag pa las skyes pa //
analyzed: de dag gi yang / dngos po rtag pa las skyes pa //
translated: For them, the following is refuted:üîΩHow could something impermanent

original: ji lta bur na mi rtag 'gyur //üîΩnam yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis //
analyzed: ji lta bur na mi rtag 'gyur // nam yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis //
translated: arise from a permanent thing?üîΩThe cause and effect are never seen

original: mtshan nyid mi ldan mthong ma yin //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi ldan mthong ma yin //
translated: to be devoid of their characteristics.

original: zhes bkag pa'i phyir bum pa nyid yod pa ma yin pas de'i mngon sum nyid ga la yod /
analyzed: zhes bkag pa'i phyir bum pa nyid yod pa ma yin pas de'i mngon sum nyid ga la yod /
translated: Therefore, since the vase itself does not exist, how could there be direct perception of it?

original: gal te de ltar mi srid na 'o na ji ltar bum pa 'di rnam par gzhag par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar mi srid na 'o na ji ltar bum pa 'di rnam par gzhag par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: If it is impossible in that way, then how should it be understood that this vase is posited?

original: de bshad par bya ste /üîΩ'byung ba chen po bzhi dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bzhi ste /
analyzed: de bshad par bya ste / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bzhi ste /
translated: That will be explained.

original: rdzas brgyad pa de dag la brten nas bum pa 'dogs te /
analyzed: rdzas brgyad pa de dag la brten nas bum pa 'dogs te /
translated: The vase is imputed in dependence on the four great elements and the four types of derivative form.

original: ji ltar bud shing la brten nas me dang / rtsva dang shing la sogs pa la brten nas khyim dang phung po dag la brten nas bdag tu 'dogs la ;üîΩde yang rang gi rgyu las rnam pa lngas btsal na ma dmigs pa de bzhin du rang gi rgyu la brten nas sbrang rtsi dang chu dang 'o ma 'chu zhing 'dzin par nus pa mthong ba'i dbang pos go bar bya ba yin pas 'jig rten gyi mngon sum
analyzed: ji ltar bud shing la brten nas me dang / rtsva dang shing la sogs pa la brten nas khyim dang phung po dag la brten nas bdag tu 'dogs la ; de yang rang gi rgyu las rnam pa lngas btsal na ma dmigs pa de bzhin du rang gi rgyu la brten nas sbrang rtsi dang chu dang 'o ma 'chu zhing 'dzin par nus pa mthong ba'i dbang pos go bar bya ba yin pas 'jig rten gyi mngon sum
translated: Just as fire is imputed in dependence on fuel, a house is imputed in dependence on grass, wood, and so on, and the self is imputed in dependence on the aggregates,

original: du gyur pa'i bum pa nye bar len pa po nyid du rnam par gzhag gi ji skad bshad pa'i brten nas brtags pa 'di khas ma blangs par rtag pa gzhan gyis bum pa rnam par gzhag par nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: du gyur pa'i bum pa nye bar len pa po nyid du rnam par gzhag gi ji skad bshad pa'i brten nas brtags pa 'di khas ma blangs par rtag pa gzhan gyis bum pa rnam par gzhag par nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: in the same way, when the five types of causes are sought, the self is not observed. In the same way, in dependence on its own causes, honey, water, and milk are seen to be able to be drunk and held by the sense faculty of sight. Therefore the pot is posited as the appropriator by the direct perception of the world. But without accepting this dependent imputation as it has been explained, it is not possible to posit the pot by means of some other permanent entity.

original: gang zhig gzugs la sogs pa las ma gtogs par bum pa gzhan du ma dmigs pa'i phyir gnas skabs de lta bu'i gzugs la sogs pa dag kho na la bum pa'i blor 'gyur gyi bum pa zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs la sogs pa las ma gtogs par bum pa gzhan du ma dmigs pa'i phyir gnas skabs de lta bu'i gzugs la sogs pa dag kho na la bum pa'i blor 'gyur gyi bum pa zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no
translated: Because a vase is not observed to be different from form and so on, the cognition of vase arises in relation to form and so on that exist in that way. But a thing called vase does not exist.

original: snyam du sems pa de ltar rgol ba de'i ltar na rtag tu 'bar ba nyid la sogs pa'i nyes bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bud shing las ma gtogs par las @196a * //
analyzed: snyam du sems pa de ltar rgol ba de'i ltar na rtag tu 'bar ba nyid la sogs pa'i nyes bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bud shing las ma gtogs par las @196a * //
translated: If you argue in that way, it would follow that fire would be constantly burning and so on.

original: med par gyur pa'i me'i yod pa nyid med pas de yang blos yongs su brtags pa tsam du 'gyur la /
analyzed: med par gyur pa'i me'i yod pa nyid med pas de yang blos yongs su brtags pa tsam du 'gyur la /
translated: Because fire would not exist without fuel, it would also be a mere imputation by the mind.

original: de bzhin du 'byung ba rnams dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams phan tshun med par 'byung bar ma grub pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin du blos brtags pa tsam nyid du 'gyur zhing rang gi ngo bos 'grub par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'byung ba rnams dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams phan tshun med par 'byung bar ma grub pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin du blos brtags pa tsam nyid du 'gyur zhing rang gi ngo bos 'grub par mi 'gyur na /
translated: Likewise, because it is not established that the primary elements, the mind and mental factors arise without each other, like a vase, they would be mere imputations by the mind and would not be established by their own nature.

original: 'di ni de ltar 'dis khas blangs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar 'dis khas blangs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But this is not what you accept.

original: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa rnams sems dang sems las byung ba lta bu dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am brten nas brtags par ci ste khas mi len te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa rnams sems dang sems las byung ba lta bu dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am brten nas brtags par ci ste khas mi len te /
translated: Therefore, why do you not accept that such things as pots are dependent-arisings or are imputed in dependence on the primary elements, just as minds and mental factors are?üîΩThus, a pot, which is the appropriator of eight substances, becomes the appropriator of its own appropriated parts, and the activity of appropriating is the activity of the world.

original: de'i phyir bum pa rdzas brgyad kyi nye bar len pa can rang gi nye bar blangs pa'i nye bar len pa por gyur cing nye bar len pa'i bya ba byed pa po 'jig rten gyi mngon sum du gyur pa'i yan lag can de ltar rnam par gnas pa
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa rdzas brgyad kyi nye bar len pa can rang gi nye bar blangs pa'i nye bar len pa por gyur cing nye bar len pa'i bya ba byed pa po 'jig rten gyi mngon sum du gyur pa'i yan lag can de ltar rnam par gnas pa
translated: This is the position.

original: yin dang 'di rnam par dpyad de /
analyzed: yin dang 'di rnam par dpyad de /
translated: But this is analyzed as follows:

original: gzugs mthong tshe na bum pa ni //
analyzed: gzugs mthong tshe na bum pa ni //
translated: When you see a form,

original: thams cad kho na mthong mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad kho na mthong mi 'gyur te /
translated: you do not see the pot at all.

original: bum pa rdzas brgyad kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa rdzas brgyad kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the pot has the nature of eight substances.

original: mig gis ni gzugs gcig pu mthong gi dri la sogs pa dag ni ma yin te yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mig gis ni gzugs gcig pu mthong gi dri la sogs pa dag ni ma yin te yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The eye sees only form, not smell and so on, because their objects are different.

original: / de'i phyir bum pa thams cad mig gis mi mthong ba'i phyir na dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo rnam par ma phye bas 'jig rten ci rung rung ltar rang gi rtog pa tshad mar byas nas bum pa dag gi mngon sum yin no zhes smra la rag
analyzed: / de'i phyir bum pa thams cad mig gis mi mthong ba'i phyir na dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo rnam par ma phye bas 'jig rten ci rung rung ltar rang gi rtog pa tshad mar byas nas bum pa dag gi mngon sum yin no zhes smra la rag
translated: Therefore, since the eye does not see the whole vase, the world is as it is, without distinguishing the nature of things.

original: mod / gang zhig rnam par 'byed par byed cing dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo la mkhas pa gang phyogs gcig mthong bas ri la mthong bar srid par mi byed pa de ni bum pa mngon sum mo zhes bya ba rnam pa de lta bur smra bar mi 'os so
analyzed: mod / gang zhig rnam par 'byed par byed cing dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo la mkhas pa gang phyogs gcig mthong bas ri la mthong bar srid par mi byed pa de ni bum pa mngon sum mo zhes bya ba rnam pa de lta bur smra bar mi 'os so
translated: But it is not right to say that the vase is directly perceived by those who distinguish it and are skilled in the nature of things, for they do not think that the vase is directly perceived by seeing one part of it.

original: // 'di la rtog ge ba rnams na re bum pa la mngon sum nyid yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: // 'di la rtog ge ba rnams na re bum pa la mngon sum nyid yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: In this regard, logicians say that the vase does not exist as a direct perception at all.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni bstan du med pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni bstan du med pa yin la /
translated: The intrinsic characteristics of form and so on are not demonstrable.

original: mngon sum gyis bsnyad par bya ba'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir mngon sum zhes bya bar 'dogs so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis bsnyad par bya ba'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir mngon sum zhes bya bar 'dogs so //
translated: It is called ‚Äúperception‚Äù because it is the object of the eye consciousness, etc., which are called ‚Äúperception.‚Äù

original: bum pa ni blos yongs su brtags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir rang gi @196b mtshan nyid du yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bum pa ni blos yongs su brtags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir rang gi @196b mtshan nyid du yod pa ma yin la /
translated: But a pot does not exist by intrinsic identity because it is a mere conceptual labeling by the intellect.

original: gang la rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa de la ni dngos kyi gnas pas mngon sum nyid mi srid pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi de la btags pa'i mngon sum nyid kyang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang la rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa de la ni dngos kyi gnas pas mngon sum nyid mi srid pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi de la btags pa'i mngon sum nyid kyang mi rung ngo //
translated: And not only is it impossible for it to be perception by direct experience because it does not exist by intrinsic identity, but also it is impossible for it to be perception by imputation.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum nyid 'gog pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir sgra la mig gis gzung bar bya ba 'gog pa ltar bum pa 'di la yang 'gog pa'i rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum nyid 'gog pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir sgra la mig gis gzung bar bya ba 'gog pa ltar bum pa 'di la yang 'gog pa'i rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since the refutation of perception is pointless, it is not right to refute the pot in the same way that one refutes the eye‚Äôs apprehension of sound.

original: rtog ge pa 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i don dag la gtan ma byang ba'i phyir byis pa gzhon nu ltar je dang po kho na nas sbyang bar gyur pa yin pas de bstan par bya ba'i phyir khyod kyi mngon sum gang zhig yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par
analyzed: rtog ge pa 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i don dag la gtan ma byang ba'i phyir byis pa gzhon nu ltar je dang po kho na nas sbyang bar gyur pa yin pas de bstan par bya ba'i phyir khyod kyi mngon sum gang zhig yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par
translated: Because this logician is completely unpracticed in worldly matters, he is like a young child who must be taught from the very beginning. Therefore, in order to teach him, we should question and examine him: ‚ÄúWhat is your perception?‚Äù

original: bya'o // smras pa shes pa mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: bya'o // smras pa shes pa mngon sum yin no //
translated: He will say, ‚ÄúConsciousness is perception.‚ÄùüîΩWhat kind of consciousness?

original: shes pa ci 'dra ba zhig / gang rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa ci 'dra ba zhig / gang rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is free from conceptual thought.‚Äù

original: rtog pa yang ci zhig gang don la ming dang rigs su lhag par sgro 'dogs /
analyzed: rtog pa yang ci zhig gang don la ming dang rigs su lhag par sgro 'dogs /
translated: What is conceptual thought? ‚ÄúIt is the discrimination that engages in superimposing names and types onto objects.‚Äù

original: par zhugs pa'i 'du shes g-yer po ste de dang bral ba'i phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa lnga ni yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid brjod du med pa tsam zhig la 'jug pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi sgras brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: par zhugs pa'i 'du shes g-yer po ste de dang bral ba'i phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa lnga ni yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid brjod du med pa tsam zhig la 'jug pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi sgras brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the five sense consciousnesses are called perception because they engage only in the inexpressible intrinsic identity of their objects.

original: dbang po dang dbang po la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang dbang po la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called sense consciousnesses because they are based on the senses.

original: 'o na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gcig ji ltar mngon sum nyid yin /
analyzed: 'o na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gcig ji ltar mngon sum nyid yin /
translated: How can a single moment of sensory consciousness be direct perception?

original: de ni dbang po dang dbang po la brten nas 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni dbang po dang dbang po la brten nas 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not a support for the sense faculty, nor does it engage in relation to a sense faculty,

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i skad cig dag skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i skad cig dag skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not shared in common and because the sense faculty and the moment of consciousness are destroyed as soon as they are produced.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni bsags pa'i rten dang dmigs pa can yin pas dbang po'i rdul phra rab dang yul gyi rdul phra rab re re zhing rten nyid dam dmigs pa nyid du rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni bsags pa'i rten dang dmigs pa can yin pas dbang po'i rdul phra rab dang yul gyi rdul phra rab re re zhing rten nyid dam dmigs pa nyid du rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The five collections of sensory consciousness are supported on and focus on a collection of atoms, and therefore the atoms of the sense faculty and the atoms of the object are not individually its support or its focus.

original: rab rib can gyis skra shad re re logs su ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab rib can gyis skra shad re re logs su ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because a person with blurred vision does not see individual strands of hair.

original: tshogs pa'i nang na gnas pa re re yang rgyu'i dngos po yin pa ltar mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab tshogs pa rnams ni re re zhing rgyu nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i nang na gnas pa re re yang rgyu'i dngos po yin pa ltar mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab tshogs pa rnams ni re re zhing rgyu nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: Just as each of the atoms that exist in a collection is a cause, so too the collection of atoms of the eye faculty, etc., is a cause for each moment of sensory consciousness.

original: dpe mi mthun pa zhig ste /
analyzed: dpe mi mthun pa zhig ste /
