translated: This is an inconsistent example.

original: rab rib med pas skra re re nas mthong ba'i phyir mig la gnod pa yod na mi mthong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: rab rib med pas skra re re nas mthong ba'i phyir mig la gnod pa yod na mi mthong bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the eye is impaired, one does not see the individual hairs because one without myodesopsia sees each hair.

original: dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams la @197a * //
analyzed: dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams la @197a * //
translated: But in the case of the minute particles of the sense faculty,

original: ni tshogs pa'i gnas skabs las phyi rol tu rdul phra rab re re rang gi rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid du ma mthong bas tshogs pa la gnas pa rnams la re re rten nyid du brtags pa 'di mi rigs so //
analyzed: ni tshogs pa'i gnas skabs las phyi rol tu rdul phra rab re re rang gi rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid du ma mthong bas tshogs pa la gnas pa rnams la re re rten nyid du brtags pa 'di mi rigs so //
translated: one does not see each minute particle as the basis of its own consciousness apart from the state of aggregation. Therefore it is illogical to impute that each particle is the basis of consciousness while they are aggregated.

original: bye ba la nus pa cung zad tsam zhig ma dmigs nas tshogs pa la gnas pa la yang de dang mthun par brtag par ni rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bye ba la nus pa cung zad tsam zhig ma dmigs nas tshogs pa la gnas pa la yang de dang mthun par brtag par ni rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not observe the slightest capacity in the individual particles, it is logical to impute that capacity in the aggregation.

original: 'di ltar rtsa gcig la sha sbrang dang sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa'i rkang pa 'ching ba'i nus pa dmigs nas de dag gi tshogs pa la glang po che 'ching ba'i nus pa'i bar srid la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtsa gcig la sha sbrang dang sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa'i rkang pa 'ching ba'i nus pa dmigs nas de dag gi tshogs pa la glang po che 'ching ba'i nus pa'i bar srid la /
translated: Thus, one observes the capacity of a single hair to bind the legs of flies, mosquitoes and so on and one infers that the aggregation of such hairs has the capacity to bind an elephant.

original: de bzhin du til rnams la re re la 'bru mar nyung zad tsam 'byin pa'i nus pa yod dang tshogs pa rnams la 'bru mar bum pa gang 'byin pa yang srid na tshogs pa la ma ltos pa'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams la ni de ltar re
analyzed: de bzhin du til rnams la re re la 'bru mar nyung zad tsam 'byin pa'i nus pa yod dang tshogs pa rnams la 'bru mar bum pa gang 'byin pa yang srid na tshogs pa la ma ltos pa'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams la ni de ltar re
translated: Likewise, if it is possible that each of the sesame seeds has the ability to produce a small amount of oil, and that the collection of them can produce a full vase of oil, then the atoms of the sense faculties, which do not rely on a collection, would also be able to produce a full vase of oil.

original: re rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid du yod pa ma yin pas rdul phra rab la ltos nas kyang gnod pa mi srid do //
analyzed: re rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid du yod pa ma yin pas rdul phra rab la ltos nas kyang gnod pa mi srid do //
translated: But this is not the case. Therefore, since each atom does not exist as the basis of consciousness, it is impossible for them to be harmed by relying on atoms.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i rdul phra rab la brten nas mig gi dbang po zhes bya ba rdul phra rab dag dang de nyid dang gzhan nyid rtogs pas stong pa rang gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa brten nas brtags par 'jig rten par gyur pa yul
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i rdul phra rab la brten nas mig gi dbang po zhes bya ba rdul phra rab dag dang de nyid dang gzhan nyid rtogs pas stong pa rang gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa brten nas brtags par 'jig rten par gyur pa yul
translated: Therefore, in dependence on the atoms of the sense faculty, the so-called eye sense faculty, which is empty of being the same as or different from those atoms, becomes the basis of its own consciousness. It is an imputation in dependence.

original: la lta ba'i bya ba can zhig yod pa yin la de yang skad cig ma nyid kyi phyir rang gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'gags pas gnod pa ga la srid /
analyzed: la lta ba'i bya ba can zhig yod pa yin la de yang skad cig ma nyid kyi phyir rang gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'gags pas gnod pa ga la srid /
translated: But since it is momentary, how could it be damaged, since it ceases together with its consciousness?

original: de'i phyir shes pa gang zhig dbang po dang dbang po la gnas pa de ni mngon sum mo zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa gang zhig dbang po dang dbang po la gnas pa de ni mngon sum mo zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to say that whatever consciousness is based on a sense faculty is direct perception.

original: ci ste rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa bdag nyid ji lta bu'i dbang po dag la gnas pa'i phyir de skad du bye brag tu bshad par 'gyur ro snyam na 'di yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa bdag nyid ji lta bu'i dbang po dag la gnas pa'i phyir de skad du bye brag tu bshad par 'gyur ro snyam na 'di yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if you think that it is explained in this way because the collection of consciousness is based on the sense faculties in such and such a way, this is also not possible.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: Why?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gcig la de ltar bye brag tu bshad pa mi srid pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gcig la de ltar bye brag tu bshad pa mi srid pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because such an explanation is impossible for a single moment of eye consciousness.

original: tshogs pa rdzas su med pa la yang dbang po la brten pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa rdzas su med pa la yang dbang po la brten pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because a collection that does not substantially exist cannot be based on a sense faculty.

original: brten nas brtags pas rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa mig gi dbang po rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: brten nas brtags pas rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa mig gi dbang po rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yang rig par bya ste /
translated: Just as the eye faculty is posited as the basis of consciousness, so too should the positing of form and so on be understood.

original: de dag kyang brten nas brtags @197b pa na rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang brten nas brtags @197b pa na rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For when they are posited as dependent imputations, they are the basis of consciousness.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa la mngon sum du rtogs pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa la mngon sum du rtogs pa mi rigs so //
translated: Thus it is not reasonable to understand consciousness as direct perception.

original: yul la ni rigs te /
analyzed: yul la ni rigs te /
translated: But it is reasonable for objects,

original: de la ni zla ba tshes pa la sogs pa la cig car rgyud du ma las skyes pa'i dbang po'i yul nyid mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la ni zla ba tshes pa la sogs pa la cig car rgyud du ma las skyes pa'i dbang po'i yul nyid mthong ngo //
translated: for in that case one sees the object of the sense faculties that arises simultaneously from many streams, such as the crescent moon and so on.

original: 'jig rten pa'i don la 'jig rten pa'i mthong ba spangs nas don gzhan la brten par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i don la 'jig rten pa'i mthong ba spangs nas don gzhan la brten par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to abandon worldly seeing of worldly objects and rely on another object.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten na yul kho na dngos kyi 'jug pas mngon sum yin la shes pa ni btags pa las so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten na yul kho na dngos kyi 'jug pas mngon sum yin la shes pa ni btags pa las so //
translated: Therefore in the world, only objects are direct perception because they engage directly. Consciousness is imputed to be direct perception.

original: gzhan gyi ltar na ni mngon sum gyi sgra shes pa dngos su yin la yul 'dir btags pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ltar na ni mngon sum gyi sgra shes pa dngos su yin la yul 'dir btags pa yin no //
translated: According to the other interpretation, the word ‚Äúperception‚Äù refers to the consciousness, and the word ‚Äúhere‚Äù refers to the object.

original: de ni 'jig rten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a worldly convention,

original: 'jig rten la de ltar kun tu tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten la de ltar kun tu tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no such usage in the world.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad gnas pa yin dang 'jig rten kho na las bum pa mngon sum mo zhes bya bar brjod par rigs kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad gnas pa yin dang 'jig rten kho na las bum pa mngon sum mo zhes bya bar brjod par rigs kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is proper to say that the pot is perceived only in the world, and that the worldly convention should be accepted just as it is.

original: rang bzhin tshol ba'i dus su de nyid rig pas de skad du smra bar 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin tshol ba'i dus su de nyid rig pas de skad du smra bar 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not proper to say this when one is seeking reality with the knowledge of reality,

original: bum pa'i rang gi ngo bo rnam pa thams cad du ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa'i rang gi ngo bo rnam pa thams cad du ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the pot is not perceived at all.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par shes pa las ni bum pa la yang mngon sum yin zhing gzugs la sogs pa dag kyang mngon sum yin la de'i nye bar len pa can rnams kyang mngon sum yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par shes pa las ni bum pa la yang mngon sum yin zhing gzugs la sogs pa dag kyang mngon sum yin la de'i nye bar len pa can rnams kyang mngon sum yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: But there is no fault in saying that the pot is perceived by the consciousness of the world, and that form, etc. are perceived by the consciousness of the world, and that the constituents of the pot are perceived by the consciousness of the world.

original: gang yang 'dis dbang po'i rnam par shes pa 'di mngon sum nyid du sgro btags nas gzhan tshad ma nyid du rtog par byed pa de yang ches shin tu ma 'brel ba zhig go //
analyzed: gang yang 'dis dbang po'i rnam par shes pa 'di mngon sum nyid du sgro btags nas gzhan tshad ma nyid du rtog par byed pa de yang ches shin tu ma 'brel ba zhig go //
translated: Moreover, it is quite unreasonable to impute to this sense consciousness the status of direct perception and then to consider it a valid cognition.

original: mi bslu ba'i shes pa ni 'jig rten na tshad ma nyid du mthong na rnam par shes pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir brdzun pa bslu ba'i chos can dang sgyu ma lta bur gsungs so //
analyzed: mi bslu ba'i shes pa ni 'jig rten na tshad ma nyid du mthong na rnam par shes pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir brdzun pa bslu ba'i chos can dang sgyu ma lta bur gsungs so //
translated: In the world, a nondeceptive consciousness is seen to be a valid cognition. But the Lord Buddha has said that consciousness is false and deceptive, like an illusion, because it is a conditioned phenomenon.

original: gang zhig brdzun pa bslu ba'i chos can dang sgyu ma lta bu yin pa de ni mi bslu ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig brdzun pa bslu ba'i chos can dang sgyu ma lta bu yin pa de ni mi bslu ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is false and deceptive, like an illusion, is not nondeceptive.

original: rnam pa gzhan du gnas pa'i dngos po la rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du gnas pa'i dngos po la rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it appears in one way while existing in another.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ni tshad ma nyid du brtag par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ni tshad ma nyid du brtag par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to consider such a consciousness to be a valid cognition,

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang tshad ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang tshad ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that all consciousnesses would be valid cognitions.

original: de'i phyir rtog ge ba 'di gal te rtog ge'i chang 'thungs pas myos pas smyos par ma gyur na ni rten cing @198a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog ge ba 'di gal te rtog ge'i chang 'thungs pas myos pas smyos par ma gyur na ni rten cing @198a * //
translated: Therefore, if this logician is not driven mad by the beer of logic, he will not go insane.üîΩ

original: 'brel par 'byung ba dang brten nas brtags pa zhes bya ba lam bzang po spangs nas mu stegs can gyi gzhung las bstan pa'i dngos po rnams gsal bar byed pa dam pa ma yin pa'i tshig 'khyal gyi tshogs ches brtol bar mi 'gyur ba zhig go //üîΩ'jig rten 'di yang phal cher ma'i bzhin ltar dpyod cing 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos po gnas pa la rnam par rmongs pa 'dis rang gi rtog pa tsam gyis sbyar zhing mtho ris dang thar ba'i lam la bar du gcod par byed pa shin
analyzed: 'brel par 'byung ba dang brten nas brtags pa zhes bya ba lam bzang po spangs nas mu stegs can gyi gzhung las bstan pa'i dngos po rnams gsal bar byed pa dam pa ma yin pa'i tshig 'khyal gyi tshogs ches brtol bar mi 'gyur ba zhig go // 'jig rten 'di yang phal cher ma'i bzhin ltar dpyod cing 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos po gnas pa la rnam par rmongs pa 'dis rang gi rtog pa tsam gyis sbyar zhing mtho ris dang thar ba'i lam la bar du gcod par byed pa shin
translated: Therefore, if this logician had not gone mad from drinking the beer of logic, he would not have abandoned the good path called ‚Äúdependent origination‚Äù and ‚Äúdependent designation‚Äù and would not have become so obsessed with the collection of nonsensical, inconsiderate words that clarify the things taught in the texts of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: tu don med par rtog ge ba'i lam la bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: tu don med par rtog ge ba'i lam la bkod pa yin no //
translated: This world, for the most part, is like a mother‚Äôs face: it is confused about the way things are in the world and beyond the world. This [logician] has created his own system through mere imagination, and he has placed [his followers] on the path of logic, which is utterly pointless and which creates obstacles on the path to the higher realms and liberation.

original: de'i phyir 'dir smyo chu 'thungs pa ltar don med pa'i ngag 'khyal las bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir smyo chu 'thungs pa ltar don med pa'i ngag 'khyal las bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, like one who has drunk a hallucinogenic potion, you are unable to stop your meaningless prattle.

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this elaboration!

original: bum pa mngon sum yin pa bsal ba 'dis ni mthong ba'i dbang po'i yul gyi dngos po thams cad mngon sum nyid yin pa bsal bar rig par bya'o ;üîΩ/ ji ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis bum pa la sogs pa rnams mngon sum nyid yin par mi rigs pa de ltar de las gzhan pa'i dbang pos yongs su gcad par bya ba brten nas gdags pa bsnam par bya ba dang myang bar bya ba dang
analyzed: bum pa mngon sum yin pa bsal ba 'dis ni mthong ba'i dbang po'i yul gyi dngos po thams cad mngon sum nyid yin pa bsal bar rig par bya'o ; / ji ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis bum pa la sogs pa rnams mngon sum nyid yin par mi rigs pa de ltar de las gzhan pa'i dbang pos yongs su gcad par bya ba brten nas gdags pa bsnam par bya ba dang myang bar bya ba dang
translated: By this refutation of the direct perception of a pot, you should understand that all things that are objects of the sense faculties of seeing and so on are refuted as being direct perception.

original: reg par bya ba rnams mngon sum nyid yin pa bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: reg par bya ba rnams mngon sum nyid yin pa bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Just as it is not tenable that pots and so on are direct perception in the way that has been explained, in the same way, in order to refute that the objects of the other sense faculties, such as smell, taste, and touch, which are also dependent imputations, are direct perception, it is said:

original: rnam par dpyad pa 'di nyid kyis //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa 'di nyid kyis //
translated: By this very same analysis,üîΩthose who possess the highest intelligence should refute

original: blo mchog ldan pas dri zhim dang // mngar dang 'jam pa thams cad dag / so sor dgag par bya ba yin //
analyzed: blo mchog ldan pas dri zhim dang // mngar dang 'jam pa thams cad dag / so sor dgag par bya ba yin //
translated: all that is sweet-smelling, sweet-tasting, and soft to the touch.

original: dri zhim zhes bya ba 'dis ni snas yongs su gcad par bya ba sna ma'i me tog dang padma dang autpa la dang tsandan la sogs pa sna'i dbang po'i yul mtha' dag nye bar mtshon par byed de /
analyzed: dri zhim zhes bya ba 'dis ni snas yongs su gcad par bya ba sna ma'i me tog dang padma dang autpa la dang tsandan la sogs pa sna'i dbang po'i yul mtha' dag nye bar mtshon par byed de /
translated: The term fragrant indicates all objects of the nose faculty, such as jasmine flowers, lotuses, utpala flowers, sandalwood, etc., which are discerned by the nose.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba med par mun khung du yang dri tsam 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin du mngar dang zhes bya ba 'dis kyang bu ram dang lan tshva dang nim pa la sogs pa lce'i dbang po'i yul thams cad nye bar mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba med par mun khung du yang dri tsam 'dzin pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du mngar dang zhes bya ba 'dis kyang bu ram dang lan tshva dang nim pa la sogs pa lce'i dbang po'i yul thams cad nye bar mtshon par byed do //
translated: Because one can smell fragrances in the dark without seeing forms, etc.üîΩSimilarly, the term sweet indicates all objects of the tongue faculty, such as molasses, salt, neem, etc.

original: 'jam pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni shing bal dang bye ma dang rdo ba la sogs pa lus kyi dbang po'i yul thams cad nye bar mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: 'jam pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni shing bal dang bye ma dang rdo ba la sogs pa lus kyi dbang po'i yul thams cad nye bar mtshon par byed do //
translated: The term smooth indicates all objects of the body faculty, such as cotton, sand, rocks, etc.

original: de dag kyang rdzas brgyad kyi nye bar len pa can yin pas bdag nyid ji lta ba'i dbang po dag gi yul re re @198b 'dzin pa yin dang rnam pa thams cad mi 'dzin pa'i phyir sna ma'i me tog dang bu ram dang shing bal la sogs pa
analyzed: de dag kyang rdzas brgyad kyi nye bar len pa can yin pas bdag nyid ji lta ba'i dbang po dag gi yul re re @198b 'dzin pa yin dang rnam pa thams cad mi 'dzin pa'i phyir sna ma'i me tog dang bu ram dang shing bal la sogs pa
translated: Since they possess the eight substances, they apprehend the object of each sense faculty according to its nature and do not apprehend all aspects, like the jasmine flower, molasses, cotton and so on.üîΩ

original: dag bdag gi mngon sum yin no zhes de kho na nyid shes pa su zhig smra /
analyzed: dag bdag gi mngon sum yin no zhes de kho na nyid shes pa su zhig smra /
translated: Since they possess the eight substances, they are the objects of the individual sense faculties in accordance with their nature, but they are not the objects of all sense faculties. Therefore, no one who knows reality would say that a jasmine flower, molasses, cotton, and so on are directly perceptible to the self.

original: sgra dgag pa ni phyis rgyas par 'chad do //
analyzed: sgra dgag pa ni phyis rgyas par 'chad do //
translated: The refutation of sound will be explained later in great detail.

original: ci ste bum pa gzugs las tha dad pa med mod kyi gzugs kyis de khyab par byas nas ni gnas pas gzugs mthong bas bum pa thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste bum pa gzugs las tha dad pa med mod kyi gzugs kyis de khyab par byas nas ni gnas pas gzugs mthong bas bum pa thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if a vase is not different from form, since form pervades it, when form is seen, the vase would be seen.

original: 'di yang snying po med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di yang snying po med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To demonstrate that this is also pointless, the root text says:üîΩIf the vase were seen

original: gal te gzugs mthong ba yis de //üîΩthams cad mthong bar 'gyur na ni //üîΩma mthong ba yis gzugs mthong ba //
analyzed: gal te gzugs mthong ba yis de // thams cad mthong bar 'gyur na ni // ma mthong ba yis gzugs mthong ba //
translated: When form is seen,üîΩHow could seeing form

original: mthong ba min par cis mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong ba min par cis mi 'gyur //
translated: Not be seeing the unseen?

original: gal te gzugs tsam zhig mthong bsam mthong yang bum pa thams cad kho na mthong bar 'gyur na ni bum pa ma mthong bas mthong ba gzugs mthong ba ma yin par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te gzugs tsam zhig mthong bsam mthong yang bum pa thams cad kho na mthong bar 'gyur na ni bum pa ma mthong bas mthong ba gzugs mthong ba ma yin par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: If you think that you see just form alone, and you see a vase, then why wouldn‚Äôt you not see the vase because you see form?

original: yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te bum pa rdzas brgyad kyi nye bar len pa can yin yang gal te rdzas gcig gi gzugs mthong bas ril mthong bar rtogs na ni re zhig de dag dang so sor mi gnas pa'i gzugs de nyid de de las gzhan
analyzed: yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te bum pa rdzas brgyad kyi nye bar len pa can yin yang gal te rdzas gcig gi gzugs mthong bas ril mthong bar rtogs na ni re zhig de dag dang so sor mi gnas pa'i gzugs de nyid de de las gzhan
translated: Or, this is another point: although a vase is the appropriated aggregates, if you think that you see the whole vase by seeing the form of one of its parts, then you would not see the vase because you do not see the other seven substances.

original: rdzas bdun ma mthong bas na ma mthong ba yin no zhes ci'i phyir mi rtog /
analyzed: rdzas bdun ma mthong bas na ma mthong ba yin no zhes ci'i phyir mi rtog /
translated: Why wouldn‚Äôt you think that you do not see the vase because you do not see the other seven substances?

original: 'jig rten na yang phal che bas brjod pa mthong ba snye mon sra na sde'u la sogs pa yod kyang mon sran gre'u'i phung pos bsnyad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang phal che bas brjod pa mthong ba snye mon sra na sde'u la sogs pa yod kyang mon sran gre'u'i phung pos bsnyad pa bzhin no //
translated: In the world, most people say, ‚ÄúI see a pile of mung beans,‚Äù even though it contains mung beans, beans, and so on.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na ma mthong ba yis te dri la sogs pa yongs su ma bcad pas mthong ba'i gzugs kyang mthong ba ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na ma mthong ba yis te dri la sogs pa yongs su ma bcad pas mthong ba'i gzugs kyang mthong ba ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in that case, because of not seeing, that is, because of not ascertaining smell and so on, even the seeing of form would not be seeing.

original: de'i phyir gzugs nyid mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir bum pa yang mngon sum nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs nyid mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir bum pa yang mngon sum nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, because form itself is not direct perception, it is not tenable that a pot is direct perception.

original: ci ste ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par dpyad pas bum pa la mngon sum nyid mi srid mod /
analyzed: ci ste ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par dpyad pas bum pa la mngon sum nyid mi srid mod /
translated: But if you think that although it is impossible for a pot to be direct perception due to the analysis explained above,

original: bum pa'i gzugs ni re zhig mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: bum pa'i gzugs ni re zhig mngon sum yin te /
translated: the form of a pot is direct perception for the time being,

original: de'i phyir rgyud nas bum pa yang mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems na 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyud nas bum pa yang mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems na 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and therefore the pot is also direct perception by extension, that is not the case.

original: gzugs la mngon sum nyid yod na ni 'di de skad du brjod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gzugs la mngon sum nyid yod na ni 'di de skad du brjod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If form were direct perception, this would be stated.

original: gzugs la mngon sum nyid srid pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: gzugs la mngon sum nyid srid pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: But in order to demonstrate that it is impossible for form to be direct perception, it is said:

original: gzugs ni 'ba' zhig kho na @199a * //
analyzed: gzugs ni 'ba' zhig kho na @199a * //
translated: Form alone

original: la ; mngon sum nyid ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: la ; mngon sum nyid ni yod ma yin //
translated: Does not have direct perception.

original: gang phyir de la'ang pha rol gyi //
analyzed: gang phyir de la'ang pha rol gyi //
translated: Because in regard to that, there is a part that is distant,

original: cha dang tshu rol dbus yod phyir //
analyzed: cha dang tshu rol dbus yod phyir //
translated: a part that is near, and a middle part.

original: dri la sogs pa dang 'brel pa brjod par mi 'dod pa'i gzugs 'ba' zhig la /
analyzed: dri la sogs pa dang 'brel pa brjod par mi 'dod pa'i gzugs 'ba' zhig la /
translated: In the case of form alone, which is not asserted to be related to smell, etc.,

original: yang rnam pa thams cad du tshu rol dang dkyil dang pha rol gyi cha rnams mthong ba'i phyir mngon sum nyid mi rigs so //
analyzed: yang rnam pa thams cad du tshu rol dang dkyil dang pha rol gyi cha rnams mthong ba'i phyir mngon sum nyid mi rigs so //
translated: it is not reasonable that it is directly perceived, because its parts that are distant, in the middle, and near are seen in every way.üîΩIn regard to those parts that are distant, near, and in the middle, there are again other parts that are distant, near, and in the middle, and in regard to those, there are again others.

original: tshu rol dang pha rol dang dbus kyi cha de dag la yang slar tshu rol dang pha rol dang dbus kyi cha gzhan dag yin la de dag la yang gzhan yin no zhes de ltar rnam par phye ba na gzugs te rdul phra rab kyi mthar thug nas
analyzed: tshu rol dang pha rol dang dbus kyi cha de dag la yang slar tshu rol dang pha rol dang dbus kyi cha gzhan dag yin la de dag la yang gzhan yin no zhes de ltar rnam par phye ba na gzugs te rdul phra rab kyi mthar thug nas
translated: When it is analyzed in this way, form, which is the ultimate limit of the smallest particles,

original: gnas so // brtags bzhin pa'i rdul de la yang mdun dang rgyab kyi phyogs kyi cha'i dbye ba dang / tshu rol dang dbus dang pha rol gyi cha'i dbye ba las /
analyzed: gnas so // brtags bzhin pa'i rdul de la yang mdun dang rgyab kyi phyogs kyi cha'i dbye ba dang / tshu rol dang dbus dang pha rol gyi cha'i dbye ba las /
translated: In regard to that particle that is being investigated, there is a division into parts that are in the front and back directions, and a division into parts that are distant, in the middle, and near.

original: rdul la cha shas yod med ces //
analyzed: rdul la cha shas yod med ces //
translated: ‚ÄúIs a particle divisible or not?‚Äù

original: dpyad pa der yang 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: dpyad pa der yang 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: This investigation will also apply to that.

original: gal te de la mdun dang rgyab kyi cha'i dbye ba dag yod na ni de'i tshe bum pa ltar de'i rdul phra rab nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de la mdun dang rgyab kyi cha'i dbye ba dag yod na ni de'i tshe bum pa ltar de'i rdul phra rab nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it has a division into front and back parts, then, like a pot, its atomicity is lost.

original: ci ste med na ni de ltar na yang gsal byed med cing ma bzung ba'i ngo bo can de la yod pa nyid med do //
analyzed: ci ste med na ni de ltar na yang gsal byed med cing ma bzung ba'i ngo bo can de la yod pa nyid med do //
translated: But if it does not, then it is not manifest, and it is not apprehended, and it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir de la mngon sum nyid srid par ga la 'gyur /üîΩde'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yis //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la mngon sum nyid srid par ga la 'gyur / de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yis //
translated: So how could it be possible for it to be a direct perception?üîΩTherefore, it is not tenable

original: bsgrub bya 'grub par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bsgrub bya 'grub par mi 'thad do //
translated: that the probandum is established by the proof.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na mngon sum nyid ma grub par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na mngon sum nyid ma grub par mi 'thad do //
translated: So in this way, it is not tenable that direct perception is not established.

original: de'i phyir de ltar mngon sum ma grub cing bsgrub par gyur pas bsgrub par bya ba ste dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du gzhan gyis khas blangs pa grub pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar mngon sum ma grub cing bsgrub par gyur pas bsgrub par bya ba ste dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du gzhan gyis khas blangs pa grub pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, since direct perception is not established and the probandum is not established, it is not tenable that the opponent accepts that things have essence.

original: gzhan yang dbang po gzugs can gyis gzung bar bya ba'i don yongs su brtags pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang po gzugs can gyis gzung bar bya ba'i don yongs su brtags pa na /
translated: Moreover, when the object that is apprehended by the physical sense faculties is examined,

original: kun kyang yan lag tu gyur na //
analyzed: kun kyang yan lag tu gyur na //
translated: If all are parts,

original: slar yang yan lag can du 'gyur //
analyzed: slar yang yan lag can du 'gyur //
translated: then there will be parts again.

original: bum pa ni yan lag gyo mo la ltos nas yan lag can yin la /
analyzed: bum pa ni yan lag gyo mo la ltos nas yan lag can yin la /
translated: A pot is a whole in relation to its parts, the shards.

original: gyo mo de dag kyang rang gi yan lag la ltos nas yan lag can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyo mo de dag kyang rang gi yan lag la ltos nas yan lag can du 'gyur ro //
translated: And those shards will be wholes in relation to their own parts.

original: de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And so on, down to the atoms.

original: de yang rdzas brgyad la ltos nas sam mdun dang rgyab dang dbus kyi cha la ltos nas slar yang yan lag can yin pas 'ga' la yang rang gi ngo bos yan lag @199b nyid dang yan lag can nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rdzas brgyad la ltos nas sam mdun dang rgyab dang dbus kyi cha la ltos nas slar yang yan lag can yin pas 'ga' la yang rang gi ngo bos yan lag @199b nyid dang yan lag can nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And those atoms will be wholes in relation to the eight substances or in relation to the parts of front, back, and middle. Therefore, nothing has parts and a whole by its own intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa rnams la mngon sum nyid med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa rnams la mngon sum nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, pots and so on are not perceived.

original: ji ltar rdul phra rab la rnam par dpyad pa de bzhin du ming gi mthar gnas pa'i yi ge la yang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rdul phra rab la rnam par dpyad pa de bzhin du ming gi mthar gnas pa'i yi ge la yang ste /
translated: Just as the atom is analyzed, so also the syllables at the end of a name are analyzed.

original: rdul phra rab ltar ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab ltar ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not established like atoms.

original: de'i phyir yi ge brjod pa yang //
analyzed: de'i phyir yi ge brjod pa yang //
translated: Therefore, the utterance of syllables

original: 'di na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not here.

original: yi ge brjod pa yang mi srid do snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: yi ge brjod pa yang mi srid do snyam du dgongs so //
translated: It is not possible to express a letter.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na bum pa la sogs pa med na de'i rjod par byed pa'i yi ge brjod pa yang mi srid de /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na bum pa la sogs pa med na de'i rjod par byed pa'i yi ge brjod pa yang mi srid de /
translated: In another way, if a pot, etc. does not exist, the expression of the letters that express it is not possible.

original: don med na shes pa dang brjod pa dag 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir yi ge brjod pa yang 'di na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don med na shes pa dang brjod pa dag 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir yi ge brjod pa yang 'di na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the engagement of cognition and expression is not possible if the object does not exist, the expression of the letters is not here.

original: gang dag gzugs kyi skye mched kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag ste de'i sgo nas bum pa nyid mngon sum nyid du rtog par byed pa de dag la rjod par byed pa ste /üîΩ'dir dbyibs 'di rtog pa na kha dog las gzhan nyid dam /
analyzed: gang dag gzugs kyi skye mched kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag ste de'i sgo nas bum pa nyid mngon sum nyid du rtog par byed pa de dag la rjod par byed pa ste / 'dir dbyibs 'di rtog pa na kha dog las gzhan nyid dam /
translated: Those who imagine that a pot, etc. is directly perceived by way of the two aspects of the form sense-sphere, which has the nature of color and shape, for them the expression is as follows.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rtog grang na //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rtog grang na //
translated: When one imagines this shape, does one imagine it as different from color or not different?

original: de la re zhig / gal te mdog las dbyibs gzhan na //
analyzed: de la re zhig / gal te mdog las dbyibs gzhan na //
translated: If shape is different from color,

original: ji lta bur na dbyibs 'dzin 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na dbyibs 'dzin 'gyur //
translated: how will one apprehend shape?

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog ni mig gi dbang po'i yul yin na /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog ni mig gi dbang po'i yul yin na /
translated: If color such as blue, etc., is the object of the eye faculty,

original: gal te de las dbyibs tha dad par 'gyur na ni kha dog las tha dad pa'i phyir sgra la sogs pa ltar mig gi gzung byar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te de las dbyibs tha dad par 'gyur na ni kha dog las tha dad pa'i phyir sgra la sogs pa ltar mig gi gzung byar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: and if shape were different from that, then like sound, etc., it would not be the object of the eye because it would be different from color.

original: kha dog ltar mig gis 'dzin pa yang yin pas de las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: kha dog ltar mig gis 'dzin pa yang yin pas de las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: But it is grasped by the eye just like color, so it is not different from that.

original: ji ltar sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa tha dad pa rnams las gang yang rung ba cig bzung nas cig shos kyang 'dzin pa de ltar kha dog las gzhan pa'i gzugs ni mi 'dzin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa tha dad pa rnams las gang yang rung ba cig bzung nas cig shos kyang 'dzin pa de ltar kha dog las gzhan pa'i gzugs ni mi 'dzin no //
translated: Just as one grasps either one of two different things, such as blue and yellow, and the other is not grasped, so shape is not grasped as different from color.

original: 'on te gzhan min na lus kyis //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan min na lus kyis //
translated: But if it is not different,

original: mdog kyang ci ste 'dzin mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mdog kyang ci ste 'dzin mi 'gyur //
translated: why does the body not grasp color?

original: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i skyon spang bar 'dod pas dbyibs kha dog las gzhan ma yin par rtog na ni ji ltar mun khung du lus kyi ring po la sogs pa 'dzin pa de bzhin du de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir dbyibs ltar kha dog kyang
analyzed: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i skyon spang bar 'dod pas dbyibs kha dog las gzhan ma yin par rtog na ni ji ltar mun khung du lus kyi ring po la sogs pa 'dzin pa de bzhin du de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir dbyibs ltar kha dog kyang
translated: If you think that shape is not different from color in order to avoid the faults just explained, then just as you apprehend the length, etc., of the body in the dark, you would also apprehend color, because it is not different from shape.

original: ci ste mi 'dzin te gzung dgos na 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste mi 'dzin te gzung dgos na 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But you do not apprehend color, so how can you apprehend shape?

original: de'i phyir dbyibs 'dzin yang ma bzung ba'i phyir kha dog las dbyibs gzhan ma yin pa ma yin no //üîΩde nyid dang gzhan nyid du rtog @200a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyibs 'dzin yang ma bzung ba'i phyir kha dog las dbyibs gzhan ma yin pa ma yin no // de nyid dang gzhan nyid du rtog @200a * //
translated: Therefore, since you do not apprehend shape without apprehending color, shape is not different from color.

original: pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan gzhag par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan gzhag par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from the concepts of sameness and difference, there is no other way to posit a third category.

original: de'i phyir kha dog ltar dbyibs kyang mi rigs la /
analyzed: de'i phyir kha dog ltar dbyibs kyang mi rigs la /
translated: Therefore, like color, shape is also illogical.

original: de med pas kyang 'ga' la yang mngon sum nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de med pas kyang 'ga' la yang mngon sum nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: And since it does not exist, no perception exists at all. This is established.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: gzugs kyi skye mched ni yod pa kho na ste de'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched ni yod pa kho na ste de'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The form base exists because its cause exists.

original: 'dir gzugs kyi rgyu ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi yin la /
analyzed: 'dir gzugs kyi rgyu ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi yin la /
translated: Here, the cause of form is the four great elements.

original: de dag ni re zhig yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni re zhig yod pa yin no //
translated: And they exist.

original: de dag yod pas de dag gi 'bras bu gzugs kyi skye mched kyang yod par 'gyur ro zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de dag yod pas de dag gi 'bras bu gzugs kyi skye mched kyang yod par 'gyur ro zhes smra'o //
translated: Since they exist, the effect of them, the form base, also exists.

original: 'di yang yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di yang yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To show that this is also not correct, the treatise states:

original: gzugs ni lta zhig ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gzugs ni lta zhig ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from form,

original: gzugs kyi rgyu ni mi snang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu ni mi snang ngo //
translated: the cause of form is not seen.

original: rdzas brgyad lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi ma gtogs par gzugs mi dmigs la /
analyzed: rdzas brgyad lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi ma gtogs par gzugs mi dmigs la /
translated: Form is not observed apart from the eight substances that definitely occur together, apart from the four great elements.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched ma gtogs par yang gzugs kyi rgyu mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched ma gtogs par yang gzugs kyi rgyu mi dmigs so //
translated: And apart from the form base, the cause of form is not observed.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched ni mig gi dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched ni mig gi dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin la /
translated: The form base is that which is apprehended by the eye faculty.

original: gzugs kyi rgyu ni lus kyi dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu ni lus kyi dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The cause of form is that which is apprehended by the body faculty.

original: de'i phyir gal te gzugs kyi rgyu zhes bya ba cung zad cig rang gi ngo bos 'grub par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe gzugs kyang rang gi ngo bos grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te gzugs kyi rgyu zhes bya ba cung zad cig rang gi ngo bos 'grub par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe gzugs kyang rang gi ngo bos grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Therefore, if the cause of form were to exist by way of its own entity, then at that time form would also exist by way of its own entity.

original: gzugs kyi rgyu gzugs las tha dad par grub pa gang yin pa 'di ni srid pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu gzugs las tha dad par grub pa gang yin pa 'di ni srid pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not possible for the cause of form to be established as different from form.

original: de'i phyir gzugs kyi rgyu med na rgyu med pa'i gzugs kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs kyi rgyu med na rgyu med pa'i gzugs kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, if the cause of form does not exist, then form that lacks a cause also does not exist.

original: ci ste 'o na ni tha dad pa ma yin par gnas pa'i gzugs kyi rgyu las gzugs yin par rag go snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste 'o na ni tha dad pa ma yin par gnas pa'i gzugs kyi rgyu las gzugs yin par rag go snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that form is the cause of form that is not different,

original: de yang srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang srid pa ma yin no //
translated: that also is not possible.

original: gal te de ltar 'gyur na ni //üîΩgnyi ga yang ni mig nyid kyis //
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'gyur na ni // gnyi ga yang ni mig nyid kyis //
translated: If that were the case,üîΩthen why wouldn‚Äôt both

original: 'dzin par ci yi phyir mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dzin par ci yi phyir mi 'gyur //
translated: be apprehended by the eye?

original: gzugs kyi rgyu yang gzugs las tha mi dad pa'i phyir mig gi dbang pos rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis ka yang 'dzin par 'gyur na 'di ni srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu yang gzugs las tha mi dad pa'i phyir mig gi dbang pos rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis ka yang 'dzin par 'gyur na 'di ni srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And because the cause of form is not different from form, the eye faculty would grasp both cause and effect. But this is impossible,

original: dbang po tha dad pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dang / mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po tha dad pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dang / mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of a different faculty and because of the difference in their characteristics.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To demonstrate just this, he says:

original: sa ni brtan zhes bya bar mthong //
analyzed: sa ni brtan zhes bya bar mthong //
translated: Earth is seen as solidity.

original: de yang lus kyis 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yang lus kyis 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: And it is grasped by the body.

original: 'dzin pa'i las @200b kyis rten gyi dngos por gnas pa'i phyir rten nyid yin pas brtan pa nyid kyis nas ni brtan pa zhes bya bar mthong la /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i las @200b kyis rten gyi dngos por gnas pa'i phyir rten nyid yin pas brtan pa nyid kyis nas ni brtan pa zhes bya bar mthong la /
translated: Earth is seen as solidity because it is solidity by nature, since it is the basis of the body due to the function of grasping.

original: de yang lus kyis 'dzin te de'i sra ba lus kyi dbang po'i gzung bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang lus kyis 'dzin te de'i sra ba lus kyi dbang po'i gzung bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is grasped by the body, because its solidity is the object of the body faculty.

original: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa /
translated: Since this is so,

original: des na reg pa 'ga' zhig 'di //
analyzed: des na reg pa 'ga' zhig 'di //
translated: therefore, some contact

original: sa'o zhes ni bya bar brjod //
analyzed: sa'o zhes ni bya bar brjod //
translated: is called earth.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched ni mig gi dbang po'i gzung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched ni mig gi dbang po'i gzung bar bya ba'o //
translated: The form sense-sphere is the object of the eye sense-faculty.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis tha me dad pa med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis tha me dad pa med de /
translated: Thus, the two, cause and effect, are not different,

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir dang / 'dzin par byed pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir dang / 'dzin par byed pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their characteristics are different and because their apprehenders are different.

original: tha dad pa yod na yang rgyu med pa par smra bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: tha dad pa yod na yang rgyu med pa par smra bar 'gyur ro//
translated: If they were different, they would be causeless.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang bral ba'i dngos po 'di 'ga' zhig la rang gi ngo bos yod pa nyid du rtag par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang bral ba'i dngos po 'di 'ga' zhig la rang gi ngo bos yod pa nyid du rtag par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable for any entity that is devoid of sameness and difference to exist by its own nature.

original: de'i phyir gzugs kyi rgyu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs kyi rgyu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cause of form does not exist.

original: gzugs kyi rgyu med na yang gzugs rang gi ngo bos yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu med na yang gzugs rang gi ngo bos yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: And, if the cause of form does not exist, form does not exist by its own nature.üîΩThus, it is established.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: For this very reason, the Lord Buddha said:

original: gang dag nga la gzugs su mthong //
analyzed: gang dag nga la gzugs su mthong //
translated: Those who see me as form,

original: gang dag nga la sgrar shes pa //
analyzed: gang dag nga la sgrar shes pa //
translated: And those who know me as sound,

original: log par spong bar zhugs pa ste //
analyzed: log par spong bar zhugs pa ste //
translated: They enter a perverted path.

original: skye bo de dag nga mi mthong //
analyzed: skye bo de dag nga mi mthong //
translated: Those people do not see me.

original: 'o na ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: But how can they see the TathƒÅgata?

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos nyid lta //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos nyid lta //
translated: The Buddhas are seen through the nature of reality.

original: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
translated: The guides are the Dharma body.

original: chos nyid shes bya ma yin te //
analyzed: chos nyid shes bya ma yin te //
translated: The nature of reality is not an object of knowledge.

original: de ni shes par nus ma yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni shes par nus ma yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is not possible to know it.

original: 'dir kha cig dag na re bum pa ni rang gi ngo bos blta bar bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig dag na re bum pa ni rang gi ngo bos blta bar bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: Here, some say: A pot is not seen by its own nature.

original: blta bar bya ba ma yin pa'ang ma yin mod kyi /üîΩblta bar bya ba nyid dang 'brel pa las blta bar bya bar ni 'gyur na /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba ma yin pa'ang ma yin mod kyi / blta bar bya ba nyid dang 'brel pa las blta bar bya bar ni 'gyur na /
translated: It is not that it is not seen.üîΩBut it becomes seen by being related to seeing.

original: blta bar bya bar gyur pas kyang mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: blta bar bya bar gyur pas kyang mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: And that which becomes seen is directly perceived.

original: 'di yang mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To show that this is also unreasonable, it is said:

original: blta bya skyes pas bum pa ni //
analyzed: blta bya skyes pas bum pa ni //
translated: The pot is not seen by the arising of the seen.

original: 'di la yon tan 'gar mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di la yon tan 'gar mi 'gyur //
translated: It does not become seen in any way.

original: des na blta bya nyid skye ltar //
analyzed: des na blta bya nyid skye ltar //
translated: Therefore, just as the arising of the seen does not exist,

original: yod pa'i ngo bo'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: yod pa'i ngo bo'ang yod ma yin //
translated: The nature of existence also does not exist.

original: gal te blta bar bya ba nyid ni mngon par gsal ba'am cis khyad par du gyur pa yin pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te blta bar bya ba nyid ni mngon par gsal ba'am cis khyad par du gyur pa yin pa zhig na /
translated: If the object of seeing is manifest or distinguished by something else,

original: gnyi ga ltar 'di la blta bar bya ba nyid dgos pa med de //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar 'di la blta bar bya ba nyid dgos pa med de //
translated: then in both cases, the object of seeing is not necessary here.

original: 'dir blta bar bya ba nyid 'di yongs su brtags nas don blta bar bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo'am /
analyzed: 'dir blta bar bya ba nyid 'di yongs su brtags nas don blta bar bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo'am /
translated: Here, having investigated the object of seeing, is it the nature of the object of seeing,

original: blta bar bya ba ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo zhig @201a * //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo zhig @201a * //
translated: or is it the nature of the non-object of seeing?

original: la rtog / re zhig gal te blta bar bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo la yin na de'i tshe de brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: la rtog / re zhig gal te blta bar bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo la yin na de'i tshe de brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: First, if it is the nature of the object of seeing, then what is the use of investigating it?

original: gang gi don yongs su rtog pa de ni med par yang yod pa nyid pas brtag par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi don yongs su rtog pa de ni med par yang yod pa nyid pas brtag par mi rigs so //
translated: Since that which is investigated exists even when it does not exist, it is not reasonable to investigate it.

original: ci ste blta bar bya ba ma yin par gyur pa la blta bar bya ba nyid rtog na yang mi rigs te lus can ma yin pa rnams kyang blta bar bya ba nyid du thal ba'i phyir dang / blta bar bya ba nyid skyes pa med pa la 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste blta bar bya ba ma yin par gyur pa la blta bar bya ba nyid rtog na yang mi rigs te lus can ma yin pa rnams kyang blta bar bya ba nyid du thal ba'i phyir dang / blta bar bya ba nyid skyes pa med pa la 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But if you imagine that which is not seen to be seen, that is illogical, because it follows that even those without bodies would be seen, and it is contradictory that that which is not seen arises.

original: blta bar bya ba nyid skyes pa med pa des na blta bya nyid skye ba ltar blta bar bya ba ma yin pa'i bum pa la rnam pa thams cad du blta bar bya ba nyid mi rigs pas skye ba mi srid pa de bzhin du blta bar byaüîΩbar ma gyur pa'i bum pa yod pa'i ngo bor yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba nyid skyes pa med pa des na blta bya nyid skye ba ltar blta bar bya ba ma yin pa'i bum pa la rnam pa thams cad du blta bar bya ba nyid mi rigs pas skye ba mi srid pa de bzhin du blta bar bya bar ma gyur pa'i bum pa yod pa'i ngo bor yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Since that which is not seen does not arise, it is illogical that a vase that is not seen is seen in any way, just as that which is seen arises.üîΩTherefore, since arising is impossible, a vase that is not seen does not exist as an existent entity.

original: yod pa yang ma yin pa'i bum pa la ni blta bar bya ba nyid brtag par rigs pa yang ma yin pas 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin pa'i bum pa la ni blta bar bya ba nyid brtag par rigs pa yang ma yin pas 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: And it is illogical to imagine that which is seen in a vase that does not exist. Therefore this is illogical.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: yul gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum dag ni yod pa kho na ste de'i 'dzin par byed pa mig la sogs pa'i dbang po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum dag ni yod pa kho na ste de'i 'dzin par byed pa mig la sogs pa'i dbang po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Objects such as form do exist, because their sense faculties such as the eyes exist.

original: yod par gyur pa'i dbang po 'di rnams ni gdon mi za bar rang gi yul la 'jug par 'gyur dgos la /
analyzed: yod par gyur pa'i dbang po 'di rnams ni gdon mi za bar rang gi yul la 'jug par 'gyur dgos la /
translated: These existing sense faculties must engage their objects without doubt.

original: gang du de rnams 'jug pa srid pa gzugs la sogs pa don de dag ni mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: gang du de rnams 'jug pa srid pa gzugs la sogs pa don de dag ni mngon sum yin no //
translated: Those objects such as form that are possible for them to engage are direct objects.

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: gal te dbang po rnams kyis yongs su gcod par nus par 'gyur na ni gzugs la sogs pa'i don dag tu 'gyur ba zhig na 'gyur ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te dbang po rnams kyis yongs su gcod par nus par 'gyur na ni gzugs la sogs pa'i don dag tu 'gyur ba zhig na 'gyur ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: If sense faculties were able to apprehend objects, then objects such as form would exist. But they do not exist.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di na mig la sogs pa lnga po ni spyir 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid du nye bar ston la /
analyzed: 'di na mig la sogs pa lnga po ni spyir 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid du nye bar ston la /
translated: The five sense faculties such as the eyes are generally taught to be derived from the elements.

original: de rnams kyi bya ba ni yul tha dad pas tha dad pa zhig go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bya ba ni yul tha dad pas tha dad pa zhig go //
translated: Their activities are distinct because their objects are distinct.

original: 'di ltar mig gis gzugs kho na mthong gi sgra mi thos la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gis gzugs kho na mthong gi sgra mi thos la /
translated: Thus the eyes see only form and do not hear sound.

original: rna bas kyang sgra thos kyi gzugs mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rna bas kyang sgra thos kyi gzugs mi mthong ngo //
translated: But the ear does not see visible form, even though it hears sound.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar /
translated: When it is like this,

original: mig ni 'byung 'gyur rna de bzhin //
analyzed: mig ni 'byung 'gyur rna de bzhin //
translated: the eye arises, and so does the ear.

original: mig gis mthong gi gzhan gyis min pa de'i tshe 'thad pa dang 'gal ba'i bya ba mi srid pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo rtog pa ga la yod /
analyzed: mig gis mthong gi gzhan gyis min pa de'i tshe 'thad pa dang 'gal ba'i bya ba mi srid pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo rtog pa ga la yod /
translated: When the eye sees and not the other, then the activity of the eye, etc., is not possible, because it would contradict reason. How then can there be an imagination of their own nature?

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid du mtshungs bzhin du yul 'dzin pa tha dad pa brtag par ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid du mtshungs bzhin du yul 'dzin pa tha dad pa brtag par ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable to imagine that they apprehend objects, even though they are similar in being derived from the elements.

original: @201b mig la sogs pa rnams kyi yod pa nyid ni yul 'dzin pa las rjes su dpog pa yin na de yang 'gal bas mi srid de de'i phyir dbang po yod pas yul rnams mngon sum nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: @201b mig la sogs pa rnams kyi yod pa nyid ni yul 'dzin pa las rjes su dpog pa yin na de yang 'gal bas mi srid de de'i phyir dbang po yod pas yul rnams mngon sum nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: The existence of the eye, etc., is inferred from the apprehension of objects. But that is impossible, because it is contradicted. Therefore, it is not reasonable that the objects are perceived by the existence of the sense faculties.

original: gal te de ltar mig la sogs pa rnams mi srid na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar mig la sogs pa rnams mi srid na /
translated: If the eye, etc., are impossible in this way,üîΩthen how can the existence of the sense faculties be inferred from the apprehension of objects?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar mig la sogs pa'i dbang po 'di rnams las kyi rnam par smin pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar mig la sogs pa'i dbang po 'di rnams las kyi rnam par smin pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Therefore, how can you posit that these faculties such as the eye are the nature of the karmic ripening?

original: ci kho bo cag gis 'di rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag gam /
analyzed: ci kho bo cag gis 'di rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag gam /
translated: Do we refute the nature of the karmic ripening of these?

original: gal te mig la sogs pa rnams 'gog par sgrub pas de ji ltar ma bkag ce na /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa rnams 'gog par sgrub pas de ji ltar ma bkag ce na /
translated: If you prove that the eye and so on are refuted, then how could we not refute them?

original: kho bo cag gi rnam par dpyod pa don rang bzhin tshol ba lhur byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi rnam par dpyod pa don rang bzhin tshol ba lhur byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because our analysis is intent on seeking the essence of things.

original: kho bo cag ni 'dir dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bos grub pa 'gog gi mig la sogs pa byas shing rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa nyid ni mi 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni 'dir dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bos grub pa 'gog gi mig la sogs pa byas shing rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa nyid ni mi 'gog pa'o //
translated: We refute here that things are established by their own nature, but we do not refute that the eye and so on are produced, are dependently arisen, and are the karmic ripening of action.

original: de'i phyir de yod pas gang zhig rnam par smin pa nyid du bsnyad pas mig la sogs pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yod pas gang zhig rnam par smin pa nyid du bsnyad pas mig la sogs pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since they exist, the eye and so on exist as the karmic ripening of action.

original: gal te de ltar na yang /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang /
translated: Even if that is so,

original: mig ni 'byung 'gyur rna de bzhin //
analyzed: mig ni 'byung 'gyur rna de bzhin //
translated: The eye is produced, so too the ear,

original: mig gis mthong gi gzhan gyis min //
analyzed: mig gis mthong gi gzhan gyis min //
translated: The eye sees, not the other.

original: zhes bya ba'i nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt this the fault that you have charged to us?

original: nyes pa 'di ni med de /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med de /
translated: This fault does not exist for us.

original: las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the evolution of karma is inconceivable.

original: las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni rigs pa bcug nas bsam par bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni rigs pa bcug nas bsam par bya bar mi nus te /
translated: The evolution of karma cannot be conceived by reasoning,

original: re zhig las de nyid rang gi ngo bos ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig las de nyid rang gi ngo bos ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that karma itself is not established by intrinsic nature.

original: gal te de rang gi ngo bos grub par gyur na ni de'i tshe dus thams cad du rnam par mi 'chad par 'gyur zhing rnam par smin pa byung zin pa las kyang slar rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'am yang na rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ba nyid
analyzed: gal te de rang gi ngo bos grub par gyur na ni de'i tshe dus thams cad du rnam par mi 'chad par 'gyur zhing rnam par smin pa byung zin pa las kyang slar rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'am yang na rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ba nyid
translated: If it were established by intrinsic nature, then it would be uninterrupted at all times, and even when the evolution of karma has already occurred, karma would evolve again or it would not evolve at all.

original: de / rang bzhin gzhan nyid du bsgyur bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de / rang bzhin gzhan nyid du bsgyur bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to change the intrinsic nature of something.

original: las kyi 'bras bu mthong ba med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu mthong ba med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the case that the result of karma is not seen.

original: de'i phyir mkhas pas 'jig rten pa'i don la ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par dpyad pa de kho na nyid mthong ba dang rjes su mthun pa ma bcug par las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du khas blangs te sprul pa las
analyzed: de'i phyir mkhas pas 'jig rten pa'i don la ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par dpyad pa de kho na nyid mthong ba dang rjes su mthun pa ma bcug par las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du khas blangs te sprul pa las
translated: Therefore, the wise do not engage in the analysis of worldly objects as explained above, which is concordant with seeing suchness.üîΩThey accept the inconceivable ripening of karma.üîΩ

original: sprul pa 'byung ba'i tshul du 'jig rten pa thams cad khas blang bar bya'o //üîΩmthong ba la ni bsnyon @202a * //
analyzed: sprul pa 'byung ba'i tshul du 'jig rten pa thams cad khas blang bar bya'o // mthong ba la ni bsnyon @202a * //
translated: Therefore, the wise do not engage in the analysis of mundane objects as explained above, which is consistent with seeing reality. They accept the inconceivability of the ripening of karma, and accept all mundane things in the manner of an emanated being creating another emanated being.

original: par mi nus la /
analyzed: par mi nus la /
translated: This is not something that can be denied by those who see it.

original: gang mig 'byung ba las gyur pa yin yang gzugs kho na mthong gi sgra mi thos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni mthong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: gang mig 'byung ba las gyur pa yin yang gzugs kho na mthong gi sgra mi thos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni mthong ba yang yin no //
translated: It is seen that even though the eye is produced from the elements, it sees only forms and does not hear sounds.

original: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa /
translated: Since this is the case,

original: des na nges par las rnam smin //
analyzed: des na nges par las rnam smin //
translated: the Sage has said that the ripening of karma

original: thub pa bsam mi khyab par gsungs //
analyzed: thub pa bsam mi khyab par gsungs //
translated: is inconceivable.

original: dngos po rang bzhin med pa rnams kyang bya ba'i 'bras bu nges pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin med pa rnams kyang bya ba'i 'bras bu nges pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Even though things lack intrinsic existence, the result of their activity is definite. Therefore the BhagavƒÅn said,

original: sems can las kyi rnam smin bsam yas pas //
analyzed: sems can las kyi rnam smin bsam yas pas //
translated: Because of the inconceivable ripening of karma of sentient beings,

original: rlung las 'jig rten 'di kun 'byung 'gyur te //
analyzed: rlung las 'jig rten 'di kun 'byung 'gyur te //
translated: this entire world arises from wind.

original: mtsho dang ri dang lha yi gzhal med khang //
analyzed: mtsho dang ri dang lha yi gzhal med khang //
translated: Lakes, mountains, and the celestial palaces of the gods,

original: rin po ches phye sa bon bkram rnams so //üîΩrlung las byung ba'i sprin gyis char 'bebs shing //
analyzed: rin po ches phye sa bon bkram rnams so // rlung las byung ba'i sprin gyis char 'bebs shing //
translated: are strewn with seeds of precious jewels.üîΩClouds rain down from the wind,

original: slar yang rlung gis sprin ni rab tu 'jil //
analyzed: slar yang rlung gis sprin ni rab tu 'jil //
translated: and again the wind disperses the clouds.

original: rlung las 'jig rten lo tog rgyas 'gyur te //
analyzed: rlung las 'jig rten lo tog rgyas 'gyur te //
translated: From the wind, the world‚Äôs crops flourish,

original: rlung gis 'gro ba kun la bde ba 'dren //
analyzed: rlung gis 'gro ba kun la bde ba 'dren //
translated: and the wind brings happiness to all beings.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: gang dag srid par gyur yang srid pa'i skyon las grol ba rnams//
analyzed: gang dag srid par gyur yang srid pa'i skyon las grol ba rnams//
translated: Those who, though existing in cyclic existence, are liberated from the faults of cyclic existence,

original: stong par smra zhing las kyi 'bras bu'ang 'dor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: stong par smra zhing las kyi 'bras bu'ang 'dor mi 'gyur //
translated: do not abandon the doctrine of emptiness or the results of karma.

original: gang dag shes pas dri ma bsregs kyang brtses brlan pa //
analyzed: gang dag shes pas dri ma bsregs kyang brtses brlan pa //
translated: Those who, though burning with the fire of knowledge, are moistened by compassion,

original: spyod pa bdag med dbang bsgyur de dag kyang dkris 'gyur //
analyzed: spyod pa bdag med dbang bsgyur de dag kyang dkris 'gyur //
translated: are also bound by their deeds, though they are masters of selflessness.

original: zhes las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab par gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab par gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said that the ripening of the results of karma is inconceivable.

original: 'dir smras pa ;üîΩmig la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa ; mig la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid de /
translated: Objection:

original: de'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The eyes and so on do exist essentially because their effect, consciousness, is seen.

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: gal te de'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa nyid yod na ni mig la sogs pa yod par 'gyur na srid pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa nyid yod na ni mig la sogs pa yod par 'gyur na srid pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If consciousness existed, the eyes and so on would exist. But that is not possible.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?üîΩFirst, he says:

original: de la re zhig / rkyen ma tshang phyir shes pa ni //
analyzed: de la re zhig / rkyen ma tshang phyir shes pa ni //
translated: Because the conditions are incomplete,

original: lta ba'i snga rol yod ma yin //
analyzed: lta ba'i snga rol yod ma yin //
translated: consciousness does not exist prior to seeing.

original: 'on te phyis na shes don med //
analyzed: 'on te phyis na shes don med //
translated: If it existed later, consciousness would be purposeless.

original: gsum par byed pa don med 'gyur //üîΩre zhig lta ba'i snga rol du ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum par byed pa don med 'gyur // re zhig lta ba'i snga rol du ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The third alternative is pointless.

original: mig gi lta ba bdag po'i rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi lta ba bdag po'i rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: First, the eye consciousness does not exist prior to seeing because the dominant condition, the eye‚Äôs seeing, is incomplete.

original: ci ste lta ba'i 'og rol du rtog na ni de'i tshe shes pa don med de /
analyzed: ci ste lta ba'i 'og rol du rtog na ni de'i tshe shes pa don med de /
translated: If you imagine that it exists later, then consciousness would be purposeless.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa med pa'i mig gis gzugs mthong na ni 'o na rnam par shes pa yongs su rtog pa don med do //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa med pa'i mig gis gzugs mthong na ni 'o na rnam par shes pa yongs su rtog pa don med do //
translated: If the eye sees visible form without consciousness, then the postulation of consciousness is useless.

original: gsum par byed pa don med 'gyur te rtog pa gsum pa ni lta ba dang shes pa gnyis cig car 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gsum par byed pa don med 'gyur te rtog pa gsum pa ni lta ba dang shes pa gnyis cig car 'byung ba ste /
translated: The third is useless, because the third postulation is the simultaneous arising of seeing and knowing.

original: de la rgyu @202b don med do //
analyzed: de la rgyu @202b don med do //
translated: The cause of that is useless.

original: 'di lta bas na lta ba ste byed pa de don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bas na lta ba ste byed pa de don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, seeing, the agent, would be useless.

original: lta ba dang shes pa gnyis cig car yod na ni rnam par shes pa gang zhig lta ba dang dus mtshungs pa de lta ba la rag las te 'byung bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: lta ba dang shes pa gnyis cig car yod na ni rnam par shes pa gang zhig lta ba dang dus mtshungs pa de lta ba la rag las te 'byung bar mi rigs so //
translated: If seeing and knowing exist simultaneously, then it is not logical that any consciousness that is simultaneous with seeing would arise in dependence on seeing.

original: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon lhan cig 'byung ba dag la ni cig shos la rag las te skye ba nyid mi srid de /
analyzed: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon lhan cig 'byung ba dag la ni cig shos la rag las te skye ba nyid mi srid de /
translated: It is impossible for the right and left horns of an ox that arise simultaneously to arise in dependence on each other.

original: de bzhin du lta ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa lta ba la rag las te skye ba nyid du mi 'gyur bas lta ba don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du lta ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa lta ba la rag las te skye ba nyid du mi 'gyur bas lta ba don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, since consciousness that co-arises with view would not arise in dependence on view, view would be meaningless.

original: ci ste sgron ma dang 'od bzhin du dus mnyam pa dag yin yang lta ba la rag las te gnas pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste sgron ma dang 'od bzhin du dus mnyam pa dag yin yang lta ba la rag las te gnas pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that, like a lamp and its light, they are simultaneous and that consciousness exists in dependence on view,

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not possible.

original: der yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the same objection and response would apply.

original: 'jig rten pa'i mthong bas de kho na nyid mthong ba gsal bar rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i mthong bas de kho na nyid mthong ba gsal bar rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not reasonable that the seeing of reality is clarified by worldly seeing,

original: de ni 'jig rten pa kho na las tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / des dmigs pa'i don yang brdzun pa bslu ba'i chos can nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa kho na las tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / des dmigs pa'i don yang brdzun pa bslu ba'i chos can nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is valid cognition only in the world and because the object observed by it is established as false and deceptive.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar rnam par shes pa mi srid pa de'i tshe de yod pas mig la sogs pa rnams yod par brtag pa gang yin pa de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar rnam par shes pa mi srid pa de'i tshe de yod pas mig la sogs pa rnams yod par brtag pa gang yin pa de ni mi rigs so //
translated: When consciousness is impossible in this way, it is illogical to imagine that the eyes and so on exist because they exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: mig ni byed pa'i ngo bor ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: mig ni byed pa'i ngo bor ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: The eyes are not the nature of seeing.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: byed pa po nyid do //
analyzed: byed pa po nyid do //
translated: They are agents.

original: byed pa po dngos por khas blangs pa'i phyir /üîΩgsum par byed pa don med 'gyur //
analyzed: byed pa po dngos por khas blangs pa'i phyir / gsum par byed pa don med 'gyur //
translated: Because you accept that agents are things,

original: zhes gang smras pa de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de ni mi rigs so //
translated: it is pointless to say that the third is pointless.üîΩTherefore, your response is illogical.

original: de ltar brtags na yang mig lta ba'i bya ba dang bral ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar brtags na yang mig lta ba'i bya ba dang bral ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if you imagine that, the eyes would be devoid of the activity of seeing.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gal te mig gis gzugs de lta ba na yul gyi yul du song nas sam ma song bar lta grang na /
analyzed: gal te mig gis gzugs de lta ba na yul gyi yul du song nas sam ma song bar lta grang na /
translated: If the eyes see form, do they see it after going to the object or without going?

original: gnyi ga ltar yang skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In response, it is said:

original: mig de 'gros dang ldan 'gyur na //
analyzed: mig de 'gros dang ldan 'gyur na //
translated: If the eyes possess movement,

original: thag ring yun ring gis mthong 'gyur //
analyzed: thag ring yun ring gis mthong 'gyur //
translated: then they would see distant objects quickly.

original: ha cang nye dang ches ring du //
analyzed: ha cang nye dang ches ring du //
translated: Neither too close nor too far away,üîΩ

original: gzugs de gsal ba ci ste min //
analyzed: gzugs de gsal ba ci ste min //
translated: Why is the form not clearly seen when it is very close or very far away?

original: gal te mig phrad na 'dzin pa'i phyir yul gyi yul du 'gro na ni de'i tshe phye ba tsam gyis zla ba dang skar ma la sogs pa'i don dag 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mig phrad na 'dzin pa'i phyir yul gyi yul du 'gro na ni de'i tshe phye ba tsam gyis zla ba dang skar ma la sogs pa'i don dag 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the eye sense faculty apprehends by coming into contact with its object, then the eye sense faculty would not apprehend the object when it is merely opened, as in the case of the moon, stars, and so on.

original: 'gro ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir na 'gro ba dang ldan pa'i don gyis yul nye bar 'dzin pa dang / dus mnyam par yul thag ring bar 'dzin @203a * //üîΩpa ni mi rigs na /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir na 'gro ba dang ldan pa'i don gyis yul nye bar 'dzin pa dang / dus mnyam par yul thag ring bar 'dzin @203a * // pa ni mi rigs na /
translated: It is illogical that the eye sense faculty apprehends an object that is close by at the same time as it apprehends an object that is far away, because the time of going to each is different.

original: phye ba tsam gyis mig gis thag ring ba na gnas pa yang nye ba na gnas pa ltar mthong ba yang yin pas 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: phye ba tsam gyis mig gis thag ring ba na gnas pa yang nye ba na gnas pa ltar mthong ba yang yin pas 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical that the eye sense faculty sees a distant object as if it were close by when it is merely opened.

original: gal te yang mig phrad nas 'dzin par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe ha cang nye bar yang mig la gnas pa'i mig sman nam thur ma mthong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te yang mig phrad nas 'dzin par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe ha cang nye bar yang mig la gnas pa'i mig sman nam thur ma mthong bar 'gyur la /
translated: If the eye sense faculty apprehends by coming into contact with its object, then the eye ointment or the spoon would be seen by the eye sense faculty that is located within the eye.

original: thag ring por yang gsal bar mthong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: thag ring por yang gsal bar mthong bar 'gyur na /
translated: And a distant object would be seen clearly.

original: 'di ni srid pa yang ma yin pas 'di mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa yang ma yin pas 'di mi rigs so //
translated: But this is not possible, since it is impossible for it to exist.

original: gzhan yang gal te mig gis phyin nas gzugs mthong na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te mig gis phyin nas gzugs mthong na /
translated: Moreover, if the eye goes to the visible form and sees it,

original: de ci ste mthong nas de'i yul du 'gro'am 'on te ma mthong ba yin /
analyzed: de ci ste mthong nas de'i yul du 'gro'am 'on te ma mthong ba yin /
translated: is it that it goes to the object of seeing or to the object of non-seeing?

original: de las cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur /
