translated: What is the problem?

original: gnyi ga ltar yang skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa /
translated: The problem is stated in the following:

original: gal te gzugs mthong mig 'gro na //
analyzed: gal te gzugs mthong mig 'gro na //
translated: If the eye goes to the visible form,

original: song bas yon tan 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: song bas yon tan 'ga' yang med //
translated: then there is no purpose in going,

original: yang na blta byar 'dod pa ni //
analyzed: yang na blta byar 'dod pa ni //
translated: or else, if it is claimed that the object is seen,

original: nges par bya ba brdzun par 'gyur //
analyzed: nges par bya ba brdzun par 'gyur //
translated: then the action is certainly false.

original: gal te gzugs mthong nas gzugs kyi yul du mig 'gro snyam du rtogs na ni 'gro ba ste dong bas mig la dgos pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: gal te gzugs mthong nas gzugs kyi yul du mig 'gro snyam du rtogs na ni 'gro ba ste dong bas mig la dgos pa ci yang med do //
translated: If you think that the eye goes to the object of visible form after seeing it, then there is no purpose in going, since the eye has already gone.

original: mig 'gro ba ni yul blta bar bya ba'i phyir yin na /
analyzed: mig 'gro ba ni yul blta bar bya ba'i phyir yin na /
translated: If the eye goes to the object in order to see it,

original: de yul de yang snga nyid du 'di na gnas pa mthong bas 'gro ba la dgos pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: de yul de yang snga nyid du 'di na gnas pa mthong bas 'gro ba la dgos pa ci yang med do //
translated: then there is no purpose in going, since the object is already seen as present.

original: ci ste ma mthong bar 'gro na ni de'i tshe blta bar 'dod pa'i yul nges par mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste ma mthong bar 'gro na ni de'i tshe blta bar 'dod pa'i yul nges par mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it goes without seeing, then at that time it would not see the object that is desired to be seen.

original: ma mthong bar mngon par ma rtogs pa'i yul du 'gro ba'i phyir long ba ltar blta bar bya ba'i yul nges par mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩci ste skyon 'di spang bar 'dod nas gal te /
analyzed: ma mthong bar mngon par ma rtogs pa'i yul du 'gro ba'i phyir long ba ltar blta bar bya ba'i yul nges par mthong bar mi 'gyur ro // ci ste skyon 'di spang bar 'dod nas gal te /
translated: Because it goes to an object that is not seen, that is, that is not understood, it would not see the object that is desired to be seen, just as a blind person does not.üîΩIf you maintain that the eye does not go to the object in order to avoid these errors,

original: mig ma song bar 'dzin na na 'gro ba 'di kun mthong 'gyur te //
analyzed: mig ma song bar 'dzin na na 'gro ba 'di kun mthong 'gyur te //
translated: then all these goings would be seen,

original: gang la 'gro ba yod min pa //
analyzed: gang la 'gro ba yod min pa //
translated: because there would be no going

original: de la ring med sgrib pa'ang med //
analyzed: de la ring med sgrib pa'ang med //
translated: where there is no distance, nor obstruction.

original: gang zhig mig dang yid dang rna ba ni yul dang ma phrad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i lung las ni mig gi yul dang ma phrad pa kho na'o snyam du sems pa de la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang zhig mig dang yid dang rna ba ni yul dang ma phrad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i lung las ni mig gi yul dang ma phrad pa kho na'o snyam du sems pa de la brjod par bya ste /
translated: One might think that the eye, mind, and ear do not contact their objects because of the scriptural statement, ‚ÄúThe eye does not come into contact and so on. ‚Äù

original: re zhig lung dang 'gal ba ni med de phrad nas 'dzin pa nyid tsam zhig 'gog pa lhur byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig lung dang 'gal ba ni med de phrad nas 'dzin pa nyid tsam zhig 'gog pa lhur byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But we reply that this is not a contradiction of scripture, because we are intent on refuting only the mere contact.

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni sgrub pa gtso bo nyid yin te gang du de mi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni sgrub pa gtso bo nyid yin te gang du de mi 'gal ba'o //
translated: In some cases, the affirmation is primary, where there is no contradiction in that.

original: la lar ni dgag pa gtso bo nyid yin te gang du de mi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: la lar ni dgag pa gtso bo nyid yin te gang du de mi 'gal ba'o //
translated: In some cases, the negation is primary, where there is no contradiction in that.

original: de'i phyir 'di la rnam par @203b dpyad pa srid pas phrad nas 'dzin pa nyid bkag pa tsam gyis yul dang mi phrad pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la rnam par @203b dpyad pa srid pas phrad nas 'dzin pa nyid bkag pa tsam gyis yul dang mi phrad pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Therefore, since analysis is possible here, the mere negation of the apprehension of the object through contact is established as the non-contact of the object.

original: sgrub pa'i sgo nas yul dang ma phrad pa nyid du rtog na ni 'di na gnas pa'i mig kho nas 'gro ba thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i sgo nas yul dang ma phrad pa nyid du rtog na ni 'di na gnas pa'i mig kho nas 'gro ba thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one imagines the non-contact of the object through affirmation, then the eye that is here would see the entire world.

original: 'di ltar gang la 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pa de la thag ring ba ga la yod de 'dis ni nye ba na gnas pa'i don yang ma song bar blta bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pa de la thag ring ba ga la yod de 'dis ni nye ba na gnas pa'i don yang ma song bar blta bar bya ba yin la /
translated: In this way, how can that which does not have going have distance? By this, one should see that the object that is near is not gone,

original: thag ring ba na gnas pa yang yin pas /
analyzed: thag ring ba na gnas pa yang yin pas /
translated: and that which is distant is also.

original: thag ring bar byas pa'i khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thag ring bar byas pa'i khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The difference made by distance does not occur.

original: gang gi tshe ma song bar mthong ba de'i tshe 'di na gnas pa bzhin thag ring po na gnas pa yang mthong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma song bar mthong ba de'i tshe 'di na gnas pa bzhin thag ring po na gnas pa yang mthong bar 'gyur la /
translated: When it is seen as not gone, then it would be seen as far away, just as it is seen as present.

original: de bzhin du bsgribs pa yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgribs pa yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And in the same way, it would be seen as obscured.

original: 'gro ba yod na ni bsgribs pas de bcom pa'i phyir bsgribs pa mi mthong ngo zhes bya bar rigs na /
analyzed: 'gro ba yod na ni bsgribs pas de bcom pa'i phyir bsgribs pa mi mthong ngo zhes bya bar rigs na /
translated: If going existed, then it would be reasonable to say that it is not seen because it is destroyed by being obscured.

original: gang gi tshe ma song bar blta bar bya ba yin pa de'i tshe ni bsgribs pa la yang 'gro ba'i gegs med pas ma bsgribs pa bzhin mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma song bar blta bar bya ba yin pa de'i tshe ni bsgribs pa la yang 'gro ba'i gegs med pas ma bsgribs pa bzhin mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But when it is seen as not gone, then since there is no obstruction to going in the obscured, it would be seen as unobscured.

original: yang gal te mig lta ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur na ni de'i tshe thams cad du rang bzhin mi nyams pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo la yang blta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang gal te mig lta ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur na ni de'i tshe thams cad du rang bzhin mi nyams pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo la yang blta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the eye were the intrinsic nature of seeing, then at all times, since its intrinsic nature would not deteriorate, it would see even its own nature.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na /
translated: For in the world,

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin ni //
translated: the intrinsic nature of all things

original: dang por bdag la snang 'gyur na //
analyzed: dang por bdag la snang 'gyur na //
translated: first appears to itself.

original: mig ni mig nyid kyis 'dzin pa //
analyzed: mig ni mig nyid kyis 'dzin pa //
translated: The eye is not apprehended by the eye itself.

original: gang zhig gis ni 'gyur ma yin //üîΩgal te ji ltar me tog tsam pa ka dang autpala la sogs pa dag gi dri bsrung dang por rang gi rten nyid la dmigs te /
analyzed: gang zhig gis ni 'gyur ma yin // gal te ji ltar me tog tsam pa ka dang autpala la sogs pa dag gi dri bsrung dang por rang gi rten nyid la dmigs te /
translated: But how could it see itself?

original: phyis de dag phrad pa las til la sogs pa dag la yang yin pa dang / yang ji ltar rang la gnas pa'i me'i tsha ba de dang 'brel pa las gzhan gyi bdag nyid la dmigs pa de bzhin du mig lta ba'i rang bzhin du gyur na ni de'i tshe de rang gi bdag nyid kho na la lta bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyis de dag phrad pa las til la sogs pa dag la yang yin pa dang / yang ji ltar rang la gnas pa'i me'i tsha ba de dang 'brel pa las gzhan gyi bdag nyid la dmigs pa de bzhin du mig lta ba'i rang bzhin du gyur na ni de'i tshe de rang gi bdag nyid kho na la lta bar 'gyur te /
translated: If, for example, the fragrance of such things as champakka and utpala flowers first observes its own support and later, through contact with those flowers, it is also in sesame seeds and so on, and if, just as the heat of fire that abides in itself is observed in other things through contact with them, in the same way, if the eye were the nature of seeing, then at that time it would see its own nature.

original: ci'i phyir mig mig nyid kyis 'dzin par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mig mig nyid kyis 'dzin par mi 'gyur /
translated: Why does the eye not apprehend eye itself?

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yang ches dang por rang gi bdag nyid la yod pa'i phyir mig kho nas mig 'dzin par rigs na mig ni rang gi bdag nyid la blta ba yang ma yin pas bong ba la sogs pa ltar gzhan la lta ba yang ma
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yang ches dang por rang gi bdag nyid la yod pa'i phyir mig kho nas mig 'dzin par rigs na mig ni rang gi bdag nyid la blta ba yang ma yin pas bong ba la sogs pa ltar gzhan la lta ba yang ma
translated: Since the nature of things exists in its own nature from the very beginning, it is logical that the eye itself apprehends the eye, but since the eye does not see its own nature, it does not see other things, like a lump of clay and so on.

original: yin pas de la mi srid do //üîΩgang zhig mig @204a * //
analyzed: yin pas de la mi srid do // gang zhig mig @204a * //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible.

original: 'ba' zhig la gzugs lta ba'i nus pa med kyi /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig la gzugs lta ba'i nus pa med kyi /
translated: If you think that the eye alone does not have the power to see form,

original: 'on kyang mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa gsum tshogs pa yod dang gzugs mthong bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa de yang snying po med de /
analyzed: 'on kyang mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa gsum tshogs pa yod dang gzugs mthong bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa de yang snying po med de /
translated: but that the coming together of the three‚Äîthe eye, form, and eye consciousness‚Äîsees form, that is also worthless.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩmig la rnam shes yod min zhing ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir / mig la rnam shes yod min zhing ;
translated: Why is that?üîΩThe eye does not have consciousness.

original: / rnam par shes pa lta med la //
analyzed: / rnam par shes pa lta med la //
translated: Consciousness does not have eyes.

original: gnyi ga gzugs la yod min na //
analyzed: gnyi ga gzugs la yod min na //
translated: The two do not exist in form.

original: de dag gis gzugs ji ltar mthong //
analyzed: de dag gis gzugs ji ltar mthong //
translated: How can they see form?

original: de la re zhig mig la rnam par shes pa med do /üîΩmig gis ni yul rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig mig la rnam par shes pa med do / mig gis ni yul rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: First, the eye does not have consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye does not cognize objects because it is not by nature consciousness.

original: mig ni 'byung ba las gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: mig ni 'byung ba las gyur pa yin te /
translated: The eye is a product of the elements.

original: bems po yin pas de la yul rtog pa mi srid do //üîΩde ltar na mig la rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: bems po yin pas de la yul rtog pa mi srid do // de ltar na mig la rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: Since it is matter, it is impossible for it to cognize objects.üîΩThus, the eye does not have consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa la yang mig med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la yang mig med do //
translated: Consciousness does not have eyes.

original: de ni gzugs can ma yin pa zhig ste /
analyzed: de ni gzugs can ma yin pa zhig ste /
translated: It is not material.

original: de la lta ba ga la yod de med pas na long ba ltar mi mthong ngo ;
analyzed: de la lta ba ga la yod de med pas na long ba ltar mi mthong ngo ;
translated: How can it see? It cannot see, like the blind.

original: / gzugs la ni gnyi ga yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / gzugs la ni gnyi ga yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But form is not like that, for both are present in it.

original: rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not consciousness,

original: rtog pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not by nature a thinker.

original: lta ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lta ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not seeing,

original: lta ba ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not by nature seeing.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams don phan tshun ma tshang ba de'i tshe de dag tshogs par yod kyang de dag gis gzugs mthong ba ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams don phan tshun ma tshang ba de'i tshe de dag tshogs par yod kyang de dag gis gzugs mthong ba ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: When the faculties, objects, and consciousnesses are mutually incomplete in meaning in this way, even when they are assembled, they do not see form,

original: gzugs lta ba'i yan lag ma tshang ba'i phyir long ba'i tshogs bzhin no snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: gzugs lta ba'i yan lag ma tshang ba'i phyir long ba'i tshogs bzhin no snyam du dgongs so //
translated: because the component of seeing form is incomplete, like a group of blind people.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar gzugs la lta ba med pa de'i tshe de nyid rigs pa su zhig gis gzugs mthong ngo zhes bya bar brjod pa'am lta bar 'os /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar gzugs la lta ba med pa de'i tshe de nyid rigs pa su zhig gis gzugs mthong ngo zhes bya bar brjod pa'am lta bar 'os /
translated: When there is no seeing of form in this way, then what is reasonable for someone to say, ‚ÄúI see form,‚Äù or to say, ‚ÄúI see‚Äù?

original: ji ltar de kho na nyid rig pas gzugs lta bar mi 'os pa de bzhin du sgra yang mnyan par mi 'os te /
analyzed: ji ltar de kho na nyid rig pas gzugs lta bar mi 'os pa de bzhin du sgra yang mnyan par mi 'os te /
translated: Just as it is not reasonable to see form through the knowledge of reality, in the same way, it is not reasonable to hear sound,

original: gzugs lta ba bzhin sgra nyan pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di na gal te sgra thos na de nyan pa'i yul du phyin pa'am ma phyin pa zhig thos grang na /
analyzed: gzugs lta ba bzhin sgra nyan pa yang med pa'i phyir ro // 'di na gal te sgra thos na de nyan pa'i yul du phyin pa'am ma phyin pa zhig thos grang na /
translated: because there is no hearing of sound like the seeing of form.üîΩIf sound is heard here, is it heard after it has gone to the domain of hearing or without going?

original: gal te re zhig phyin te thos na de nyan pa'i yul du 'gro ba na sgra 'byin zhing 'gro ba'am sgra med pa yin /
analyzed: gal te re zhig phyin te thos na de nyan pa'i yul du 'gro ba na sgra 'byin zhing 'gro ba'am sgra med pa yin /
translated: If, first, it is heard after it has gone to the domain of hearing, then when it goes to the domain of hearing, does it go making sound or without sound?

original: de yang gal te rtog pa dang po yin na ni de'i tshe gal te smra zhing sgra 'gro na /
analyzed: de yang gal te rtog pa dang po yin na ni de'i tshe gal te smra zhing sgra 'gro na /
translated: If, first, it is imagined that it goes making sound, then at that time, if it goes making sound,

original: gang gis smra ba por mi @204b 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis smra ba por mi @204b 'gyur //
translated: by what does the speaker not become nonexistent?

original: 'on te mi smra bar 'gro na'ang //
analyzed: 'on te mi smra bar 'gro na'ang //
translated: But if it goes without speaking,

original: gang gis de la shes pa skye //
analyzed: gang gis de la shes pa skye //
translated: by what does the cognition of it arise?

original: de'i phyir smra ba po yin pa'i phyir lha sbyin ltar sgrar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir smra ba po yin pa'i phyir lha sbyin ltar sgrar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because it is a speaker, it is not sound, like Devadatta.

original: ci ste mi smra bar 'gro na ni de'i tshe sgra med par 'gro ba'i sgra de la 'di ni sgra'o snyam du nges par su zhig la 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste mi smra bar 'gro na ni de'i tshe sgra med par 'gro ba'i sgra de la 'di ni sgra'o snyam du nges par su zhig la 'gyur /
translated: But if it goes without speaking, then when sound is absent, who would ascertain that sound is present, thinking, This is sound?

original: ma bzung ba de ni yod pa nyid kyang ma yin pas 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: ma bzung ba de ni yod pa nyid kyang ma yin pas 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: Since it is not apprehended, it does not exist. This is illogical.

original: gzhan yang / gal te phrad de sgra 'dzin na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te phrad de sgra 'dzin na //
translated: Moreover, if sound is apprehended after contact,

original: sgra yi dang po gang gis 'dzin //
analyzed: sgra yi dang po gang gis 'dzin //
translated: then by what is the first sound apprehended?

original: sgra ni rkyang pa'ang mi 'ong na //
analyzed: sgra ni rkyang pa'ang mi 'ong na //
translated: If a solitary sound does not occur,

original: reng bu ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: reng bu ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: how could a series of sounds be apprehended?

original: gal te rna ba'i dbang po'i gnas su phyin pa'i sgra 'dzin na 'o na ni de'i dbang po gang gis 'dzin //
analyzed: gal te rna ba'i dbang po'i gnas su phyin pa'i sgra 'dzin na 'o na ni de'i dbang po gang gis 'dzin //
translated: If sound is apprehended after it reaches the site of the ear sense faculty, then by what sense faculty is it apprehended?

original: phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir rna ba la ni sgra'i dang por 'dzin pa med la /
analyzed: phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir rna ba la ni sgra'i dang por 'dzin pa med la /
translated: Since it is apprehended after contact, the ear does not apprehend the first sound.

original: de'i 'dzin par byed pa'i dbang po gzhan yang yod pa ma yin pas 'di dbang po gang gis kyang mi 'dzin no //
analyzed: de'i 'dzin par byed pa'i dbang po gzhan yang yod pa ma yin pas 'di dbang po gang gis kyang mi 'dzin no //
translated: Since there is no other sense faculty that apprehends it, it is not apprehended by any sense faculty.

original: de'i phyir ma bzung ba'i don de ni sgra nyid du mi 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma bzung ba'i don de ni sgra nyid du mi 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, the meaning that is not grasped is not sound itself.

original: sgra'i rdul phra rab ni rdzas dgu'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra ni rkyang par mi 'ong na /
analyzed: sgra'i rdul phra rab ni rdzas dgu'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra ni rkyang par mi 'ong na /
translated: Since the subtle particle of sound has the nature of nine substances, sound does not come alone.

original: khyod kyis ni sgra tsam zhig kho na rna bas 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: khyod kyis ni sgra tsam zhig kho na rna bas 'dzin gyi /
translated: But you say that the ear grasps only sound,

original: dri la sogs pa dag ni ma yin no zhes te mi rigs so //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa dag ni ma yin no zhes te mi rigs so //
translated: not smell and so on. This is unreasonable.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na sgra yang mi 'dzin par 'gyur ba'am //üîΩyang na dri la sogs pa dag kyang zung shig /'di ni de ltar yang ma yin pas sgra phrad pa'i yul nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na sgra yang mi 'dzin par 'gyur ba'am // yang na dri la sogs pa dag kyang zung shig /'di ni de ltar yang ma yin pas sgra phrad pa'i yul nyid ma yin no //
translated: Or else, sound also would not be grasped,

original: ci ste / gal te phrad de sgra 'dzin na //üîΩsgra yi dang po gang gis 'dzin //
analyzed: ci ste / gal te phrad de sgra 'dzin na // sgra yi dang po gang gis 'dzin //
translated: or else, you should grasp smell and so on. Since this is not the case, sound is not an object that comes into contact.

original: zhes gang smras na /
analyzed: zhes gang smras na /
translated: But if you say,üîΩIf it grasps sound through contact,üîΩwhat grasps the first sound?

original: gal te de'i dang po ma bzung na de'i tshe nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de'i dang po ma bzung na de'i tshe nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong if the first sound is not grasped?

original: gang zhig de'i sgra nyid nyams par 'gyur ba 'di ni nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig de'i sgra nyid nyams par 'gyur ba 'di ni nyes pa yin no //
translated: The fault is that the sound itself is impaired.

original: 'di ltar / ji srid sgra thos ma gyur pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ji srid sgra thos ma gyur pa //
translated: As long as the sound is not heard,

original: de yi bar du sgrar mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi bar du sgrar mi 'gyur //
translated: in the interim it is not sound.

original: sgra med pa yang mthar sgra nyid //
analyzed: sgra med pa yang mthar sgra nyid //
translated: And in the end, the non-sound becomes sound.

original: 'gyur na de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'gyur na de ni mi rigs so //
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: gang zhig mi thos pa de ni thos bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir dri la sogs pa ltar sgra nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig mi thos pa de ni thos bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir dri la sogs pa ltar sgra nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is not heard is not sound, like smell and so on, because it is not being heard.

original: ci ste gang zhig gi tshe thos pa de'i tshe sgrar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste gang zhig gi tshe thos pa de'i tshe sgrar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that when it is heard, at that time it becomes sound,

original: 'di yang srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang srid pa ma yin no //
translated: that is not possible.

original: dri la sogs pa phyis sgra nyid du mthong ba ni ma yin te de bzhin du sgra med pa 'di yang phyis sgra nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa phyis sgra nyid du mthong ba ni ma yin te de bzhin du sgra med pa 'di yang phyis sgra nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: Smell and so on are not seen later to be sound, and in the same way, it is not reasonable that this non-sound later becomes sound.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /üîΩyid du @205a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis / yid du @205a * //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said:

original: 'ong ba'i sgra gang thos gyur pa //
analyzed: 'ong ba'i sgra gang thos gyur pa //
translated: Whatever pleasant sounds are heard,

original: de ni nam yang nang du zhugs pa med //
analyzed: de ni nam yang nang du zhugs pa med //
translated: they never enter the inner

original: de yi 'pho ba rnyed par mi 'gyur mod //
analyzed: de yi 'pho ba rnyed par mi 'gyur mod //
translated: and the movement of that is not found.

original: rtog pa'i dbang gis sgra ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dbang gis sgra ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Sound arises through the power of conception.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: dper na shing dang rgyud la brten byas la //
analyzed: dper na shing dang rgyud la brten byas la //
translated: For example, in dependence on a tree and a vine,

original: lag pas rtsol ba byas pa gsum tshogs na //üîΩsgrogs byed pi wang gling bu la sogs pa //
analyzed: lag pas rtsol ba byas pa gsum tshogs na // sgrogs byed pi wang gling bu la sogs pa //
translated: and the effort of the hand, the three come together,üîΩand from that sound arises

original: de dag las ni sgra yang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag las ni sgra yang 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: from such things as a drum, flute, and so on.

original: de nas mkhas pa la las brtag bya ste //
analyzed: de nas mkhas pa la las brtag bya ste //
translated: Then some wise person would investigate,

original: de ni gang nas 'ongs la gar song zhes //
analyzed: de ni gang nas 'ongs la gar song zhes //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere did it come from? Where did it go?‚Äù

original: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams kun du brtag byas na //
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams kun du brtag byas na //
translated: Having investigated in all directions and subdirections,

original: sgra yi 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sgra yi 'gro ba'am 'ong ba mi dmigs so //
translated: the going and coming of sound is not observed.

original: zhes ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it has been said.

original: de ltar re zhig dbang po rnams la yul 'dzin pa'i nus pa med par brjod nas yid la yang yul de 'dzin pa'i nus pa med par brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dbang po rnams la yul 'dzin pa'i nus pa med par brjod nas yid la yang yul de 'dzin pa'i nus pa med par brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Thus, having said that the sense faculties do not have the capacity to apprehend objects, in order to say that the mind also does not have the capacity to apprehend objects, the text says:

original: dbang po rnams dang bral sems kyis //
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang bral sems kyis //
translated: The mind that is devoid of the sense faculties

original: song ste'ang ci zhig byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: song ste'ang ci zhig byed par 'gyur //
translated: has gone, but what will it do?

original: gal te sems yul gyi yul du song nas yul yongs su gcod par byed do snyam du rtog na de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: gal te sems yul gyi yul du song nas yul yongs su gcod par byed do snyam du rtog na de ni mi rigs so //
translated: If you think that the mind goes to the object-field of the object-field, then it is not tenable that it apprehends the object-field.

original: 'di na sems 'di dbang po dang lhan cig pa zhig yul gyi yul du 'gro'am /
analyzed: 'di na sems 'di dbang po dang lhan cig pa zhig yul gyi yul du 'gro'am /
translated: In this regard, does the mind, together with the sense faculty, go to the object-field?

original: reng bu zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: reng bu zhig yin grang na /
translated: Or does the mind alone go?

original: de la re zhig dbang po dang bcas pa ni mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig dbang po dang bcas pa ni mi 'gro ste /
translated: In this regard, first, it is not tenable that the mind together with the sense faculty goes.

original: dbang po rnams ni rtag tu lus kho na la nye bar gnas pa'i phyir la 'gro ba yin na lus dbang po med pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni rtag tu lus kho na la nye bar gnas pa'i phyir la 'gro ba yin na lus dbang po med pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the sense faculties always remain in the body, and if they went, it would follow that the body would be without sense faculties.

original: ci ste / reng bu 'gro na de'i tshe yang //
analyzed: ci ste / reng bu 'gro na de'i tshe yang //
translated: But if you think that the mind alone goes, then in that case,

original: dbang po rnams dang bral sems kyis //
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang bral sems kyis //
translated: the mind, devoid of sense faculties,

original: song ste 'ang ci zhig byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: song ste 'ang ci zhig byed par 'gyur //
translated: having gone, what will it do?

original: mig la sogs pa dbang po'i sgo spangs pa de la ni gzugs la sogs pa lta ba la sogs pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dbang po'i sgo spangs pa de la ni gzugs la sogs pa lta ba la sogs pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For it is not tenable that the mind alone, devoid of the sense faculties such as the eyes, has the capacity to see form and so on.

original: long ba la sogs pa rnams la yang lta ba la sogs pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: long ba la sogs pa rnams la yang lta ba la sogs pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It follows that even the blind would see, and so on.

original: ci ste yang ci zhig ltar 'di la yang yul gyi yul du 'gro bas don dmigs par rtog na de'i tshe na yang don rtogs pa mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste yang ci zhig ltar 'di la yang yul gyi yul du 'gro bas don dmigs par rtog na de'i tshe na yang don rtogs pa mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you imagine that the object is perceived because the object goes to the sense faculty, then even then, because the object‚Äôs realization is endless, it would not return.

original: de ltar yin dang srog 'di ni //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang srog 'di ni //
translated: If that were so, this life

original: rtag tu yid med ci ste min //
analyzed: rtag tu yid med ci ste min //
translated: would be without mind, wouldn‚Äôt it?

original: dus thams cad du bdag sems med pa kho nar 'gyur na /
analyzed: dus thams cad du bdag sems med pa kho nar 'gyur na /
translated: At all times, the self would be without mind.

original: sems med pa ni bdag nyid du srid par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sems med pa ni bdag nyid du srid par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not reasonable for the mindless to exist as a self,

original: ka ba dang bum pa @205b la sogs pa rnams kyang bdag nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ka ba dang bum pa @205b la sogs pa rnams kyang bdag nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that pillars, pots, and so on would also be selves.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rigs pas rnam par dpyad pa na dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams la yod pa'i ngo bo med pas rang gi ngo bos grub pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rigs pas rnam par dpyad pa na dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams la yod pa'i ngo bo med pas rang gi ngo bos grub pa med do //
translated: Therefore, when one analyzes in this way using reasoning, since the sense faculties, objects, and consciousnesses do not have an existent essence, they do not exist essentially.

original: gal te 'di rnams rang gi ngo bos grub par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'thad pas rnam par dpyad pa rnams ches gsal bar ji ltar gnas pa'i ngo bos yod pa nyid du dmigs par 'gyur na dmigs pa yang ma yin te de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis stong
analyzed: gal te 'di rnams rang gi ngo bos grub par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'thad pas rnam par dpyad pa rnams ches gsal bar ji ltar gnas pa'i ngo bos yod pa nyid du dmigs par 'gyur na dmigs pa yang ma yin te de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis stong
translated: If these things existed essentially, then when they are analyzed by reasonings, they would be clearly seen to exist by virtue of their own nature, but they are not so seen. Therefore, they are empty of essential existence.

original: ngo zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: ngo zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Thus it is established that they are empty of essence.

original: gal te de rnams la rang bzhin med na 'o na gang zhig bye brag rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu nyid du ston pa de rnams kyi khyad par yongs su gcod par byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'du shes ko ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de rnams la rang bzhin med na 'o na gang zhig bye brag rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu nyid du ston pa de rnams kyi khyad par yongs su gcod par byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'du shes ko ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If they have no essence, then what is the cause of their classification into different types? How can there be a conception that has the nature of discerning their differences?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: dngos po rnams yod na ni /
analyzed: dngos po rnams yod na ni /
translated: If things existed,

original: de rnams kyi bye brag yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'du shes rigs na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi bye brag yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'du shes rigs na /
translated: then it would make sense for there to be a conception that has the nature of discerning their differences.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po de rnams yod pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po de rnams yod pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa de'i tshe /
translated: But when it is shown that those things do not exist,

original: de rnams kyi sgo nas 'du shes de rang gi ngo bos grub par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sgo nas 'du shes de rang gi ngo bos grub par ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could that perception exist by way of its own entity through those?

original: gal te yul yongs su gcod pa 'di rnam pa thams cad du med dam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yul yongs su gcod pa 'di rnam pa thams cad du med dam zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúIs the determination of the object completely nonexistent?‚Äù

original: med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonexistent.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i dngos pos yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i dngos pos yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things that lack intrinsic nature exist.üîΩThus:üîΩThe mind apprehends the object

original: 'di ltar / sngar mthong ba yi don gang zhig / yid kyis smig rgyu ltar 'dzin pa //üîΩde ni chos kun rnam gzhag la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sngar mthong ba yi don gang zhig / yid kyis smig rgyu ltar 'dzin pa // de ni chos kun rnam gzhag la //
translated: That was seen before, like a mirage.

original: 'du shes phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the perception aggregate.

original: 'di na mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes nas 'gag pa na dbang po dang yul rnams dang lhan cig 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di na mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes nas 'gag pa na dbang po dang yul rnams dang lhan cig 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, when the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form and then ceases, it ceases together with the faculties and objects.

original: de 'gags na sngar mthong ba'i don gang yin pa de nyid phyis yid kyis 'dzin to //
analyzed: de 'gags na sngar mthong ba'i don gang yin pa de nyid phyis yid kyis 'dzin to //
translated: When it ceases, the mind later apprehends that very object that was seen before.

original: yang ji ltar nye ba ma yin pa la 'dzin pa srid ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar nye ba ma yin pa la 'dzin pa srid ce na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow is it possible to apprehend something that is not present?‚Äù

original: smig rgyu ltar zhes bya ba smros te /
analyzed: smig rgyu ltar zhes bya ba smros te /
translated: The text says ‚Äúlike a mirage.‚Äù

original: smig rgyu la chu bag tsam kyang med mod kyi /üîΩ'on kyang rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis chu'i rnam pa can gyi 'du shes 'byung ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du smig rgyu la bya ba ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po gzung zin pa la yang gang rnam par rtog pa can
analyzed: smig rgyu la chu bag tsam kyang med mod kyi / 'on kyang rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis chu'i rnam pa can gyi 'du shes 'byung ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du smig rgyu la bya ba ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po gzung zin pa la yang gang rnam par rtog pa can
translated: Although there is not even a drop of water in a mirage,üîΩnevertheless, due to the power of causes and conditions, the perception of the form of water arises.

original: gyi rnam par shes pa skye ba de ni chos thams cad rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gyi rnam par shes pa skye ba de ni chos thams cad rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: In the same way, when a thing that is not inherently existent like a mirage is grasped, the conceptual consciousness that arises is the cause for positing all phenomena.

original: chos thams @206a * //
analyzed: chos thams @206a * //
translated: All phenomena are posited

original: cad rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir na de nyid la 'du shes phung po zhes bsnyad de /
analyzed: cad rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir na de nyid la 'du shes phung po zhes bsnyad de /
translated: because of being the cause for positing all phenomena, it is called the aggregate of perception.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i 'du shes kyi khyad par dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i 'du shes kyi khyad par dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is concomitant with the special perception of that type.

original: chos thams cad kyi rnam par gzhag pa yang 'du shes kyi dbang gis shes par bya ba'i dngos po rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu can ni ma yin te rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rnam par gzhag pa yang 'du shes kyi dbang gis shes par bya ba'i dngos po rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu can ni ma yin te rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The arrangement of all phenomena is not due to the intrinsic reality of things that are to be known by the power of perception, because intrinsic reality is impossible in every respect.

original: gal te de lta na ni 'o na 'du shes kyi phung po rang bzhin gyis yod pa yin te de med na ni chos thams cad rnam par gzhag par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni 'o na 'du shes kyi phung po rang bzhin gyis yod pa yin te de med na ni chos thams cad rnam par gzhag par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the aggregate of perception exists essentially, because if it did not exist, it would be impossible to arrange all phenomena.

original: brjod par bya ste /üîΩ'du shes de yang rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa de ma gtogs par med la /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste / 'du shes de yang rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa de ma gtogs par med la /
translated: We reply:üîΩThat perception also does not exist essentially, because it is concomitant with consciousness, and apart from that consciousness it does not exist.

original: rnam par shes pa de yang 'du shes de ma gtogs par ma grub pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bos med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de yang 'du shes de ma gtogs par ma grub pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bos med do //
translated: And that consciousness also does not exist essentially, because apart from that perception it is not established.

original: 'di las kyang yin te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang yin te /
translated: This is also shown by the following.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because the mind arises

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas yid //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas yid //
translated: In dependence on the eye and form,

original: sgyu ma bzhin du skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin du skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Like an illusion.

original: gang zhig skye bar bya ba'i rten nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa de skye ba'i snga rol na ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig skye bar bya ba'i rten nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa de skye ba'i snga rol na ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness that occurs as the very basis for that which is to arise does not exist prior to arising.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams yod kyang rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo med par skye ba'i bya ba mi 'jug pa'i phyir skye ba mi rigs na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams yod kyang rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo med par skye ba'i bya ba mi 'jug pa'i phyir skye ba mi rigs na /
translated: If it is illogical for consciousness to arise because the activity of arising does not occur without the essence of consciousness even when the conditions such as the eye exist,

original: rnam par shes pa 'di ni skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di ni skye ba ma yin no //
translated: then this consciousness does not arise.

original: de'i phyir sgyu ma'i chos nyid las ma gtogs par ci zhig nges par bya bar nus /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgyu ma'i chos nyid las ma gtogs par ci zhig nges par bya bar nus /
translated: Therefore, what can be ascertained other than the reality of illusion?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said:üîΩ‚ÄúMonks, for example, a magician or a magician‚Äôs apprentice displays various magical creations at a crossroads, such as an army of elephants, horses, and chariots,

original: dge slong dag dper na sgyu ma mkhan nam sgyu ma'i mchan bu zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor sgyu ma'i las rnam pa sna tshogs ston pa 'di lta ste glang po che'i tshogs dang rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs dang zhes rgyu cher 'byung zhing /
analyzed: dge slong dag dper na sgyu ma mkhan nam sgyu ma'i mchan bu zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor sgyu ma'i las rnam pa sna tshogs ston pa 'di lta ste glang po che'i tshogs dang rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs dang zhes rgyu cher 'byung zhing /
translated: and so on.

original: de skyes bu mig dang ldan pa zhig lta bar byed sems par byed tshul bzhin du yongs su rtog par byed pa na lta zhing sems la tshul bzhin du yongs su rtog pa de la yod pa ma yin par yang snang /
analyzed: de skyes bu mig dang ldan pa zhig lta bar byed sems par byed tshul bzhin du yongs su rtog par byed pa na lta zhing sems la tshul bzhin du yongs su rtog pa de la yod pa ma yin par yang snang /
translated: When a person with eyes looks at it, thinks about it, and properly investigates it, it appears to that person who looks, thinks, and properly investigates it to be inexistent.

original: gsog dang gsob dang snying po med par yang snang ngo //
analyzed: gsog dang gsob dang snying po med par yang snang ngo //
translated: It appears to be hollow, false, and without essence.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ci sgyu ma byas pa de la snying po lta yod dam /üîΩdge slong dag de bzhin du rnam par shes pa @206b gang ci yang rung ba 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'am nang gi'am phyi'i'am /üîΩrags pa'am phra ba'am /
analyzed: ci sgyu ma byas pa de la snying po lta yod dam / dge slong dag de bzhin du rnam par shes pa @206b gang ci yang rung ba 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'am nang gi'am phyi'i'am / rags pa'am phra ba'am /
translated: Is there any essence to that illusory creation?‚Äù

original: ngan pa'am gya nom pa'am thag ring po na yod pa gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: ngan pa'am gya nom pa'am thag ring po na yod pa gang yin pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúBhik·π£us, in the same way, whatever consciousness there is‚Äîwhether it is past, future, or present, internal or external, gross or subtle, inferior or superior, far or near‚Äî

original: nye ba na yod pa gang yin pa de dge slong zhig lta bar byed /
analyzed: nye ba na yod pa gang yin pa de dge slong zhig lta bar byed /
translated: whatever consciousness there is, a bhik·π£u looks at it,

original: sems par byed tshul bzhin du yongs su rtog par byed pa de la yod pa ma yin par yang snang /
analyzed: sems par byed tshul bzhin du yongs su rtog par byed pa de la yod pa ma yin par yang snang /
translated: thinks about it, and properly investigates it. It appears to that bhik·π£u who looks at it, thinks about it, and properly investigates it to be inexistent.

original: gsog dang gsob dang snying po med pa dang nad dang 'bras dang / zug rngu dang sdig pa dang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med par yang snang ngo //
analyzed: gsog dang gsob dang snying po med pa dang nad dang 'bras dang / zug rngu dang sdig pa dang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med par yang snang ngo //
translated: It appears as a heap, as a fraud, as essenceless, as a disease, as a tumor, as a dart, as a calamity, as impermanent, as suffering, as empty, as selfless.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ci rnam par shes pa'i phung po 'di la snying po lta yod dam zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: ci rnam par shes pa'i phung po 'di la snying po lta yod dam zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúIs there any essence in this consciousness aggregate?‚Äù

original: ji ltar dmigs pa de ltar rnam par dpyad pa la rang gi ngo bos med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa sgyu ma'i na chung dang 'dra'o zhes bya bar nges par nus so //
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs pa de ltar rnam par dpyad pa la rang gi ngo bos med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa sgyu ma'i na chung dang 'dra'o zhes bya bar nges par nus so //
translated: Thus, just as it is observed, it is possible to ascertain that consciousness is like an illusory young woman, because it does not exist by way of its own nature.

original: de'i phyir / mig dang gzugs la brten nas yid //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mig dang gzugs la brten nas yid //
translated: Therefore, the statement,

original: sgyu ma bzhin du skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin du skye bar 'gyur //
translated: The mind arises like an illusion,üîΩin dependence on the eye and form,

original: zhes bya ba'i legs par gsungs pa yin no //üîΩyang gal te 'di'i rang gi ngo bo zhig du 'gyur na ni de'i tshe rang gi ngo bos /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i legs par gsungs pa yin no // yang gal te 'di'i rang gi ngo bo zhig du 'gyur na ni de'i tshe rang gi ngo bos /
translated: is a good statement.

original: gang la yod pa nyid yod de //
analyzed: gang la yod pa nyid yod de //
translated: Moreover, if it had an intrinsic reality, then at that time it would exist by way of its own nature.üîΩBut it does not exist by way of its own nature.

original: sgyu ma zhes byar mi rigs so //
analyzed: sgyu ma zhes byar mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical to call it an illusion.

original: rang bzhin gyis mi stong zhing yod par 'gyur ba'i bud med ni 'jig rten na sgyu ma zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis mi stong zhing yod par 'gyur ba'i bud med ni 'jig rten na sgyu ma zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
translated: A woman who is not empty of intrinsic nature and who exists is not logical to call an illusion in the world.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang rang gi ngo bos yod pas sgyu ma lta bur mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang rang gi ngo bos yod pas sgyu ma lta bur mi 'gyur na /
translated: Likewise, if consciousness does not become like an illusion because it exists by its own nature,

original: rnam par shes pa sgyu ma lta bur bstan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa sgyu ma lta bur bstan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: then it is not taught that consciousness is like an illusion.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa rang bzhin med do //
translated: Therefore consciousness is essenceless.

original: gang gi chos rnam par shes pa rang bzhin med pa de'i tshe rang bzhin med pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes kyang rang bzhin med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: gang gi chos rnam par shes pa rang bzhin med pa de'i tshe rang bzhin med pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes kyang rang bzhin med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: When consciousness is essenceless, then, just as consciousness is essenceless, so also the discriminations associated with it are essenceless.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said:

original: rab rdzogs shes pa don can gyi //
analyzed: rab rdzogs shes pa don can gyi //
translated: The perfect knower of the meaning

original: 'dzin la 'du shes nges par bstan //
analyzed: 'dzin la 'du shes nges par bstan //
translated: has taught that grasping is discrimination.

original: 'du shes de yang 'dzin med de //
analyzed: 'du shes de yang 'dzin med de //
translated: That discrimination is also ungraspable,

original: rnam par dben pa'i don gyis bstan //
analyzed: rnam par dben pa'i don gyis bstan //
translated: taught by the meaning of voidness.

original: rnam dben gang de'ang 'du shes te //
analyzed: rnam dben gang de'ang 'du shes te //
translated: And that is also a perception.

original: rnam dben gang de bstan pa yin //
analyzed: rnam dben gang de bstan pa yin //
translated: That is taught to be a disengagement.

original: de ltar don de bsam byas na //
analyzed: de ltar don de bsam byas na //
translated: When one thinks about that meaning in that way,

original: des na 'du shes 'byung mi @207a * //
analyzed: des na 'du shes 'byung mi @207a * //
translated: then perception does not arise.

original: 'gyur // 'du shes 'di yang spang snyam du //
analyzed: 'gyur // 'du shes 'di yang spang snyam du //
translated: When one thinks, ‚ÄúI will abandon this perception,‚Äù

original: gang la 'du shes 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: gang la 'du shes 'byung ba ni //
translated: wherever perception arises,

original: 'du shes spros la spyod 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: 'du shes spros la spyod 'gyur gyi //
translated: one will engage in the proliferation of perception.

original: 'du shes las ni grol mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'du shes las ni grol mi 'gyur //
translated: One will not be liberated from perception.

original: 'du shes 'di ko ga la 'byung //
analyzed: 'du shes 'di ko ga la 'byung //
translated: Where does this perception arise?

original: gang zhig gis ni 'du shes bkag / gang la 'du shes 'byung 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: gang zhig gis ni 'du shes bkag / gang la 'du shes 'byung 'gyur ba'i //
translated: By what is perception stopped?

original: chos ni sangs rgyas kyis ma brnyes //
analyzed: chos ni sangs rgyas kyis ma brnyes //
translated: The Buddha did not find a phenomenonüîΩwherever perception arises.

original: de ltar don de bsam byas na //
analyzed: de ltar don de bsam byas na //
translated: When one thinks about that meaning in that way,

original: de nas 'du shes 'byung mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas 'du shes 'byung mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: then perception does not arise.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: ci nas kyang dbang po rnams yul 'dzin pa mi srid pa mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa yang skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni ngo mtshar ba zhig go //
analyzed: ci nas kyang dbang po rnams yul 'dzin pa mi srid pa mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa yang skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni ngo mtshar ba zhig go //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is amazing that the Buddha said, ‚ÄòThe eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms,‚Äô even though it is impossible for the sense faculties to apprehend objects.‚Äù

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: ci 'di kho na ngo mtshar gyi gang 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa'i sa bon las myu gu 'byung bar mi rigs la sa bon la brten nas myu gu skye ba yang yin pa dang / de bzhin du byas shing bsags pa'i las 'gags nas yun shin tu ring por lon pa la 'gar yang gnas pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: ci 'di kho na ngo mtshar gyi gang 'gags pa dang 'gag bzhin pa'i sa bon las myu gu 'byung bar mi rigs la sa bon la brten nas myu gu skye ba yang yin pa dang / de bzhin du byas shing bsags pa'i las 'gags nas yun shin tu ring por lon pa la 'gar yang gnas pa med mod kyi /
translated: Similarly, although karma that is done and accumulated ceases and a very long time transpires without it remaining anywhere,

original: 'on kyang 'gags nas bskal pa du mas chod pa'i las las kyang 'bras bu dngos su 'byung ba dang bum pa la sogs pa rnams rang gi rgyu las de nyid dang gzhan du rnam pa lngar dpyad pa na yod pa ma yin mod kyi ;
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gags nas bskal pa du mas chod pa'i las las kyang 'bras bu dngos su 'byung ba dang bum pa la sogs pa rnams rang gi rgyu las de nyid dang gzhan du rnam pa lngar dpyad pa na yod pa ma yin mod kyi ;
translated: the effect of karma that has ceased and been interrupted by many eons can directly arise. Although pots and so on do not exist in the five ways when analyzed in terms of being the same as or different from their causes,

original: de lta na yang brten nas brtags pas sbrang rtsi dang chu dang 'o ma 'dzin pa dang 'chu ba la sogs pa'i bya ba la rung bar 'gyur ba 'di ci ngo mtshar ba zhig gam /
analyzed: de lta na yang brten nas brtags pas sbrang rtsi dang chu dang 'o ma 'dzin pa dang 'chu ba la sogs pa'i bya ba la rung bar 'gyur ba 'di ci ngo mtshar ba zhig gam /
translated: it is still possible to engage in actions such as collecting honey, water, and milk. Is this not amazing?

original: de'i phyir de ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gang tshe mkhas las stengs na //
analyzed: gang tshe mkhas las stengs na //
translated: When the wise examine this,

original: ngo mtshar can min cang med pa //
analyzed: ngo mtshar can min cang med pa //
translated: What is there to be amazed at in that?

original: de tshe dbang rtogs de 'dra ba //
analyzed: de tshe dbang rtogs de 'dra ba //
translated: At that time, the understanding of the power of the cause is like that.

original: ya mtshan zhes bya ci zhig yod //
analyzed: ya mtshan zhes bya ci zhig yod //
translated: What is there to be amazed at in that?

original: 'bras bu ni rang gi rgyu'i rjes su byed par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rang gi rgyu'i rjes su byed par mthong ste /
translated: The effect is seen to conform to its cause.

original: dper na ba lang las ba lang dang / rta las rta dang / s'a lu las s'a lu zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu yin na /
analyzed: dper na ba lang las ba lang dang / rta las rta dang / s'a lu las s'a lu zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu yin na /
translated: For example, a cow from a cow, a horse from a horse, rice from rice, and so on.

original: 'byung ba rnams dang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa rnams la ni tshul 'di mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams dang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa rnams la ni tshul 'di mi rigs so //
translated: But this is not the case for the primary elements and form, sound, etc.

original: 'di ltar 'byung ba chen po dag ni lus kyi dbang pos gzang bar bya ba yin zhing mnyan par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung ba chen po dag ni lus kyi dbang pos gzang bar bya ba yin zhing mnyan par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: For the primary elements are grasped by the body faculty and are not heard.

original: de dag las gzugs mig gis gzung bar bya ba dang / mnyan par bya ba skra 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di ni mchog tu ngo mtshar ba zhig go //
analyzed: de dag las gzugs mig gis gzung bar bya ba dang / mnyan par bya ba skra 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di ni mchog tu ngo mtshar ba zhig go //
translated: But from them, form is grasped by the eye faculty and is heard, such as the sound of hair growing. This is the most amazing thing.

original: de bzhin du sna la @207b sogs pa'i yul dang mig la sogs pa dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sna la @207b sogs pa'i yul dang mig la sogs pa dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the object of the nose faculty, etc., and the eye faculty, etc., should be applied.

original: yang na dbang po rnams kyi don rtogs pa 'di ni ya mtshan gyi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na dbang po rnams kyi don rtogs pa 'di ni ya mtshan gyi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Or else, the understanding of the object by the sense faculties is not a cause of wonder.

original: gal te ngo mtshar ba 'di dbang po rnams kyi don rtogs pa 'ba' zhig kho na la 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te ngo mtshar ba 'di dbang po rnams kyi don rtogs pa 'ba' zhig kho na la 'gyur na ni /
translated: If this wonder were only the understanding of the object by the sense faculties,

original: de'i tshe 'di ya mtshan pa'i gnas su 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di ya mtshan pa'i gnas su 'gyur na /
translated: then it would be a cause of wonder.

original: gang gi tshe ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis mkhas pa rnams la 'gro ba thams cad mig 'phrul ltar ya mtshan gyi rgyu yin pa de'i tshe 'di ngo mtshar ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis mkhas pa rnams la 'gro ba thams cad mig 'phrul ltar ya mtshan gyi rgyu yin pa de'i tshe 'di ngo mtshar ba ma yin no //
translated: But when, in the manner explained above, the wise see that all things are like a magical creation, then it is not a cause of wonder.

original: srid par mi 'os pa cung zad cig phyogs 'gar gnas par dmigs pa ni ya mtshan du byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: srid par mi 'os pa cung zad cig phyogs 'gar gnas par dmigs pa ni ya mtshan du byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: A certain thing that is not possible in existence is observed to be located somewhere, and that is made a cause of wonder.

original: thams cad du mtshungs pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du mtshungs pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: But not when it is the same everywhere.

original: me'i tsha ba ya mtshan can gyi rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me'i tsha ba ya mtshan can gyi rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The heat of fire is not a cause of wonder.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rang gi ngo bo ma nges pas rkyen ji lta ba de lta de ltar rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir mkhas pa rnams la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rang gi ngo bo ma nges pas rkyen ji lta ba de lta de ltar rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir mkhas pa rnams la /
translated: Therefore, for the wise,üîΩThe wheel of fire is like an emanation,üîΩA dream, an illusion, a moon in the water,

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo sprul pa dang // rmi lam sgyu ma chu zla dang // khug rna nang gi brag ca dang // smig rgyu sprin dang srid pa mtshungs //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo sprul pa dang // rmi lam sgyu ma chu zla dang // khug rna nang gi brag ca dang // smig rgyu sprin dang srid pa mtshungs //
translated: An echo in a canyon, a mirage, a cloud, and existence.

original: ji ltar med dang bcas pa'i yog pa myur du bskor ba'i 'gros de mthong ba phyin ci log gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'khor lo'i rnam par dmigs par 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar med dang bcas pa'i yog pa myur du bskor ba'i 'gros de mthong ba phyin ci log gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'khor lo'i rnam par dmigs par 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: When a firebrand is quickly rotated, the wise see the form of a wheel due to the cause of mistaken perception.üîΩHowever, the wheel does not exist in the slightest.

original: de la 'khor lo rang gi ngo bo bag tsam yang yod pa ma yin pa dang / ji ltar sprul pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rkyen las byung ba'i bud med dag yod par 'gyur ba'i bud med rnams ltar 'dod chags can rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyur 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la 'khor lo rang gi ngo bo bag tsam yang yod pa ma yin pa dang / ji ltar sprul pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rkyen las byung ba'i bud med dag yod par 'gyur ba'i bud med rnams ltar 'dod chags can rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyur 'gyur zhing /
translated: Just as women who arise from the conditions of the concentration of emanation become the cause of the affliction of desire for those who are desirous,

original: thub pa rnams kyis sprul pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i thub pa'i rang gi ngo bo med cing yod par gyur pa'i thub pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba rnams bden par gyur pa'i thub pa dag ltar skye bo ma lus pa'i yid kyi mun pa
analyzed: thub pa rnams kyis sprul pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i thub pa'i rang gi ngo bo med cing yod par gyur pa'i thub pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba rnams bden par gyur pa'i thub pa dag ltar skye bo ma lus pa'i yid kyi mun pa
translated: Just as the emanated beings of the buddhas, through the power of the concentration of emanation, are devoid of the nature of the emanated beings, and are devoid of the nature of the real buddhas, who are existent,

original: 'joms pa na sems can rnams kyi mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam gyi rgyur 'gyur la ;
analyzed: 'joms pa na sems can rnams kyi mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam gyi rgyur 'gyur la ;
translated: when they destroy the darkness of the minds of all beings, they become the cause of the path of high rebirth and definite goodness for sentient beings.

original: de rnams sems dang sems las byung ba dang bral bas bden par gyur pa ma yin pa dang / ji ltar sad pa'i bdag gi dngos po ltar gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i bdag gi dngos po'i rkyen can rmi lam gyi bdag gi dngos po @208a * //
analyzed: de rnams sems dang sems las byung ba dang bral bas bden par gyur pa ma yin pa dang / ji ltar sad pa'i bdag gi dngos po ltar gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i bdag gi dngos po'i rkyen can rmi lam gyi bdag gi dngos po @208a * //
translated: But since they are devoid of mind and mental factors, they are not real, and just as the state of self in the waking state, the state of self in dreams is conditioned by the self that possesses consciousness concomitant with sleep.

original: bdag la chags pa phyin ci log gi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: bdag la chags pa phyin ci log gi rgyu yin la /
translated: Attachment to self is the cause of error.

original: sad pas de ltar mthong ba med pas de bden par gyur pa yang ma yin pa dang / ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan gyi 'khrul 'khor gyi rgyu can sgyu mar byas pa'i na chung rnams bden par gyur pa'i na chung gis stong bzhin du de'i rang bzhin rnam par mi shes pa rnams kyis sems rmongs pa lhur byed par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: sad pas de ltar mthong ba med pas de bden par gyur pa yang ma yin pa dang / ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan gyi 'khrul 'khor gyi rgyu can sgyu mar byas pa'i na chung rnams bden par gyur pa'i na chung gis stong bzhin du de'i rang bzhin rnam par mi shes pa rnams kyis sems rmongs pa lhur byed par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: And just as the young women created by the magician‚Äôs illusions, which are based on the magician‚Äôs tools, are empty of being real young women, those who do not understand their nature will be deluded by them.

original: ji ltar bden par gyur pa'i zla bas stong pa'i chu'i zla ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i stobs kyis de ltar 'byung ba na byis pa rnams la zla bar phyin ci log pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar yul dang dus dang rgyu mtshan rnam pa de lta bu dag la brten nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i stobs nyid las khug rna byung ba na rgyang ring po na gnas pa rnams la bden par 'gyur ba'i du bar phyin ci log pa'i rgyur 'gyur
analyzed: ji ltar bden par gyur pa'i zla bas stong pa'i chu'i zla ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i stobs kyis de ltar 'byung ba na byis pa rnams la zla bar phyin ci log pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar yul dang dus dang rgyu mtshan rnam pa de lta bu dag la brten nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i stobs nyid las khug rna byung ba na rgyang ring po na gnas pa rnams la bden par 'gyur ba'i du bar phyin ci log pa'i rgyur 'gyur
translated: Just as smoke arises due to the power of dependent origination in dependence upon such things as a place, time, and a cause, it becomes the cause of the mistaken perception of real smoke for those who are far away.

original: ba dang / ji ltar ri'i tshang tshing dang / ri khrod kyi sul dang / rlung gi zabs rnams kyi nang gi brag cas skye bo rnams la yod par gyur pa'i sgrar mngon par rlom pa skyed par byed pa dang / ji ltar yul dang dus kyi khyad par du nye bar lhags pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi rten can gyi smig rgyu chu'i rang gi ngo bos dben bzhin du thag ring ba rnams la chur phyin ci log skyed par byed pa dang /
analyzed: ba dang / ji ltar ri'i tshang tshing dang / ri khrod kyi sul dang / rlung gi zabs rnams kyi nang gi brag cas skye bo rnams la yod par gyur pa'i sgrar mngon par rlom pa skyed par byed pa dang / ji ltar yul dang dus kyi khyad par du nye bar lhags pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi rten can gyi smig rgyu chu'i rang gi ngo bos dben bzhin du thag ring ba rnams la chur phyin ci log skyed par byed pa dang /
translated: Just as the sound of an echo arises in a canyon, in the interior of a mountain, in a cave, or in a valley, and causes beings to conceive of the presence of sound,üîΩjust as a mirage, which is based on the rays of the sun in a particular place and time, is devoid of the essence of water but causes those in the distance to mistakenly perceive it as water,

original: yang ji ltar sprin rnams thag ring po nas ri la sogs pa'i rnam par phyin ci log nye bar skyed par byed pa de bzhin du mkhas pa ji lta ba bzhin rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rang bzhin la bzo ba rnams la ma rig pa'i phyin ci
analyzed: yang ji ltar sprin rnams thag ring po nas ri la sogs pa'i rnam par phyin ci log nye bar skyed par byed pa de bzhin du mkhas pa ji lta ba bzhin rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rang bzhin la bzo ba rnams la ma rig pa'i phyin ci
translated: and just as clouds give rise to the mistaken perception of mountains and so on from a distance, in the same way, the wise, who understand the nature of dependent origination, will not be confused about the nature of things.

original: log gis 'phangs pa las kyi rkyen can gyi 'khor ba rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i skye ba phyi rol gyi snod dang bcas par skye bzhin pa mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa ltar /
analyzed: log gis 'phangs pa las kyi rkyen can gyi 'khor ba rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i skye ba phyi rol gyi snod dang bcas par skye bzhin pa mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa ltar /
translated: Samsara, which is projected by karma and propelled by error, is arising in the consciousness and so forth, along with the external environment. It is like the circle of a firebrand and so forth.üîΩIt is false and deceptive. Although it is essentially empty, it appears to deceive childish beings.

original: brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can yin dang rang bzhin gyis stor par gyur du zin kyang byis pa'i skye bo 'drid par snang bar 'gyur te dngos po'i rang bzhin shes pas rnam pa thams cad du chags pa zad pas rnam par grol ba la brten par 'gyur bar
analyzed: brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can yin dang rang bzhin gyis stor par gyur du zin kyang byis pa'i skye bo 'drid par snang bar 'gyur te dngos po'i rang bzhin shes pas rnam pa thams cad du chags pa zad pas rnam par grol ba la brten par 'gyur bar
translated: Those who know the nature of things will be completely free of attachment and will rely on complete liberation.

original: 'khor ba mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa ltar rang bzhin med do zhes bya ba 'di mi g-yo bar gnas so //
analyzed: 'khor ba mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa ltar rang bzhin med do zhes bya ba 'di mi g-yo bar gnas so //
translated: ‚ÄúSamsara is essenceless, like the circle of a firebrand and so forth.‚Äù This is unshakeable.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: ji ltar @208b mig ni 'khrul ba yis //
analyzed: ji ltar @208b mig ni 'khrul ba yis //
translated: Just as the eye, through error,

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo 'dzin byed pa //üîΩde bzhin dbang po rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo 'dzin byed pa // de bzhin dbang po rnams kyis ni //
translated: Seizes on a firebrand‚Äôs circle,üîΩSo the senses seize

original: da lta'i yul dag 'dzin par byed //
analyzed: da lta'i yul dag 'dzin par byed //
translated: On present objects.

original: ces bya ba dang / bden pa'i dge slong dngos bral dge slong gnyis shig gis //
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / bden pa'i dge slong dngos bral dge slong gnyis shig gis //
translated: The two monks, Satya and Bh≈´mija,

original: dkon mchog brtsegs las thub pa yongs su mya ngan ma 'das par //
analyzed: dkon mchog brtsegs las thub pa yongs su mya ngan ma 'das par //
translated: In the Heap of Jewels, the Buddha did not pass into parinirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: thub dbang zla ba'i dam pa'i chos kyi nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis //
analyzed: thub dbang zla ba'i dam pa'i chos kyi nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis //
translated: The light rays of the sun of the sublime Dharma of the lord of sages, the moon,

original: dge slong brgya phrag lnga de dag gi gti mug mun pa bsal //
analyzed: dge slong brgya phrag lnga de dag gi gti mug mun pa bsal //
translated: Eliminated the darkness of the five hundred monks.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly:

original: ji ltar bu mo gzhon nu'i rmi lam na //
analyzed: ji ltar bu mo gzhon nu'i rmi lam na //
translated: Just as a young girl in a dream

original: bu pho 'byung zhing shi ba des mthong nas //
analyzed: bu pho 'byung zhing shi ba des mthong nas //
translated: Gives birth to a son and then sees him die,

original: byung nas dga' zhing shi nas mi dga' ltar //
analyzed: byung nas dga' zhing shi nas mi dga' ltar //
translated: And she is happy when he is born and sad when he dies,

original: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes par gyis //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes par gyis //
translated: So should you understand all phenomena.

original: sgyu ma byed pa dag gis gzugs sprul te //
analyzed: sgyu ma byed pa dag gis gzugs sprul te //
translated: Illusionists conjure up forms

original: rta dang glang po shing rta sna tshogs byas //
analyzed: rta dang glang po shing rta sna tshogs byas //
translated: And create various horses, elephants, and chariots,

original: de la ji ltar snang ba gang yang med //
analyzed: de la ji ltar snang ba gang yang med //
translated: But none of them exist in the way they appear.

original: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes par gyis //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes par gyis //
translated: So should you understand all phenomena.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' dangs par zla shar ba //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' dangs par zla shar ba //
translated: Just as the moon shining in a clear sky

original: de yi gzugs brnyan dang ba'i tshor song ste //
analyzed: de yi gzugs brnyan dang ba'i tshor song ste //
translated: And the reflection of the moon appears in the water,

original: zla ba chu yi nang du 'phos pa med //
analyzed: zla ba chu yi nang du 'phos pa med //
translated: But the moon has not moved into the water.

original: chos kun mtshan nyid de 'drar shes par gyis //
analyzed: chos kun mtshan nyid de 'drar shes par gyis //
translated: Know that all phenomena are characterized in this way.üîΩJust as an echo arises in dependence

original: brag phug ri rdzong chu klung dogs dag tu //üîΩde dag la brten brag ca 'byung ji ltar //
analyzed: brag phug ri rdzong chu klung dogs dag tu // de dag la brten brag ca 'byung ji ltar //
translated: On a rocky cavern, a mountain fortress, or a river gorge,

original: de bzhin 'dus byas 'di kun shes par gyis //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dus byas 'di kun shes par gyis //
translated: So should you understand all conditioned things.

original: 'gro ba thams cad sgyu ma smig rgyu mtshungs //üîΩji ltar sos ka'i nyi ma phyed dus na //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad sgyu ma smig rgyu mtshungs // ji ltar sos ka'i nyi ma phyed dus na //
translated: All beings are like illusions and mirages.üîΩJust as a person tormented by thirst,

original: skyes bu skom pas gdungs shing 'gro ba yis //
analyzed: skyes bu skom pas gdungs shing 'gro ba yis //
translated: Wandering in the hot season‚Äôs midday heat,

original: smig rgyu dag la chu yi phung por mthong //
analyzed: smig rgyu dag la chu yi phung por mthong //
translated: Might see a mirage as a body of water,

original: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes par gyis //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes par gyis //
translated: So should you understand all phenomena.

original: smig rgyu la yang chu ni yod med na //
analyzed: smig rgyu la yang chu ni yod med na //
translated: If there is no water in a mirage,

original: sems can rmongs pa de la 'thung 'dod do //
analyzed: sems can rmongs pa de la 'thung 'dod do //
translated: Foolish beings want to drink it,

original: mi bden chu ni btung bar yong mi nus //
analyzed: mi bden chu ni btung bar yong mi nus //
translated: But they cannot drink the water that does not exist.

original: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes par gyis //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes par gyis //
translated: So should you understand all phenomena.

original: ji ltar bar snang chung zad sprin med par //
analyzed: ji ltar bar snang chung zad sprin med par //
translated: Just as a small patch of cloud appears in the cloudless sky,

original: skad cig tu ni sprin gyi dkyil 'khor snang //
analyzed: skad cig tu ni sprin gyi dkyil 'khor snang //
translated: In an instant, a mandala of clouds appears.

original: thog mar gang nas byung bar shes par bya //
analyzed: thog mar gang nas byung bar shes par bya //
translated: Know that it comes from nowhere at first.

original: de bzhin chos rnams thams cad shes par gyis //
analyzed: de bzhin chos rnams thams cad shes par gyis //
translated: Know that all phenomena are like that.

original: ji ltar smig rgyu dri za'i grong khyer dang // sgyu ma ji bzhin rmi lam ji lta bur //
analyzed: ji ltar smig rgyu dri za'i grong khyer dang // sgyu ma ji bzhin rmi lam ji lta bur //
translated: Like a mirage, a city of gandharvas, an illusion, a dream,

original: mtshan ma sgom pa ngo bo nyid kyis snang //
analyzed: mtshan ma sgom pa ngo bo nyid kyis snang //
translated: Signs of meditation appear by their very nature.

original: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes par gyis //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes par gyis //
translated: Know that all phenomena are like that.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @209a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @209a * //
translated: And so on.

original: so ; / slob dpon 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bzhi brgya pa las /
analyzed: so ; / slob dpon 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bzhi brgya pa las /
translated: ƒÄcƒÅrya ƒÄryadeva, in his BodhisattvayogƒÅcƒÅracatu·∏•≈õataka,

original: dbang po dang don dgag pa bsgom pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang don dgag pa bsgom pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: teaches the meditation that refutes the faculties and objects.

original: rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa'i 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa'i 'grel ba'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the thirteenth chapter, having sixteen verses, called ‚Äúthe examination of the faculties and objects.‚Äù

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa mgal me'i 'khor lo dang sprul pa dang rmi lam la sogs pa ltar rang bzhin med na 'on na de gang zhig rang bzhin du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa mgal me'i 'khor lo dang sprul pa dang rmi lam la sogs pa ltar rang bzhin med na 'on na de gang zhig rang bzhin du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If, because of being dependently arisen, cyclic existence is essenceless, like a circle of a firebrand, a magical creation, or a dream, then what is it that becomes the essence?

original: dngos po 'ga' la yang rang bzhin brtag par mi nus te /
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' la yang rang bzhin brtag par mi nus te /
translated: It is not possible to posit an essence for any thing.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar / dngos po gang zhig gzhan 'ga' la'ang //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar / dngos po gang zhig gzhan 'ga' la'ang //
translated: This is because a thing of that kind is not observed in any way.üîΩThus,

original: rag las pa zhig mi 'gyur na //
analyzed: rag las pa zhig mi 'gyur na //
translated: If any thing did not depend on another for its existence,

original: de yi bdag nyid 'grub 'gyur na //
analyzed: de yi bdag nyid 'grub 'gyur na //
translated: then its essence would be established.

original: de ni gang la'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de ni gang la'ang yod ma yin //
translated: But that does not exist for anything.

original: gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig 'grub pa la 'ga' la yang cung zad cig rag las par gnas pa nyid du mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe rang dbang ba gzhan la rag ma las pa de rang nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis yod pa
analyzed: gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig 'grub pa la 'ga' la yang cung zad cig rag las par gnas pa nyid du mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe rang dbang ba gzhan la rag ma las pa de rang nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis yod pa
translated: If any thing were to exist without depending on another for its existence, then at that time, it would be independent, not depending on another. Since it would exist by its own power, it would be essentially existent.

original: nyid du brtags par rigs na gang zhig rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te skye ba'i dngos po gzhan la rag las pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: nyid du brtags par rigs na gang zhig rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te skye ba'i dngos po gzhan la rag las pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If it is reasonable to investigate whether things exist inherently, then how could things that arise in dependence on causes and conditions not be dependent on other things?

original: rgyu med pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig 'byung ba 'di ni srid pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig 'byung ba 'di ni srid pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is impossible for anything to arise without a cause.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur bas 'ga' zhig tu dngos po 'ga'i rang bzhin rang gi ngo bo med pa de'i phyir 'ga' la yang rang bzhin med la /üîΩrang bzhin med pas kyang mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa ltar rang bzhin gyis grub pa med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur bas 'ga' zhig tu dngos po 'ga'i rang bzhin rang gi ngo bo med pa de'i phyir 'ga' la yang rang bzhin med la / rang bzhin med pas kyang mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa ltar rang bzhin gyis grub pa med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Since it follows that things would be causeless, the essence or intrinsic nature of no thing exists in any way. Therefore, nothing has essence.üîΩAnd since they have no essence, they are essenceless, like a magician‚Äôs illusion, a mirage, a dream, an optical illusion, an echo, a reflection of the moon in water, a city of gandharvas, and a magical creation.

original: gal te dngos po 'di dag mgal me'i 'khor lo dang sprul pa la sogs pa ltar slu bas dngos po med par mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe nges par 'thad pas rnam par dpyad pa nas le sbram la sogs pa ltar rang gi ngo bo ches gsal bar
