translated: Therefore, the fuel that is the three great elements is burned by fire alone, not by anything else, and only fuel is burned, not anything else.

original: de la gal te bud shing tsha ba mes bsregs na ni de'i tshe tsha ba de me kho nar 'gyur gyi bud shing ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gal te bud shing tsha ba mes bsregs na ni de'i tshe tsha ba de me kho nar 'gyur gyi bud shing ni ma yin no //
translated: If the fuel that is hot is burned by fire, then that heat would be fire alone, not fuel.

original: tsha ba ma yin pa la yang sreg pa mi srid pas tsha ba ma yin pa yang bud shing ma yin no //
analyzed: tsha ba ma yin pa la yang sreg pa mi srid pas tsha ba ma yin pa yang bud shing ma yin no //
translated: And since burning is impossible without heat, that which is not hot is not fuel.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na rnam pa thams cad du des bsreg par bya ba mi srid pas gang zhig 'byung ba gsum gyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa bud shing zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na rnam pa thams cad du des bsreg par bya ba mi srid pas gang zhig 'byung ba gsum gyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa bud shing zhes bya ba med do //
translated: Thus, since it is impossible for it to be burned in any way, there is no fuel that is the nature of the three elements.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar me ma gtogs par bud shing zhes bya ba gzhan mi srid pa de'i tshe bud shing med dang rgyu med pa'i me yang mi srid pas //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar me ma gtogs par bud shing zhes bya ba gzhan mi srid pa de'i tshe bud shing med dang rgyu med pa'i me yang mi srid pas //
translated: When it is thus impossible for fuel to exist apart from fire, then it is impossible for fire to exist without fuel or without a cause.

original: de med me yod ma yin no //
analyzed: de med me yod ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, without that, fire does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: bud shing ni sra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pas tsha ba ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can zhig ste /
analyzed: bud shing ni sra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pas tsha ba ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can zhig ste /
translated: Fuel has the nature of solidity and so on, but it does not have the nature of heat.

original: de tsha ba'i rang bzhin gyi mes zil gyis mnan pa las tsha bar @216a * //
analyzed: de tsha ba'i rang bzhin gyi mes zil gyis mnan pa las tsha bar @216a * //
translated: When it is overcome by the nature of heat, which is fire, it becomes hot.

original: 'gyur la / tsha ba yin dang bsreg par bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur la / tsha ba yin dang bsreg par bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And when it is hot, it becomes combustible.

original: de ltar yongs su brtags na yang bud shing zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su brtags na yang bud shing zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Reply: Even if you imagine this, the meaning of the term fuelüîΩis not established.

original: gal te zil mnan tsha na yang //
analyzed: gal te zil mnan tsha na yang //
translated: If it is hot when overcome by heat,

original: de yang ci ste mer mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de yang ci ste mer mi 'gyur //
translated: why does it not become fire?

original: gal te bud shing zhes bya ba'i don tsha ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa yang mes zil gyis mnan te tsha bar 'gyur ro snyam du rtog na de yang me kho nar 'gyur te tsha ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te bud shing zhes bya ba'i don tsha ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa yang mes zil gyis mnan te tsha bar 'gyur ro snyam du rtog na de yang me kho nar 'gyur te tsha ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if you think that the meaning of fuel is that which is not by nature hot, but becomes hot when overcome by fire, then that fuel would be fire itself, because it has the nature of being hot.

original: de'i phyir bud shing med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bud shing med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, fuel would not exist.

original: 'on te mi tsha na dngos gzhan //
analyzed: 'on te mi tsha na dngos gzhan //
translated: But if it is not hot,

original: me la yod ces byar mi rung //
analyzed: me la yod ces byar mi rung //
translated: it is not tenable to say that it exists in fire.

original: ci ste don de zil gyis mnan yang tsha ba ma yin pa nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste don de zil gyis mnan yang tsha ba ma yin pa nyid du 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that the meaning of fuel is that which is not hot even when overcome by fire,

original: 'o na ni me las gzhan pa'i dngos po bud shing zhes bya ba dang 'byung ba gsum po tsha ba dang 'gal bas tsha ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can de /
analyzed: 'o na ni me las gzhan pa'i dngos po bud shing zhes bya ba dang 'byung ba gsum po tsha ba dang 'gal bas tsha ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can de /
translated: then it is not tenable to say that the thing called fuel, which is other than fire, and which is by nature not hot because it is incompatible with heat,

original: me la yod do zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: me la yod do zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: exists in fire.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba gsum dang bral ba'i me tsam zhig tu 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba gsum dang bral ba'i me tsam zhig tu 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, fire would be mere fire, which is devoid of the three elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po 'di rnams la ni phan tshun med par 'byung ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po 'di rnams la ni phan tshun med par 'byung ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would contradict your tenets that these great elements do not occur without mutual dependence.

original: me la bud shing zhes bya ba'i dngos po gzhan med pas me rgyu med pa can nyid du yang 'gyur bas 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: me la bud shing zhes bya ba'i dngos po gzhan med pas me rgyu med pa can nyid du yang 'gyur bas 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: And because fire would be without a cause, since there is no other thing called fuel that is different from fire. This is not reasonable.

original: ci ste me'i rdzas kyi rdul phra rab las 'byung ba gsum med pas bud shing med par yang me yod pa nyid do snyam du sems na bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste me'i rdzas kyi rdul phra rab las 'byung ba gsum med pas bud shing med par yang me yod pa nyid do snyam du sems na bshad par bya ste /
translated: But if you think that fire exists without fuel because the three elements do not exist in the particles of the substance fire, then we shall explain.

original: gal te rdul la shing med na //
analyzed: gal te rdul la shing med na //
translated: If there is no fuel in the particles,

original: des na shing med me yod do //
analyzed: des na shing med me yod do //
translated: then fire exists without fuel.

original: de'i phyir rgyu med pa can nyid kyi skyon du thal pa de nyid kyi don du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu med pa can nyid kyi skyon du thal pa de nyid kyi don du 'gyur ro ;
translated: Therefore, the error of causelessness would follow.

original: / rgyu med pa nyid du thal ba'i skyon de nyid kyi phyir bye brag pa dag ltar rang gi sde pa rnams kyis rdzas kyi rdul phra rab khas blang bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: / rgyu med pa nyid du thal ba'i skyon de nyid kyi phyir bye brag pa dag ltar rang gi sde pa rnams kyis rdzas kyi rdul phra rab khas blang bar mi rigs so //
translated: For this very reason, it is not reasonable for our own schools to accept the substantial particle, as do the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: bye brag ba'i rdul phra rab tu smra ba na rab tu byed pa dgu pa nyid las bkag pa'i phyir yang mi dgag go //
analyzed: bye brag ba'i rdul phra rab tu smra ba na rab tu byed pa dgu pa nyid las bkag pa'i phyir yang mi dgag go //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika theory of subtle particles is refuted in the ninth chapter of the Praj√±ƒÅmula, so it will not be refuted here.

original: ci ste me rgyu med pa can nyid du thal bas 'jigs nas rdul phra rab la bud shing yod par rtog na /
analyzed: ci ste me rgyu med pa can nyid du thal bas 'jigs nas rdul phra rab la bud shing yod par rtog na /
translated: If you fear the consequence that fire would be without a cause, you may imagine that fuel exists in the subtle particles.üîΩBut then,

original: de'i phyir / gal te de la'ang shing yod na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gal te de la'ang shing yod na //
translated: If wood exists in it,

original: gcig gi bdag can rdul yod min //
analyzed: gcig gi bdag can rdul yod min //
translated: A particle with a single nature does not exist.

original: gal te rdul la bud shing yod do zhes bya bar rtog na /
analyzed: gal te rdul la bud shing yod do zhes bya bar rtog na /
translated: If you imagine that fuel exists in the subtle particles,

original: 'o na ni me'i rdzas kyi rdul phra rab gcig gi ngo bor @216b yod do zhes khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni me'i rdzas kyi rdul phra rab gcig gi ngo bor @216b yod do zhes khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: then you should not accept that the subtle particles of fire exist as a single nature.

original: rdzas brgyad lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa rdul phra rab gcig gi bdag nyid med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang de las gzhan pa'i dngos po yang ste /
analyzed: rdzas brgyad lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa rdul phra rab gcig gi bdag nyid med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang de las gzhan pa'i dngos po yang ste /
translated: Not only is it certain that the eight substances do not exist as a single subtle particle, but also other things do not exist as a single entity.

original: dngos po gang yang yongs btags pa //
analyzed: dngos po gang yang yongs btags pa //
translated: Any thing that is imputed

original: de dang de la gcig nyid med //
analyzed: de dang de la gcig nyid med //
translated: Does not exist as a single entity.

original: ji ltar de las gzhan la gzhan yod pas 'byung ba chen po rnams la gcig gi bdag nyid can yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyu med pa can nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas 'byung ba las gyur pa yang 'byung ba rnams med par rkyang ba
analyzed: ji ltar de las gzhan la gzhan yod pas 'byung ba chen po rnams la gcig gi bdag nyid can yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyu med pa can nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas 'byung ba las gyur pa yang 'byung ba rnams med par rkyang ba
translated: Just as the elements do not exist as a single nature because of the existence of other elements, in the same way, since it would follow that they are causeless, the derivative form does not exist without the elements.

original: med do // de bzhin du sems med par sems las byung ba rnams mi srid la /
analyzed: med do // de bzhin du sems med par sems las byung ba rnams mi srid la /
translated: Similarly, it is impossible for mental factors to exist without mind,

original: sems las byung ba rnams med par yang sems ma yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams med par yang sems ma yin no //
translated: and without mental factors, there is no mind.

original: de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid rnams med par mtshan gzhi gzugs la sogs pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid rnams med par mtshan gzhi gzugs la sogs pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Similarly, without the characteristics such as arising, the characterized, such as form, does not exist.

original: mtshan gzhi med pa yang rten med pa'i mtshan nyid mi srid do //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi med pa yang rten med pa'i mtshan nyid mi srid do //
translated: And without a basis, the characteristics are impossible.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po gcig po 'ga' la yang grub pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe gcig pa rnams kyi tshogs pa med na du ma grub pa rgyang ring du spangs pa nyid do zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po gcig po 'ga' la yang grub pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe gcig pa rnams kyi tshogs pa med na du ma grub pa rgyang ring du spangs pa nyid do zhes bshad pa /
translated: Since in this way no single thing exists, when there is no collection of singularities, the existence of plurality is far removed.

original: gang gis gcig kyang yod min pa //
analyzed: gang gis gcig kyang yod min pa //
translated: But since even one does not exist,

original: des na du ma dag kyang med //
analyzed: des na du ma dag kyang med //
translated: Therefore, many do not exist.

original: re re ma grub pa yin dang tshogs pa rnams kyang grub pa med do //
analyzed: re re ma grub pa yin dang tshogs pa rnams kyang grub pa med do //
translated: Since each individual is not established, a collection of them is also not established.

original: ci ste lhan cig 'byung bar nges par khas blangs pas sun dbyung ba 'di rang gi sde pa la 'thad kyi pha rol po la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste lhan cig 'byung bar nges par khas blangs pas sun dbyung ba 'di rang gi sde pa la 'thad kyi pha rol po la ni ma yin te /
translated: But if you accept that they definitely arise together, then this refutation is correct for our schools, but not for the opponent,

original: sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab de las gzhan pa'i dngos po la yod pa dang bral ba brtag pa rnams yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab de las gzhan pa'i dngos po la yod pa dang bral ba brtag pa rnams yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: because you accept that the subtle particles of earth and so on exist as things that are different from those particles.

original: de la yang mi rigs pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩgal te gang na dngos de rnams //
analyzed: de la yang mi rigs pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa / gal te gang na dngos de rnams //
translated: But that is also illogical, so to explain this, the text says:üîΩIf you assert that where those things do not exist,

original: med der gcig yod ces 'dod na //
analyzed: med der gcig yod ces 'dod na //
translated: The one exists there,

original: de yang yang dag ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang yang dag ma yin no //
translated: That is also not correct.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gis kun la gsum nyid yod //
analyzed: gang gis kun la gsum nyid yod //
translated: Since the three exist in all,

original: des na gcig nyid yod ma yin //
analyzed: des na gcig nyid yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, the one does not exist.

original: pha rol po la yang gcig ces bya ba'i dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol po la yang gcig ces bya ba'i dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For the opponent, there is no such thing as a single entity called ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de la yang sa'i rdul phra rab la rdzas nyid dang gcig nyid dang yod pa nyid ces bya ba gsum yod la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la yang sa'i rdul phra rab la rdzas nyid dang gcig nyid dang yod pa nyid ces bya ba gsum yod la /
translated: Because for him, the subtle particle of earth has three things: substantial nature, oneness, and existence.

original: de bzhin du yon tan la yon tan nyid dang yod pa nyid dang @217a * //üîΩgcig nyid ces bya ba yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan la yon tan nyid dang yod pa nyid dang @217a * // gcig nyid ces bya ba yod do //
translated: Similarly, for a quality, there are three things: quality, existence, and oneness.

original: gang gi phyir gsum yod pa de'i phyir gcig ces bya ba dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsum yod pa de'i phyir gcig ces bya ba dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because there are three things, there is no such thing as a single entity called ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du grangs can la yang thams cad yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir gcig gi dngos po 'ga' yang med pas 'ga' yang bshad zin pa'i sun 'byin pa las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du grangs can la yang thams cad yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir gcig gi dngos po 'ga' yang med pas 'ga' yang bshad zin pa'i sun 'byin pa las mi 'da'o //
translated: Similarly, for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, because everything is the nature of the three qualities, there is no such thing as a single entity. Therefore, no one can escape the previously explained refutation.

original: gzhan yang sun 'byin pa'i tshul 'di mkhas pas rgol ba thams cad kyi phyogs bsal bar bya ba'i phyir sbyar bar bya'o zhes bslab pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang sun 'byin pa'i tshul 'di mkhas pas rgol ba thams cad kyi phyogs bsal bar bya ba'i phyir sbyar bar bya'o zhes bslab pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
translated: Moreover, the master explains this method of refutation so that the wise will apply it in order to eliminate the positions of all opponents.üîΩThe wise should always applyüîΩthe method of existence, nonexistence,

original: yod dang med dang yod med dang // yod med min zhes bya ba'i tshul //
analyzed: yod dang med dang yod med dang // yod med min zhes bya ba'i tshul //
translated: both existence and nonexistence, and neither existence nor nonexistence

original: 'di ni mkhas pas gcig nyid sogs //üîΩdag la rtag tu sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: 'di ni mkhas pas gcig nyid sogs // dag la rtag tu sbyar bar bya //
translated: to unity and so on.

original: gcig nyid la sogs pa dag ni gcig nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gcig nyid la sogs pa dag ni gcig nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Unity and so on are unity, difference, both, and neither.

original: blo bzang pos rgol ba rnams kyi gcig nyid la sogs pa'i phyogs rnam par gnas pa de dag la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang med pa nyid la sogs pas mtshon pa'i sun 'byin pa'i phyogs tshul gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: blo bzang pos rgol ba rnams kyi gcig nyid la sogs pa'i phyogs rnam par gnas pa de dag la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang med pa nyid la sogs pas mtshon pa'i sun 'byin pa'i phyogs tshul gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The wise should always apply the method of existence, nonexistence, both existence and nonexistence, and neither existence nor nonexistence to the positions of unity and so on of the opponents.

original: de la 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i phyogs ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis gcig pa nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i phyogs ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis gcig pa nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: The position of those who maintain that the effect exists is that the cause and effect are the same.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu de'i rgyu'i bdag nyid du rnam par gnas pa nyid du gyur pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur ba ste med pa ni bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu de'i rgyu'i bdag nyid du rnam par gnas pa nyid du gyur pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur ba ste med pa ni bya bar mi nus so //
translated: Thus, the effect, which exists in the state of being the self of the cause, would not be able to be produced, since it would already exist.

original: gal te 'byung na ni de'i tshe thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung na ni de'i tshe thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: If it were produced, then everything would be produced from everything.

original: thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar mthong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar mthong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not seen that everything is produced from everything,

original: 'o ma la sogs pa kho na las zho la sogs pa so sor nges par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa kho na las zho la sogs pa so sor nges par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen that curd, etc., are produced individually from milk, etc.

original: de'i phyir rgol ba de'i ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig nyid du khas blangs pas 'bras bu yod pa nyid du skye ste de ltar na gcig nyid kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgol ba de'i ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig nyid du khas blangs pas 'bras bu yod pa nyid du skye ste de ltar na gcig nyid kyi phyogs so //
translated: Therefore, according to the opponent, the effect would be produced as existent, since the cause and effect are accepted as the same. Thus, this is the position of identity.

original: gcig nyid kyi phyogs de la 'bras bu yod par smra ba dpyad pa'i sgo nas sun 'byin pa rtag tu brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gcig nyid kyi phyogs de la 'bras bu yod par smra ba dpyad pa'i sgo nas sun 'byin pa rtag tu brjod par bya ste /
translated: The refutation of the position of the existence of the effect through analysis should always be stated to those who advocate the existence of the effect.üîΩAnd this is explained by:

original: de yang / 'bras bu yod nyid gang 'dod la /üîΩkhyim gyi don du ka ba la //
analyzed: de yang / 'bras bu yod nyid gang 'dod la / khyim gyi don du ka ba la //
translated: For those who assert the effect exists,üîΩthe ornament of the pillar

original: sogs pa'i rgyan ni don med 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba 'dis bshad la /
analyzed: sogs pa'i rgyan ni don med 'gyur // zhes bya ba 'dis bshad la /
translated: for the sake of the house would be pointless.

original: de bzhin du /üîΩgang zhig @217b 'byung bar byed pa de //
analyzed: de bzhin du / gang zhig @217b 'byung bar byed pa de //
translated: And similarly:üîΩIt is illogical to say

original: sngar yod ces byar mi rigs te //
analyzed: sngar yod ces byar mi rigs te //
translated: that which is produced exists previously.

original: gal te yod pa skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te yod pa skye 'gyur na //
translated: If the existent were produced,

original: skyes zin pa'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩgal te byas pa med kyang chos //
analyzed: skyes zin pa'ang 'byung bar 'gyur // gal te byas pa med kyang chos //
translated: that already produced would be produced again.üîΩIf the existent were produced,

original: yod na des sdom don med 'gyur //
analyzed: yod na des sdom don med 'gyur //
translated: the purpose of the vow would be pointless.

original: ci ste cung zad byed na yang //
analyzed: ci ste cung zad byed na yang //
translated: But if it were produced even slightly,

original: 'bras bu yod pa mi srid do //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa mi srid do // zhes bshad do //
translated: the existent effect would be impossible.

original: de ltar mkhas pa rnams kyis 'bras bu yod par smra bas nye bar mtshon pa'i sun 'byin pa gcig nyid kyi phyogs la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mkhas pa rnams kyis 'bras bu yod par smra bas nye bar mtshon pa'i sun 'byin pa gcig nyid kyi phyogs la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus the refutation exemplified by the advocates of the existence of the effect should be applied to the position of existence.

original: 'bras bu med par smra ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid du smra ba dag go //
analyzed: 'bras bu med par smra ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid du smra ba dag go //
translated: The proponents of the nonexistence of effects are those who maintain that cause and effect are different.

original: de dag gis ni yod pa skye ba don med par sems shing 'bras bu med pa kho na skye'o zhes rtogs te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni yod pa skye ba don med par sems shing 'bras bu med pa kho na skye'o zhes rtogs te /
translated: They think that the arising of an existent is pointless, and they understand that only the nonexistent arises.

original: de dag gi gzhan nyid kyi phyogs la yang 'bras bu med pas nye bar mtshon pa'i sun 'byin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhan nyid kyi phyogs la yang 'bras bu med pas nye bar mtshon pa'i sun 'byin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The refutation that applies to their position of difference should be stated as follows:

original: de yang / 'bras bu med nyid gang 'dod la //üîΩkhyim gyi don du ka ba la //
analyzed: de yang / 'bras bu med nyid gang 'dod la // khyim gyi don du ka ba la //
translated: ‚ÄúIf you maintain that the effect is nonexistent,üîΩthen the pillar‚Äôs function of supporting the house

original: sogs pa'i rgyan ni don med 'gyur //
analyzed: sogs pa'i rgyan ni don med 'gyur //
translated: would be pointless.‚Äù

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: This is explained in the following:üîΩ‚ÄúIf you maintain that the effect is nonexistent,üîΩthen the pillar‚Äôs function of supporting the houseüîΩwould be pointless.‚Äù

original: gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis gcig nyid du 'gyur la gzhan nyid du yang 'gyur ro snyam du rtogs pa de dag ni 'bras bu yod pa dang med par smra'o //
analyzed: gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis gcig nyid du 'gyur la gzhan nyid du yang 'gyur ro snyam du rtogs pa de dag ni 'bras bu yod pa dang med par smra'o //
translated: Those who think that cause and effect are both the same and different maintain that the effect both exists and does not exist.

original: de dag ni lha sbyin srog gi bdag nyid du rnam par gnas shing lha sbyin gyi bdag nyid du rnam par mi gnas par skye bar 'dod la /
analyzed: de dag ni lha sbyin srog gi bdag nyid du rnam par gnas shing lha sbyin gyi bdag nyid du rnam par mi gnas par skye bar 'dod la /
translated: They maintain that Devadatta, who is the life-force, is born without Devadatta being the life-force.

original: de bzhin du gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa gser gyi bdag nyid du rnam par gnas shing gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du rnam par mi gnas pa rnams skye bar rtogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa gser gyi bdag nyid du rnam par gnas shing gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du rnam par mi gnas pa rnams skye bar rtogs so //
translated: Likewise, one should understand that bracelets, armlets, and so on, which exist as gold, but do not exist as bracelets, armlets, and so on, are produced.

original: de dag gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid gnyi ga'i phyogs la 'bras bu yod pa dang med par smra ba dgag pas nye bar mtshon pa'i sun 'byin pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid gnyi ga'i phyogs la 'bras bu yod pa dang med par smra ba dgag pas nye bar mtshon pa'i sun 'byin pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: The refutation that is illustrated by the refutation of the existence and nonexistence of the effect in the case of sameness and difference should be stated.

original: de yang / 'bras bu yod nyid gang 'dod dang // zhes pa la sogs pas bshad de /
analyzed: de yang / 'bras bu yod nyid gang 'dod dang // zhes pa la sogs pas bshad de /
translated: And that is explained by ‚ÄúIf you assert the effect exists‚Äù and so on.

original: rgol ba gnyis kyi skyon gyi phyogs gcig la sbyar bar bya ba 'di ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: rgol ba gnyis kyi skyon gyi phyogs gcig la sbyar bar bya ba 'di ni khyad par ro //
translated: This application of the fault of the two opponents to one side is the difference.

original: gang dag gi ltar na bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po med par rang gi rgyu dag las gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med pa dag dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i rgyu can yin pa de dag la yod pa dang med par smra ba bzlog
analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po med par rang gi rgyu dag las gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med pa dag dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i rgyu can yin pa de dag la yod pa dang med par smra ba bzlog
translated: Those who say that things such as pots, which are inexpressible as either the same or different from their causes, exist substantially, should be refuted by the following analysis:

original: pa'i sgo nas yod pa yang ma yin @218a * //
analyzed: pa'i sgo nas yod pa yang ma yin @218a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not tenable to say that things exist or do not exist.‚Äù

original: med pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba dpyad pas sun 'byin pa brjod par bya'o //üîΩde yang smra ba gnyi ga srid na ni de dag bkag pa'i sgo nas gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba dpyad pas sun 'byin pa brjod par bya'o // de yang smra ba gnyi ga srid na ni de dag bkag pa'i sgo nas gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not tenable to say that things exist or do not exist.‚ÄùüîΩIf both assertions are possible, then by refuting both, one can say that things are neither.

original: gang gi tshe 'di gnyi ga mi srid pa de'i tshe gang bkag pas gnyis ma yin par rtogs par 'gyur zhes don gyis bshad zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di gnyi ga mi srid pa de'i tshe gang bkag pas gnyis ma yin par rtogs par 'gyur zhes don gyis bshad zin pa nyid do //
translated: But when both are impossible, then what is refuted so that one can understand that things are neither?

original: de ltar na go rims ji lta ba bzhin du /üîΩyod dang med dang yod med pa //
analyzed: de ltar na go rims ji lta ba bzhin du / yod dang med dang yod med pa //
translated: Thus, in order,

original: yod med min zhes bya ba'i tshul //
analyzed: yod med min zhes bya ba'i tshul //
translated: ‚ÄúExistence,‚Äù ‚Äúnonexistence,‚Äù ‚Äúboth existence and nonexistence,‚ÄùüîΩAnd ‚Äúneither existence nor nonexistence‚Äù

original: 'di ni mkhas pas gcig nyid sogs //
analyzed: 'di ni mkhas pas gcig nyid sogs //
translated: Are the ways of the wise.

original: dag la rtag tu sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: dag la rtag tu sbyar bar bya //
translated: One should always apply this method to the one and the many.

original: gzhan dag ni gal te gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i tshul kho nas dngos po rnams bkag gam 'on te tshul gzhan gyis kyang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gal te gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i tshul kho nas dngos po rnams bkag gam 'on te tshul gzhan gyis kyang yin zhe na /
translated: Others ask, ‚ÄúAre things refuted only by the method of the one and the many, or by other methods as well?‚Äù

original: brjod par bya ste /üîΩyod dang med dang yod med dang // yod med min zhes bya ba'i tshul //üîΩ'di ni mkhas pas gcig nyid sogs //
analyzed: brjod par bya ste / yod dang med dang yod med dang // yod med min zhes bya ba'i tshul // 'di ni mkhas pas gcig nyid sogs //
translated: We reply:üîΩThe wise should always apply this method

original: dag la rtag tu sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: dag la rtag tu sbyar bar bya //
translated: to the one and the many,üîΩviz., existence, nonexistence, both existence and nonexistence, and neither existence nor nonexistence.

original: yod pa dang med pa dang / yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tshul 'di ni mkhas pa rnams kyis gcig nyid la sogs pa phyogs bzhi la rtag tu de kho na sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang / yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tshul 'di ni mkhas pa rnams kyis gcig nyid la sogs pa phyogs bzhi la rtag tu de kho na sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The wise should always apply this method to the four positions, viz., the one, the many, and so on.

original: de la yod pa zhes bya ba ni bdog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la yod pa zhes bya ba ni bdog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú Existence‚Äù means ‚Äúpossession.‚Äù

original: med bzhes bya ba ni bdog pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med bzhes bya ba ni bdog pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú Nonexistence‚Äù means ‚Äúnonpossession.‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú Both existence and nonexistence‚Äù means ‚Äúexistence and nonexistence.‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú Neither existence nor nonexistence‚Äù means ‚Äúneither existence nor nonexistence.‚Äù

original: yod kyang yod la med kyang med //üîΩces bya ba ni bdog kyang bdog la mi bdog kyang mi bdog ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod kyang yod la med kyang med // ces bya ba ni bdog kyang bdog la mi bdog kyang mi bdog ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It exists as it exists, and it does not exist as it does not exist.üîΩThis means that it exists as it exists, and it does not exist as it does not exist.

original: yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni bdog pa yang ma yin mi bdog pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni bdog pa yang ma yin mi bdog pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: It is neither existent nor nonexistent means that it is neither existent nor nonexistent.üîΩOne, etc. means one, different, both, and neither.

original: gcig nyid la sogs pa dag ces bya ba ni gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid dang gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid la sogs pa dag ces bya ba ni gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid dang gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If it is one, etc., then it is either one or different, or both, or neither.

original: de la gnyis sam mang po rnams la gcig nyid dam gzhan nyid dang / gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de la gnyis sam mang po rnams la gcig nyid dam gzhan nyid dang / gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: In this regard, if it is two or many, it is one or different, or both, or neither.

original: de la gang dag gi ltar na snam bu dang dkar po gcig nyid ces bya ba phyogs yin pa de la yod pa zhes bya ba'i tshul 'di yul dang dus dang mtshan nyid la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang dag gi ltar na snam bu dang dkar po gcig nyid ces bya ba phyogs yin pa de la yod pa zhes bya ba'i tshul 'di yul dang dus dang mtshan nyid la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In this regard, those who hold the position that a cloth and whiteness are one, for them this method called existence is to be applied to place, time, and characteristic.

original: de la re zhig yul las ni gal te snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid yin na /
analyzed: de la re zhig yul las ni gal te snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid yin na /
translated: First, with regard to place, if cloth and whiteness were the same,

original: gang dang gang na dkar po yod pa de dang de na snam @218b bu yang yod par 'gyur bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: gang dang gang na dkar po yod pa de dang de na snam @218b bu yang yod par 'gyur bar bya dgos so //
translated: then wherever whiteness exists, cloth would have to exist there.

original: gang dang gang na snam bu yod pa de dang de na dkar po yang yod par 'gyur bar bya dgos so //üîΩci ste gang dang gang na dkar po yod pa de dang de na snam bu yod par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang dang gang na snam bu yod pa de dang de na dkar po yang yod par 'gyur bar bya dgos so // ci ste gang dang gang na dkar po yod pa de dang de na snam bu yod par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: And wherever cloth exists, whiteness would have to exist there.üîΩBut if whiteness does not exist wherever cloth exists,

original: gang dang gang na snam bu yod pa de dang de na dkar po yod par mi 'gyur na ni//
analyzed: gang dang gang na snam bu yod pa de dang de na dkar po yod par mi 'gyur na ni//
translated: and cloth does not exist wherever whiteness exists,

original: de la snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid yin no zhes gang 'dod pa de mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de la snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid yin no zhes gang 'dod pa de mi 'thad de /
translated: then it is not tenable to assert that cloth and whiteness are the same.

original: yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdus las kyang ste /
analyzed: yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro // dus las kyang ste /
translated: Because their places are different.üîΩWith regard to time,

original: de la dus ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la dus ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: there are three times:

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ro /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ro /
translated: the past, the future, and the present.

original: de la 'das pa la ni 'das pa'i gnas skabs kho nar sngar skyes pa'i dkar po mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la 'das pa la ni 'das pa'i gnas skabs kho nar sngar skyes pa'i dkar po mthong ngo //
translated: In the past, the white cloth was seen only after it was produced.

original: gal te snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid yin na ni /
translated: If the cloth and the white color are the same,

original: de'i tshe gal te dkar po sngar skyes na ni snam bu yang sngar skyes par 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: de'i tshe gal te dkar po sngar skyes na ni snam bu yang sngar skyes par 'gyur dgos so //
translated: then if the white color is produced first, the cloth must also be produced first.

original: ci ste snam bu phyis skyes na dkar po yang phyis skye bar 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: ci ste snam bu phyis skyes na dkar po yang phyis skye bar 'gyur dgos so //
translated: If the cloth is produced later, the white color must also be produced later.

original: gal te dkar po sngar skyes na ni de lta na snam bu phyis skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te dkar po sngar skyes na ni de lta na snam bu phyis skyes pa yin la /
translated: If the white color is produced first, then the cloth is produced later.

original: gang zhig sngar skyes pa dang gang zhig phyis skyes pa de dag ni gcig nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig sngar skyes pa dang gang zhig phyis skyes pa de dag ni gcig nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: But that which is produced first and that which is produced later cannot be the same.

original: skye ba'i rim pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang gal te snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid du 'gyur na ni de'i tshe dkar po zhig na snam bu 'jig par 'gyur dgos la ;
analyzed: skye ba'i rim pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang gal te snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid du 'gyur na ni de'i tshe dkar po zhig na snam bu 'jig par 'gyur dgos la ;
translated: Because the order of their production is different.üîΩMoreover, if the cloth and the white color are the same, then when the white color ceases, the cloth must also cease.

original: snam bu zhig ni yang dkar po 'jig par 'gyur dgos na /
analyzed: snam bu zhig ni yang dkar po 'jig par 'gyur dgos na /
translated: And when the cloth ceases, the white color must also cease.

original: gang gi tshe dkar po zhig na dkar po 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dkar po zhig na dkar po 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
translated: When something white is destroyed, it is the white that is destroyed,

original: snam bu 'jig par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: snam bu 'jig par mi 'gyur la /
translated: but the cloth is not destroyed.

original: snam bu zhig na yang snam bu kho na 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: snam bu zhig na yang snam bu kho na 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
translated: When the cloth is destroyed, it is the cloth that is destroyed,

original: dkar po 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dkar po 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but the white is not destroyed.

original: de la snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid do zhes gang 'dod pa de ma yin te /
analyzed: de la snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid do zhes gang 'dod pa de ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the cloth and the white are the same.

original: 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang dkar po zhes smra na dkar po zhes bya ba kho na smras par 'gyur gyi snam bu zhes smras pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang dkar po zhes smra na dkar po zhes bya ba kho na smras par 'gyur gyi snam bu zhes smras pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Because destruction and non-destruction are different.üîΩMoreover, if you say ‚Äúwhite,‚Äù you are saying ‚Äúwhite,‚Äù but not ‚Äúcloth.‚Äù

original: snam bu zhes smra na yang snam bu kho na smras par 'gyur gyi dkar po zhes smras pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snam bu zhes smra na yang snam bu kho na smras par 'gyur gyi dkar po zhes smras pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If you say ‚Äúcloth,‚Äù you are saying ‚Äúcloth,‚Äù but not ‚Äúwhite.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir dkar po zhes bya ba kho na smras par 'gyur gyi snam bu zhes smras par ni mi 'gyur la snam bu zhes smras na yang snam bu kho na smras par 'gyur gyi dkar po ma yin pa de'i phyir yang de dag gcig tu mi 'gyurüîΩgyi smras pa dang ma smras pa @219a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dkar po zhes bya ba kho na smras par 'gyur gyi snam bu zhes smras par ni mi 'gyur la snam bu zhes smras na yang snam bu kho na smras par 'gyur gyi dkar po ma yin pa de'i phyir yang de dag gcig tu mi 'gyur gyi smras pa dang ma smras pa @219a * //
translated: Because it is said ‚Äúwhite,‚Äù but it is not said ‚Äúcloth,‚Äù and when it is said ‚Äúcloth,‚Äù it is said ‚Äúcloth,‚Äù but not ‚Äúwhite.‚Äù Therefore, they are not the same.

original: tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the difference between what is said and what is not said.

original: mtshan nyid las kyang ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid las kyang ste /
translated: Also, because of their characteristics.

original: 'di na mtshan nyid ni dkar po'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: 'di na mtshan nyid ni dkar po'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: Here, the characteristic is the nature of white,

original: mtshan gzhi ni snam bu yin na gal te de gnyis gcig nyid du 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi ni snam bu yin na gal te de gnyis gcig nyid du 'gyur na ni /
translated: and the basis of characteristics is cloth. If those two were the same,

original: de'i tshe gal te dkar po mtshan nyid yin na snam bu lang mtshan nyid kho nar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de'i tshe gal te dkar po mtshan nyid yin na snam bu lang mtshan nyid kho nar 'gyur ro ;
translated: then if white were the characteristic, cloth would be the characteristic alone.

original: / gal te snam bu mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur na ni dkar po yang mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / gal te snam bu mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur na ni dkar po yang mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If cloth were not the characteristic, white would not be the characteristic.

original: gal te dkar po kho na mtshan nyid du 'gyur gyi snam bu ma yin pa la snam bu kho na mtshan gzhir 'gyur gyi dkar po ni ma yin na ni de la snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid po zhes gang 'dod pa der mi 'gyur te
analyzed: gal te dkar po kho na mtshan nyid du 'gyur gyi snam bu ma yin pa la snam bu kho na mtshan gzhir 'gyur gyi dkar po ni ma yin na ni de la snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid po zhes gang 'dod pa der mi 'gyur te
translated: If only white were the definition and not the cloth, and only cloth were the definiendum and not the white, then the assertion that cloth and white are the same would not be tenable,

original: / mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the definition and the definiendum would be different.

original: ji ltar snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid bkag pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyi gcig nyid kyi dgag pa yang rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid bkag pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyi gcig nyid kyi dgag pa yang rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just as the identity of cloth and white is refuted, so too the identity of all things should be extensively refuted.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid dgag pa ni smras na gzhan nyid la brjod par bya'o /
analyzed: snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid dgag pa ni smras na gzhan nyid la brjod par bya'o /
translated: Although the identity of cloth and white is refuted, their difference should be expressed.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te snam bu dang dkar po dag gzhan nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te snam bu dang dkar po dag gzhan nyid yin zhing /
translated: If cloth and white were different,

original: gal te yon tan rdzas la brten pa'i phyir dkar po snam bur mi 'gyur na ni ji ltar gal te mchod sbyin lha sbyin zhes bya ba'i spun zla ma yin na lha sbyin yang mchod sbyin gyi spun zlar mi 'gyur ba nyid yin pa ltar snam bu yang
analyzed: gal te yon tan rdzas la brten pa'i phyir dkar po snam bur mi 'gyur na ni ji ltar gal te mchod sbyin lha sbyin zhes bya ba'i spun zla ma yin na lha sbyin yang mchod sbyin gyi spun zlar mi 'gyur ba nyid yin pa ltar snam bu yang
translated: If it is not a white cloth because its whiteness depends on a substance, then just as Devadatta is not Yaj√±adatta‚Äôs brother, so Yaj√±adatta is not Devadatta‚Äôs brother.

original: dkar por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkar por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the cloth is not white.

original: gal te dkar po dang ldan pa las snam bu dkar por 'gyur ro zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te dkar po dang ldan pa las snam bu dkar por 'gyur ro zhes 'dod na /
translated: If you accept that the cloth is white because it possesses whiteness,

original: de la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: then we would say this:

original: gal te dkar po dang ldan pas snam bu dkar por 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dkar po dang ldan pas snam bu dkar por 'gyur na /
translated: If the cloth is white because it possesses whiteness,

original: snam bu de gcig dkar po dang ldan pas dkar po'i mtshan nyid thob pa zhig gam 'on te ma thob pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: snam bu de gcig dkar po dang ldan pas dkar po'i mtshan nyid thob pa zhig gam 'on te ma thob pa zhig yin grang na /
translated: is the cloth that possesses whiteness obtained as the characteristic of whiteness or not?

original: gal te de zhig dkar po'i mtshan nyid thob pas snam bu dkar po nyid du 'gyur na ni 'di'i snam bu nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de zhig dkar po'i mtshan nyid thob pas snam bu dkar po nyid du 'gyur na ni 'di'i snam bu nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the cloth is white because it obtains the characteristic of whiteness, then its status as cloth would be lost.

original: ci ste dkar po'i mtshan nyid ma thob pa yin na ni dkar po'i mtshan nyid ma thob pa'i phyir ldan pa yod kyang snam bu dkar por mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: ci ste dkar po'i mtshan nyid ma thob pa yin na ni dkar po'i mtshan nyid ma thob pa'i phyir ldan pa yod kyang snam bu dkar por mi 'gyur te //
translated: If it is not the case that the cloth has obtained the property of whiteness, then even if it is associated with whiteness, it is not white because it has not obtained the property of whiteness.

original: de la dkar po dang ldan pas snam bu dkar po yin no zhes bya ba gang 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dkar po dang ldan pas snam bu dkar po yin no zhes bya ba gang 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that one asserts that the cloth is white because it is associated with whiteness.

original: ji ltar snam bu dkar por mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du snam bu'i khyad @219b par gang dag sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dmar ser dang / ser skya dang / phug ron kha dang / nag po dang / ring po dang /
analyzed: ji ltar snam bu dkar por mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du snam bu'i khyad @219b par gang dag sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dmar ser dang / ser skya dang / phug ron kha dang / nag po dang / ring po dang /
translated: Just as the cloth is not white, so also the cloth is not different from the properties of blueness, yellowness, redness, paleness, grayness, pigeon-colorness, blackness, length,

original: thung du dang / 'jam dang rtsub pa la sogs pa de dag las snam bu gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad du srid pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thung du dang / 'jam dang rtsub pa la sogs pa de dag las snam bu gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad du srid pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: shortness, smoothness, roughness, and so on, because it is not possible for it to exist in any way.

original: thams cad du srid pa med pas kyang snam bu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad du srid pa med pas kyang snam bu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it is not possible for it to exist in any way, it is not a cloth.

original: ji ltar snam bu snam bu nyid du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang yon tan gyi khyad par de dang de dag la gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad du srid pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar snam bu snam bu nyid du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang yon tan gyi khyad par de dang de dag la gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad du srid pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as a cloth is not a cloth, in the same way, all things are not other than their particular qualities, because they are not possible in every way.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: yod pa dang med pa dag gis gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid la ni dgag pa smran  gnyi ga'i phyogs la yang dgag pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag gis gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid la ni dgag pa smran  gnyi ga'i phyogs la yang dgag pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: If existence and nonexistence are refuted in terms of sameness and difference, then the refutation should be stated in terms of both positions.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gang gi snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid du yang 'gyur la gzhan nyid du yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba phyogs yin pa de la gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa sngar bshad pa dag kho nas dgag pa rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: gang gi snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid du yang 'gyur la gzhan nyid du yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba phyogs yin pa de la gcig nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag pa sngar bshad pa dag kho nas dgag pa rnam par bshad do //
translated: If it is your position that a cloth and whiteness are the same and also different, then the refutation is explained by the previous refutations of sameness and difference.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa gang gi phyogs yin pa de la mdor bsdus nas dgag pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa gang gi phyogs yin pa de la mdor bsdus nas dgag pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: If it is your position that they are neither the same nor different, then the refutation should be stated in brief.

original: gal te snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te snam bu dang dkar po dag gcig nyid ma yin la /
translated: If a cloth and whiteness are not the same,

original: gnyi ga nyid kyang ma yin na ni gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid ma thob pa'i phyir dkar po yang dkar po nyid ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gnyi ga nyid kyang ma yin na ni gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid ma thob pa'i phyir dkar po yang dkar po nyid ma yin zhing /
translated: If it is neither, then because it does not obtain the characteristics of both, white is not white,

original: dkar po ma yin pa yang ma yin la snam bu yang snam bu nyid ma yin zhing snam bu ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dkar po ma yin pa yang ma yin la snam bu yang snam bu nyid ma yin zhing snam bu ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and it is not nonwhite. And the cloth is not cloth, and it is not noncloth.

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid gnyi ga ma thob pa'i dkar po la ci'i phyir dkar po zhes brjod kyi nag po zhes ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid gnyi ga ma thob pa'i dkar po la ci'i phyir dkar po zhes brjod kyi nag po zhes ma yin /
translated: Therefore, why is the white that does not obtain the characteristics of both called white and not called black?

original: gang gi phyir dkar po de la dkar po zhes bya ba brjod kyi nag po zhes bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir dkar po nyid du yod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dkar po de la dkar po zhes bya ba brjod kyi nag po zhes bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir dkar po nyid du yod do //
translated: Because that white is called white and not called black, therefore white exists.

original: mtshan nyid gnyi ga ma thob pa'i snam bu de la yang ci'i phyir snam bu zhes brjod kyi bum pa zhes ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gnyi ga ma thob pa'i snam bu de la yang ci'i phyir snam bu zhes brjod kyi bum pa zhes ma yin /
translated: And why is the cloth that does not obtain the characteristics of both called cloth and not called a pot?

original: gang gi phyir snam bu de la snam bu zhes bya ba nyid brjod kyi bum pa zhes bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir snam bu yang snam bu nyid du yod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snam bu de la snam bu zhes bya ba nyid brjod kyi bum pa zhes bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir snam bu yang snam bu nyid du yod do //
translated: Because that cloth is called ‚Äúcloth‚Äù and not called ‚Äúpot,‚Äù therefore cloth exists as cloth.

original: de ltar dkar po nyid dang snam bu nyid du grub pa dang / gdon mi za bar de dag gcig nyid dam gzhan nyid du 'gyur dgos la gcig nyid yin na ni slar yang gcig nyid 'gog pa'i rim @220a * //üîΩpa kho na brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dkar po nyid dang snam bu nyid du grub pa dang / gdon mi za bar de dag gcig nyid dam gzhan nyid du 'gyur dgos la gcig nyid yin na ni slar yang gcig nyid 'gog pa'i rim @220a * // pa kho na brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, white and cloth are established, and they must be either the same or different. If they are the same, then again the process of refuting identity must be stated.

original: gzhan nyid yin na yang gzhan nyid 'gog pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na yang gzhan nyid 'gog pa'i tshul lo //
translated: If they are different, then the method of refuting difference must be stated.

original: de bzhin du dngos po thams cad la yang 'gog pa'i tshul rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes rnam par 'chad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po thams cad la yang 'gog pa'i tshul rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes rnam par 'chad do //
translated: In the same way, the method of refuting all things should be stated extensively.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gal te de ltar ma grub pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med na rgol ba de dag 'thad pa gang gis rangs te dngos po yod par rtog ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar ma grub pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med na rgol ba de dag 'thad pa gang gis rangs te dngos po yod par rtog ce na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf things do not have intrinsic nature because they are not established in this way, then by what reasoning are these disputants satisfied that things exist?‚Äù

original: de la 'thad pa 'ga' yang med kyi 'on kyang /
analyzed: de la 'thad pa 'ga' yang med kyi 'on kyang /
translated: But this is not tenable.

original: ji ltar rgyun la blta nyes na //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyun la blta nyes na //
translated: If you view the continuum wrongly,

original: rtag pa yod ces byar 'gyur ba //
analyzed: rtag pa yod ces byar 'gyur ba //
translated: you will say that the permanent exists.

original: de bzhin tshogs la blta nyes na //
analyzed: de bzhin tshogs la blta nyes na //
translated: If you view the collection wrongly,

original: dngos po yod ces bya bar 'gyur //üîΩji ltar mar me'i me lce skad cig re re la 'jig cing snga ma dang phyi ma skad cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa rnam par ma chad par gnas pa la rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa yod na yod pa'i rgyun 'byung ba de bzhin du 'du
analyzed: dngos po yod ces bya bar 'gyur // ji ltar mar me'i me lce skad cig re re la 'jig cing snga ma dang phyi ma skad cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa rnam par ma chad par gnas pa la rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa yod na yod pa'i rgyun 'byung ba de bzhin du 'du
translated: you will say that things exist.üîΩJust as the flame of a lamp is momentary and disintegrates in every instant, but the continuum of the flame persists without interruption as the relationship of cause and effect between the prior and subsequent moments, and the continuum of the flame arises as long as the collection of causes and conditions exists, so too,

original: byed skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa thams cad la bdag nyid ji lta bu'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa yod na yod pa'i rgyun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa rnam par ma chad par gnas pa thog ma med par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byed skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa thams cad la bdag nyid ji lta bu'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa yod na yod pa'i rgyun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa rnam par ma chad par gnas pa thog ma med par 'byung ngo //
translated: all conditioned states that disintegrate immediately after they arise arise in a beginningless and endless continuum as long as the collection of causes and conditions that give rise to them exists, without the continuum being interrupted by the relationship of cause and effect between the prior and subsequent moments.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar rgyun de'i rang gi ngo bo ji ltar gnas pa ltar nges par ma 'phrigs shing phyin ci log tu nges pa'i phyi rol pa'i drang srong rnams la sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran zhing 'dir skad cig mar 'jig pa mngon sum ma yin pas
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar rgyun de'i rang gi ngo bo ji ltar gnas pa ltar nges par ma 'phrigs shing phyin ci log tu nges pa'i phyi rol pa'i drang srong rnams la sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran zhing 'dir skad cig mar 'jig pa mngon sum ma yin pas
translated: Therefore, just as the nature of that continuum is ascertained as it abides, the non-Buddhist sages who ascertain it in a distorted way remember their past lives.

original: phung po gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rgyun la nges par mthong ba yin dang bdag gam gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: phung po gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rgyun la nges par mthong ba yin dang bdag gam gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: Since they do not directly perceive momentary disintegration here, they see the continuum that is the succession from one aggregate to another as permanent.

original: dngos po rtag pa yod do snyam par 'byung ba de bzhin du tshogs pa de dang de la brten nas 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dang / mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can dang /
analyzed: dngos po rtag pa yod do snyam par 'byung ba de bzhin du tshogs pa de dang de la brten nas 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dang / mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can dang /
translated: They think, ‚ÄúA permanent thing exists,‚Äù and in the same way, they think, ‚ÄúThe self or something else exists.‚Äù

original: de'i nye bar len pa can rtsva dang phyi ma dang rdzas la sogs pa tshogs la khyim la sogs pa dang gzugs dang dri la sogs pa'i yon tan tshogs pa bum pa la sogs pa dang / dngos po tshogs pa bdag dang nam mkha' la sogs pa yod do //üîΩtshogs pa las logs shig tu mtshan nyid ma grub pa'i chos 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dang / @220b bum pa la sogs pa gzugs brnyan dang brag ca la sogs pa dang 'dra ba de dang de las so so so sor 'jig rten pa'i phyin ci log tshad mar byas te 'jig rten gzhug par bya ba'i phyir nye bar blangs nas sam brten nas rang dang
analyzed: de'i nye bar len pa can rtsva dang phyi ma dang rdzas la sogs pa tshogs la khyim la sogs pa dang gzugs dang dri la sogs pa'i yon tan tshogs pa bum pa la sogs pa dang / dngos po tshogs pa bdag dang nam mkha' la sogs pa yod do // tshogs pa las logs shig tu mtshan nyid ma grub pa'i chos 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dang / @220b bum pa la sogs pa gzugs brnyan dang brag ca la sogs pa dang 'dra ba de dang de las so so so sor 'jig rten pa'i phyin ci log tshad mar byas te 'jig rten gzhug par bya ba'i phyir nye bar blangs nas sam brten nas rang dang
translated: The collection of grass, sticks, and so on is a house, the collection of form, smell, and so on is a vase, and the collection of things is a self, space, and so on.üîΩThe arising of phenomena that are not established as characteristics apart from their collections, such as the elements and the derivatives of the elements, minds and mental factors, and vases and so on, are like reflections and echoes.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid du 'dogs pa tsam zhig tu byed la /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid du 'dogs pa tsam zhig tu byed la /
translated: The world is introduced by taking those phenomena as valid cognitions of error, and they are imputed as mere imputations of general and specific characteristics.

original: de dag kyang skye ba na tshogs pa kho na skye zhing tshogs pa kho na 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang skye ba na tshogs pa kho na skye zhing tshogs pa kho na 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, when they arise, only the collection arises, and when they cease, only the collection ceases.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa de ji lta ba bzhin ma shes pa dang blta ba nyes pas rgol ba dag la sogs pa so so la rang gi ngo bos yongs su grub par rtog cing phyin ci log tsam las rigs pa med pa'i dngos po kho na rtogs so
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa de ji lta ba bzhin ma shes pa dang blta ba nyes pas rgol ba dag la sogs pa so so la rang gi ngo bos yongs su grub par rtog cing phyin ci log tsam las rigs pa med pa'i dngos po kho na rtogs so
translated: Therefore, because of not understanding the collection as it is and because of faulty observation, the disputants imagine that each thing is established by its own nature. They understand only a mere error, not a thing that is reasonable.

original: ; / gal te de ltar dngos po med pas kho bo cag gi dngos por lta ba phyin ci log yin na /
analyzed: ; / gal te de ltar dngos po med pas kho bo cag gi dngos por lta ba phyin ci log yin na /
translated: If, because of the nonexistence of things, our view of things is an error,

original: khyod kyang dngos po khas mi len na dngos po med par lta bar 'gyur na de yang shin tu mi rigs te /
analyzed: khyod kyang dngos po khas mi len na dngos po med par lta bar 'gyur na de yang shin tu mi rigs te /
translated: then since you do not accept things, your view of the nonexistence of things would be an error. But that is most unreasonable.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because seeing and not seeing are mutually exclusive.

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: bdag gi dngos po med par smra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po med par smra ba ma yin te /
translated: We do not advocate the nonexistence of things.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We advocate dependent origination.

original: ci khyod dngos por smra ba zhig gam zhen ma yin te /
analyzed: ci khyod dngos por smra ba zhig gam zhen ma yin te /
translated: Are you a proponent of real things?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: No, because we are proponents of dependent origination.

original: khyod ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: khyod ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of proponents are we?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar smra ba'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar smra ba'o //
translated: We are proponents of dependent origination.

original: yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the meaning of dependent origination?

original: rang bzhin med pa'i don de /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i don de /
translated: It is the meaning of essencelessness.

original: rang bzhin ma skyes pa'i don dang / sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang gzugs brnyan dang dri za'i grong khyer dang sprul pa dang rmi lam dang mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi 'bras bu 'byung ba'i don dang stong pa nyid bdag med pa'i don to //üîΩ'di ltar / gang la brten nas 'byung yod pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin ma skyes pa'i don dang / sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang gzugs brnyan dang dri za'i grong khyer dang sprul pa dang rmi lam dang mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi 'bras bu 'byung ba'i don dang stong pa nyid bdag med pa'i don to // 'di ltar / gang la brten nas 'byung yod pa //
translated: It is the meaning of non-arising by virtue of essence, the meaning of the arising of effects that are like a magician‚Äôs illusion, a mirage, a reflection, a city of smell-eaters, a magical creation, or a dream, and the meaning of emptiness and selflessness.

original: de ni rang dbang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni rang dbang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus: That which originates in dependence Does not have intrinsic nature.üîΩThat which lacks intrinsic nature is not produced.

original: 'di kun rang dbang med pa ste //
analyzed: 'di kun rang dbang med pa ste //
translated: All of these are without intrinsic nature.

original: des na bdag ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: des na bdag ni yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, there is no self.

original: 'di na gang rang gi ngo bo dang rang bzhin dang rang dbang dang gzhan la rag ma las pa nyid yin pa de la ni rang las ma grub pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod pa ma yin na 'dus byas thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byungüîΩba yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di na gang rang gi ngo bo dang rang bzhin dang rang dbang dang gzhan la rag ma las pa nyid yin pa de la ni rang las ma grub pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod pa ma yin na 'dus byas thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang yin no //
translated: Here, that which has its own nature, intrinsic nature, independence, and does not rely on another is not established from itself. Therefore, since it is not dependently arisen, all conditioned phenomena are dependently arisen.

original: de ltar na dngos po gang la brten nas 'byung ba yod pa de ni rang dbang du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po gang la brten nas 'byung ba yod pa de ni rang dbang du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, that which arises in dependence on a thing is not independent.

original: rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: 'di kun rang dbang med pa @221a * //
analyzed: 'di kun rang dbang med pa @221a * //
translated: All of these are not independent.

original: ste ; de'i phyir dngos po gang la yang bdag ste rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ste ; de'i phyir dngos po gang la yang bdag ste rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, no thing has self, that is, intrinsic nature.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rang dbang gi ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir rang dbang gi ngo bo dang bral ba'i don stong pa nyid kyi don yin gyi thams cad dngos po med pa'i don ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rang dbang gi ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir rang dbang gi ngo bo dang bral ba'i don stong pa nyid kyi don yin gyi thams cad dngos po med pa'i don ni ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, here dependent origination is free from an independent nature. The meaning of emptiness is free from an independent nature, but it is not the meaning of the nonexistence of all things.

original: / de'i phyir 'di la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba byas shing sgyu ma dang 'dra ba kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyu la skur pa btab pas de med par lta ba phyin ci log yin la rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa'i
analyzed: / de'i phyir 'di la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba byas shing sgyu ma dang 'dra ba kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyu la skur pa btab pas de med par lta ba phyin ci log yin la rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa'i
translated: Therefore, in this context, since dependent origination is fabricated and is like an illusion, and since the view that denies the cause of affliction and purification is a wrong view, and since intrinsic reality does not exist,

original: phyir na dngos por lta ba yang phyin ci log yin no //
analyzed: phyir na dngos por lta ba yang phyin ci log yin no //
translated: the view that things exist is also a wrong view.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba rnams la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med pa dang rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba rnams la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med pa dang rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, for those who propound that things possess intrinsic reality, dependent origination does not exist, and the errors of the views of eternalism and nihilism ensue.

original: ci ste gal te rang dbang med pa'i don rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don yin na ni 'o na gang khyed kyis nged cag la gnod par 'gyur ba khyod dang nged cag la khyad par ci yod snyam du sems na bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste gal te rang dbang med pa'i don rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don yin na ni 'o na gang khyed kyis nged cag la gnod par 'gyur ba khyod dang nged cag la khyad par ci yod snyam du sems na bshad par bya ste /
translated: If the meaning of ‚Äúlacking independent nature‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúdependent origination,‚Äù then what difference is there between you and us, since you think that we are harmed?

original: gang khyed kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa dang brjod mi shes pa 'di ni khyad par ro //üîΩji ltar byis pa gzhon nu tha snyad la ma byang bas gzugs brnyan la bden par gyur par lhag par sgro btags pas ji lta ba bzhin gnas pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid bsal nas rang bzhin dang bcas par rtogs pa na gzugs brnyan rtog mi shes pa
analyzed: gang khyed kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa dang brjod mi shes pa 'di ni khyad par ro // ji ltar byis pa gzhon nu tha snyad la ma byang bas gzugs brnyan la bden par gyur par lhag par sgro btags pas ji lta ba bzhin gnas pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid bsal nas rang bzhin dang bcas par rtogs pa na gzugs brnyan rtog mi shes pa
translated: The difference is that you do not understand the meaning of dependent arising as it is and you cannot express it.üîΩJust as an unschooled child superimposes true existence on a reflection and, having eliminated its nature of emptiness as it exists, conceives it to be possessing intrinsic nature, you,

original: de bzhin du khyod kyis kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khas blangs kyang gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du gyur kyang rang gi ngo bos ji ltar gnas pa bzhin khong du chud par mi shes te
analyzed: de bzhin du khyod kyis kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khas blangs kyang gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du gyur kyang rang gi ngo bos ji ltar gnas pa bzhin khong du chud par mi shes te
translated: in the same way, although you accept dependent arising, do not understand the nature of dependent arising, which is similar to a reflection, as it exists, as empty of intrinsic nature, but instead conceive it to exist essentially.

original: / rang bzhin med pa la rang bzhin med pa nyid du mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / yod pa ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo la yod pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du lhag par sgro btags nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / rang bzhin med pa la rang bzhin med pa nyid du mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / yod pa ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo la yod pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du lhag par sgro btags nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the absence of intrinsic reality is not grasped as the absence of intrinsic reality, and because the non-existent intrinsic reality is grasped as the intrinsic reality of existent.

original: brjod kyang mi shes te /
analyzed: brjod kyang mi shes te /
translated: One does not understand even when it is expressed,

original: rang bzhin med pa nyid du mi brjod pa'i phyir dang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa nyid du mi brjod pa'i phyir dang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the absence of intrinsic reality is not expressed and because the intrinsic reality of entities is expressed.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rtogs pa dang brjod mi shes pa na bdag nyid dang gzhan nyid slu bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rtogs pa dang brjod mi shes pa na bdag nyid dang gzhan nyid slu bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, when one does not understand in this way and does not understand when it is expressed, one deceives oneself and others.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag ches tshogs che ba 'dir gnas pas bstan @221b bcos byed pa'i rtsom pa 'di 'bras bu med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag ches tshogs che ba 'dir gnas pas bstan @221b bcos byed pa'i rtsom pa 'di 'bras bu med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, we who abide in this great assembly, this composition of the treatise is not without result.üîΩBecause for anyone, arising by virtue of intrinsic reality does not exist,

original: gang gi phyir 'ga' la yang ngo bo nyid kyi skye ba yod pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'ga' la yang ngo bo nyid kyi skye ba yod pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: for that very reason,

original: 'bras bu med par dngos po ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu med par dngos po ni //
translated: An entity without effect

original: kun la 'du ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: kun la 'du ba yod ma yin //
translated: does not exist anywhere.

original: 'bras bu'i don du 'du ba gang //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i don du 'du ba gang //
translated: The assembly is for the sake of the effect.

original: 'di ni 'phags la 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags la 'dus pa'o //
translated: This is the assembly of the ƒÅryas.

original: gal te dngos po rnams kyi 'jug pa rang bzhin par 'gyur na ni de rtag pa dang 'bras bu la ltos par mi 'gyur te rang bzhin ni 'bras bu la mi ltos so //
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams kyi 'jug pa rang bzhin par 'gyur na ni de rtag pa dang 'bras bu la ltos par mi 'gyur te rang bzhin ni 'bras bu la mi ltos so //
translated: If the activity of things were intrinsic, it would not be permanent and it would not depend on the effect, because the intrinsic nature does not depend on the effect.

original: gcig gi dngos po ni 'gas kyang 'bras bu cung zad kyang sgrub par mi nus pas tshogs pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub par bya ba la phan tshun 'du bar yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: gcig gi dngos po ni 'gas kyang 'bras bu cung zad kyang sgrub par mi nus pas tshogs pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub par bya ba la phan tshun 'du bar yang 'gyur la /
translated: Since the intrinsic nature of one thing is not able to establish any effect at all, the assembly would be mutually assembled for the sake of establishing the effect of one thing.

original: gang zhig 'bras bu'i ched du 'du bde ni de'i rang bzhin gzigs pa'i 'phags pa rnams la 'du ba med pa zhig ste bden par gyur pa nyid du mngon par mi bzhed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig 'bras bu'i ched du 'du bde ni de'i rang bzhin gzigs pa'i 'phags pa rnams la 'du ba med pa zhig ste bden par gyur pa nyid du mngon par mi bzhed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is assembled for the sake of the effect is not assembled for the ƒÅryas who see the intrinsic nature of that, because they do not assert that it becomes real.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo lhag par sgro 'dogs par byed pa nyon mongs pa can gyi mi shes pa'i dbang gis dngos po rnams la chags pa dang ldan zhing 'khor bar 'jug pa'i sa bon du gyur pa rnam pa
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo lhag par sgro 'dogs par byed pa nyon mongs pa can gyi mi shes pa'i dbang gis dngos po rnams la chags pa dang ldan zhing 'khor bar 'jug pa'i sa bon du gyur pa rnam pa
translated: Therefore, due to the power of afflicted ignorance, which superimposes the entity of things onto consciousness, one is attached to things and the seeds of entering sa·πÉsƒÅra are planted.

original: thams cad du dgag pa las 'khor ba ldog par rnam par gzhag go zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: thams cad du dgag pa las 'khor ba ldog par rnam par gzhag go zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to teach that sa·πÉsƒÅra is stopped by completely stopping those seeds, it is said:

original: srid pa'i sa bon rnam shes te //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon rnam shes te //
translated: The seed of existence is consciousness.

original: yul rnams de yi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: yul rnams de yi spyod yul lo //
translated: Objects are its domain.

original: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
analyzed: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
translated: When one sees the absence of self in objects,

original: srid pa'i sa bon 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: The seed of existence is stopped.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis yul rang bzhin med par mthong bas chags pa'i rgyu rnam par shes pa srid pa'i sa bon du gyur pa rnam pa thams cad du log pa las nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'khor ba ldog pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis yul rang bzhin med par mthong bas chags pa'i rgyu rnam par shes pa srid pa'i sa bon du gyur pa rnam pa thams cad du log pa las nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'khor ba ldog pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The cessation of cyclic existence is posited for the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas who have attained the forbearance of the nonarising of phenomena on the basis of the complete cessation of the consciousness that is the cause of attachment, which is the seed of existence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i sa bon byang chub kyi sems de ni de rnams la mi ldog ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i sa bon byang chub kyi sems de ni de rnams la mi ldog ste /
translated: The seed of the arising of the wisdom of the tathƒÅgatas, the thought of awakening, does not cease for them.

original: thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rnyed pa gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rnyed pa gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is certain that the wisdom of the tathƒÅgatas will be attained by all.

original: gang dag gis byang chub kyi sems rnam pa de lta bu ma bskyed pa de dag gis kyang phyis gdon mi za bar bskyed nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas bla na med pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba kho na ste /
analyzed: gang dag gis byang chub kyi sems rnam pa de lta bu ma bskyed pa de dag gis kyang phyis gdon mi za bar bskyed nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas bla na med pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba kho na ste /
translated: Even those who have not generated the thought of awakening in that way will later, without a doubt, generate it and attain unsurpassed wisdom through the conduct of the bodhisattva.

original: 'di ni 'phags @222a * //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags @222a * //
translated: This is the nobleüîΩ

original: pa dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo la sogs pa las btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo la sogs pa las btsal bar bya'o //
translated: This should be sought in the noble Holy Lotus S≈´tra of the Good Dharma and so forth.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bzhi brgya pa las mthar 'dzin pa dgag pa bsgom pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bzhi brgya pa las mthar 'dzin pa dgag pa bsgom pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the fourteenth chapter having fourteen verses called ‚Äúthe cultivation of the refutation of grasping extremes.‚Äù

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: 'dus byas rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid de de'i mtshan nyid skye ba la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid de de'i mtshan nyid skye ba la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
