translated: ‚ÄúCompounded phenomena exist essentially because their characteristics, such as arising, exist.‚Äù

original: bong bu'i rva la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa la ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin te 'dus byas la ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba la sogs pa yod pa yang yin no //
analyzed: bong bu'i rva la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa la ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin te 'dus byas la ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba la sogs pa yod pa yang yin no //
translated: The characteristics of compounded phenomena do not exist in nonexistent things such as the horns of an ass. But the characteristics of compounded phenomena, such as arising, do exist for compounded phenomena.

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyang yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyang yod do //
translated: Therefore, compounded phenomena also exist.

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:

original: gal te de'i tshe mtshan nyid lta zhig tu 'gyur na ni 'dus byas yod par 'gyur na yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe mtshan nyid lta zhig tu 'gyur na ni 'dus byas yod par 'gyur na yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: If it were a characteristic at that time, then the conditioned would exist, but it does not exist.

original: ji ltar byas te zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas te zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di na skye ba 'di 'dus byas kyi dngos po bskyed pa na 'dus byas med pa'am yod pa zhig bskyed grang na /
analyzed: 'di na skye ba 'di 'dus byas kyi dngos po bskyed pa na 'dus byas med pa'am yod pa zhig bskyed grang na /
translated: Here, when arising generates a conditioned thing, does it generate a non-existent or an existent conditioned thing?

original: de la re zhig gang 'bras bu med par smra ba de'i ltar na sa bon gyi gnas skabs na myu gu med pa'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pas sa bon gyi mtha'i skad cig las myu gu skye'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig gang 'bras bu med par smra ba de'i ltar na sa bon gyi gnas skabs na myu gu med pa'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pas sa bon gyi mtha'i skad cig las myu gu skye'o //
translated: First, according to those who advocate the non-existence of effects, since the sprout does not exist in the state of the seed, the sprout arises from the final moment of the seed, which is the collection of causes and conditions.

original: de'i phyir rgol ba de'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgol ba de'i /
translated: Therefore, for that opponent,

original: tha mar med par skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: tha mar med par skye bar 'gyur //
translated: arising would occur without the final moment.

original: zhes bya ba phyogs yin na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba phyogs yin na /
translated: If that is the position,

original: yod pa ma yin pa ni 'byung bar rigs pa yang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa ni 'byung bar rigs pa yang ma yin pa ste /
translated: then it is not logical for the non-existent to arise,

original: bong bu'i rva la sogs pa yang skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bong bu'i rva la sogs pa yang skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that even the horns of a donkey would arise.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩdes na med pa gang la skye //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / des na med pa gang la skye //
translated: For that very reason,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúHow could that which does not exist arise?‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi rgyus so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi rgyus so //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of the non-existence of the cause.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa la ste /
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn what‚Äù means in the impossible.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir med pa la skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir med pa la skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because of non-existence, there is no arising of the non-existent.

original: ci ste nyes pa 'dis 'jigs nas 'bras bu yod par smra bas yod pa kho na la skye bar 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste nyes pa 'dis 'jigs nas 'bras bu yod par smra bas yod pa kho na la skye bar 'dod na /
translated: But if, fearing this fault, the advocate of the existence of the effect maintains that only the existent arises,

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: then,

original: yod pa gdod nas skye 'gyur ba //
analyzed: yod pa gdod nas skye 'gyur ba //
translated: since the existent would arise from the beginning,

original: des na yod pa gang la skye //
analyzed: des na yod pa gang la skye //
translated: in what existent would it arise?

original: gal te skye ba'i ches snga rol sa bon gyi gnas skabs kho nar myu gu skye bar rtog na de'i tshe skye bar mi 'gyur te yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te skye ba'i ches snga rol sa bon gyi gnas skabs kho nar myu gu skye bar rtog na de'i tshe skye bar mi 'gyur te yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you imagine that the sprout arises in the state of the seed prior to arising, then at that time it would not arise because it would be existent.

original: ci ste yod pa la skye bar yongs su rtog na de'i tshe skye ba thug pa med par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ci ste yod pa la skye bar yongs su rtog na de'i tshe skye ba thug pa med par 'gyur zhing /
translated: But if you imagine that the existent arises, then arising would be endless.

original: de la slar skye bas byas pa'i bogs su yang 'gyur na de ni srid pa yang ma yin pas yod pa la yang skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la slar skye bas byas pa'i bogs su yang 'gyur na de ni srid pa yang ma yin pas yod pa la yang skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And if it were to arise again, it would have to be increased by arising, but that is impossible. Therefore, the existent does not arise.

original: @222b gzhan yang /
analyzed: @222b gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'bras bu yis ni rgyu bshig pa //
analyzed: 'bras bu yis ni rgyu bshig pa //
translated: The effect destroys the cause.

original: des na med pa skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: des na med pa skye mi 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, that which is nonexistent does not arise.

original: gang gi phyir myu gu skye bzhin pas rgyu sa bon zhes bya ba bshig pa de'i phyir myu gu med pa kho na sa bon las skye'o zhes bya bar yang mi rigs so //üîΩji ltar nas dang gro la sogs pa dag la yod pa ma yin pa'i s'a lu'i myu gu de dag rnam par 'gyur bas skye ba ma yin pa de bzhin du yod pa ma yin pas s'a lu'i sa bon rnam par 'gyur bas kyang skye ba ma yin
analyzed: gang gi phyir myu gu skye bzhin pas rgyu sa bon zhes bya ba bshig pa de'i phyir myu gu med pa kho na sa bon las skye'o zhes bya bar yang mi rigs so // ji ltar nas dang gro la sogs pa dag la yod pa ma yin pa'i s'a lu'i myu gu de dag rnam par 'gyur bas skye ba ma yin pa de bzhin du yod pa ma yin pas s'a lu'i sa bon rnam par 'gyur bas kyang skye ba ma yin
translated: Because the sprout that is in the process of arising destroys the cause called the seed, therefore it is not tenable to say that the sprout arises from the seed that is nonexistent.

original: pa zhig na 'bru mar 'byung na til la sogs pa dag ltar myu gu skye ba na sa bon de 'jig pa yang yin no //
analyzed: pa zhig na 'bru mar 'byung na til la sogs pa dag ltar myu gu skye ba na sa bon de 'jig pa yang yin no //
translated: Just as a rice sprout does not arise from barley seeds and so on, which do not exist, and does not arise from a rice seed that does not exist, in the same way, when the sprout arises, the seed is destroyed, just as sesame oil arises from sesame seeds.

original: de'i phyir med pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa mi skye'o //
translated: Therefore, that which is nonexistent does not arise.

original: grub la sgrub byed yod ma yin //
analyzed: grub la sgrub byed yod ma yin //
translated: That which exists is not established.

original: de phyir yod pa'ang mi skye'o //
analyzed: de phyir yod pa'ang mi skye'o //
translated: Therefore, that which exists does not arise.

original: grub zin pa'i myu gu ni slar 'grub pa ma yin pas yod pa yang mi skye'o //
analyzed: grub zin pa'i myu gu ni slar 'grub pa ma yin pas yod pa yang mi skye'o //
translated: Since an already established sprout is not produced again, an existent does not arise.

original: skye ba'i dus mi srid pa'i phyir yang skye ba yod pa ma yin par brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: skye ba'i dus mi srid pa'i phyir yang skye ba yod pa ma yin par brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Since the time of arising is impossible, it is said that arising does not exist.

original: de'i tshe skye ba yod min zhing //üîΩgzhan tshe skye ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: de'i tshe skye ba yod min zhing // gzhan tshe skye ba yod ma yin //
translated: At that time, arising does not exist.üîΩAt another time, arising does not exist.

original: de tshe gzhan tshe mi skye na //
analyzed: de tshe gzhan tshe mi skye na //
translated: If it does not arise at another time,

original: nam zhig skye ba yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: nam zhig skye ba yod par 'gyur //
translated: when will it arise?

original: gang gi tshe myu gu 'di bdag gi dngos po rnyed pa yin pa de'i tshe ni grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'di la skye ba mi srid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe myu gu 'di bdag gi dngos po rnyed pa yin pa de'i tshe ni grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'di la skye ba mi srid do //
translated: When this sprout has obtained its own nature, at that time, since it has an established nature, its arising is impossible.

original: gang gi tshe 'di ma grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i dus der yang mi skye ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di ma grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i dus der yang mi skye ba mi rigs te /
translated: When it is at a time when it has not yet obtained its own nature, it is also unreasonable that it arises.

original: ma grub pa ni med pa nyid kyis rten med pa'i skye ba'i bya ba mi 'byung bas gzhan gyi tshe skye ba mi srid do //
analyzed: ma grub pa ni med pa nyid kyis rten med pa'i skye ba'i bya ba mi 'byung bas gzhan gyi tshe skye ba mi srid do //
translated: Since that which has not yet obtained its own nature is nonexistent, the action of arising does not occur without a basis. Therefore, arising is impossible at another time.

original: cung zad cig grub cing cung zad cig ma grub pa grub bzhin pa la yang phyogs gnyi gar brjod pa'i skyon du thal ba'i phyir de'i tshe dang gzhan gyi tshe skye ba mi srid do //
analyzed: cung zad cig grub cing cung zad cig ma grub pa grub bzhin pa la yang phyogs gnyi gar brjod pa'i skyon du thal ba'i phyir de'i tshe dang gzhan gyi tshe skye ba mi srid do //
translated: Also, that which is partly established and partly not established is not established. Since the consequence of the error of both positions is stated, arising is impossible at the time of that which is established and at the time of that which is not established.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar dus gsum char du yang skye ba mi srid pa'i de'i tshe de las tha dad pa gzhan mi srid pas nam zhig skye ba yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar dus gsum char du yang skye ba mi srid pa'i de'i tshe de las tha dad pa gzhan mi srid pas nam zhig skye ba yod par 'gyur te /
translated: When arising is impossible in all three temporal periods in that way, then since that which is different from that is impossible, when will arising exist?

original: gang du 'di skye bar 'gyur ba'i dus de yod pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: gang du 'di skye bar 'gyur ba'i dus de yod pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs so //
translated: The time when it arises does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: 'o ma zho'i dngos por 'byung bar skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'o ma zho'i dngos por 'byung bar skye ba yin no //
translated: Milk arises as the entity of yogurt.

original: 'di yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs te /
translated: This is also not correct.

original: 'o ma la zho'i dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o ma la zho'i dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the entity of yogurt is impossible in milk.

original: re zhig 'o ma'i dngos por gnas pa'i 'o ma la ni de'i bdag nyid su skye ba med de /
analyzed: re zhig 'o ma'i dngos por gnas pa'i 'o ma la ni de'i bdag nyid su skye ba med de /
translated: First, the milk that remains as the entity of milk does not arise from itself,

original: de 'o ma'i bdag nyid der yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'o ma'i bdag nyid der yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists as the entity of milk.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, in that way,

original: de la de yi dngos po ru //
analyzed: de la de yi dngos po ru //
translated: It is not tenable that it is the entity of that.üîΩ

original: ji ltar skye ba yod min ltar //üîΩde bzhin gzhan gyi dngos por yang //
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba yod min ltar // de bzhin gzhan gyi dngos por yang //
translated: Just as arising does not exist in the entity of milk,

original: de la skye ba yod ma yin //üîΩji ltar @223a * //
analyzed: de la skye ba yod ma yin // ji ltar @223a * //
translated: so also arising does not exist in the entity of curd.

original: 'o ma'i ngo bor gnas pa'i 'o ma la skye ba mi srid pa de bzhin du 'o ma las gzhan zho'i dngos por skye ba yang mi srid do //
analyzed: 'o ma'i ngo bor gnas pa'i 'o ma la skye ba mi srid pa de bzhin du 'o ma las gzhan zho'i dngos por skye ba yang mi srid do //
translated: Just as arising is not possible in milk that exists as milk, so also arising is not possible in the entity of curd that is different from milk.

original: gang las 'o ma zho'i yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba 'o ma la zho zhes bsnyad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang las 'o ma zho'i yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba 'o ma la zho zhes bsnyad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that milk is designated as curd, from which it would follow that ‚Äúmilk is curd.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe de zho yin pa de'i tshe de 'o ma ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de zho yin pa de'i tshe de 'o ma ma yin la /
translated: When it is curd, it is not milk.

original: yang gang gi tshe de 'o ma yin pa de'i tshe de zho ma yin pas 'o ma zhor 'gyur ro zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe de 'o ma yin pa de'i tshe de zho ma yin pas 'o ma zhor 'gyur ro zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: When it is milk, it is not curd. Therefore it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúMilk becomes curd.‚Äù

original: 'di las kyang 'dus byas la skye ba med de /
analyzed: 'di las kyang 'dus byas la skye ba med de /
translated: Also, arising does not exist in conditioned phenomena because of this:

original: 'di ltar / thog ma bar dang tha ma rnams //
analyzed: 'di ltar / thog ma bar dang tha ma rnams //
translated: The beginning, middle, and end

original: skye ba'i snga rol srid ma yin //
analyzed: skye ba'i snga rol srid ma yin //
translated: are not possible prior to arising.

original: 'dir thog ma dang bar dang tha ma dag ni dngos po'i skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir thog ma dang bar dang tha ma dag ni dngos po'i skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa ste /
translated: Here, the beginning, middle, and end are the arising, enduring, and disintegrating of things.

original: re zhig de dag skye ba'i snga rol gyi gnas skabs na yod pa'i ngo bor med pas skye ba'i snga rol na 'dus byas mi srid do //üîΩci ste skye ba'i dus na skye ba yin la gnas pa'i dus na /
analyzed: re zhig de dag skye ba'i snga rol gyi gnas skabs na yod pa'i ngo bor med pas skye ba'i snga rol na 'dus byas mi srid do // ci ste skye ba'i dus na skye ba yin la gnas pa'i dus na /
translated: First, since the entity that exists in the state prior to arising does not exist, the produced does not exist prior to arising.

original: gnas pa yin zhing 'jig pa'i dus na 'jig pa'i snyam du /
analyzed: gnas pa yin zhing 'jig pa'i dus na 'jig pa'i snyam du /
translated: If you think that at the time of arising, it is arising; at the time of enduring, it is enduring; and at the time of disintegration, it is disintegrating,

original: 'di yang mi rigs te ;üîΩ'di ltar / gnyis gnyis dag ni med pa ru //
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs te ; 'di ltar / gnyis gnyis dag ni med pa ru //
translated: this also is illogical.üîΩWhy? BecauseüîΩhow could each of the two

original: ji ltar re re rtsom par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar re re rtsom par 'gyur //
translated: begin without the other?

original: 'dir skye ba'i dus na gnas pa dang mi rtag pa gnyis med pas gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba'i 'dus byas nyid med pa'i phyir skye bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir skye ba'i dus na gnas pa dang mi rtag pa gnyis med pas gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba'i 'dus byas nyid med pa'i phyir skye bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, since enduring and impermanence do not exist at the time of arising, since the produced itself is devoid of enduring and disintegrating, arising would not exist.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa'i dus dang 'jig pa'i dus su yang gnyis gnyis dag med par re re 'jug pa mi srid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa'i dus dang 'jig pa'i dus su yang gnyis gnyis dag med par re re 'jug pa mi srid do //
translated: Similarly, at the time of enduring and at the time of disintegration, it is impossible for each to occur without the other.

original: de med pas 'dus byas ma yin no //
analyzed: de med pas 'dus byas ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not exist, it is not a conditioned thing.

original: 'di las kyang 'dus byas kyi skye ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang 'dus byas kyi skye ba mi rigs te /
translated: Also, the arising of a conditioned thing is not tenable in this way:

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: gzhan gyi dngos po med par ni //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po med par ni //
translated: Without the thing of another,

original: bdag gi dngos po 'byung ba med //üîΩde yi phyir na bdag gzhan ni //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po 'byung ba med // de yi phyir na bdag gzhan ni //
translated: The thing of itself does not occur.üîΩTherefore, arising from both

original: gnyis ka las 'byung yod ma yin //
analyzed: gnyis ka las 'byung yod ma yin //
translated: Self and other does not exist.

original: 'dir bum pa rang las grub pa'i ngo bo med de gyo mo la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir bum pa rang las grub pa'i ngo bo med de gyo mo la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, a pot does not have an established nature from itself because it depends on shards.

original: gyo mo de dag la yang bdag gi dngos po med de gseg ma la ltos pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir de ltar na gzhan gyi dngos po gyo mo med na bum pa la bdag gi dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gyo mo de dag la yang bdag gi dngos po med de gseg ma la ltos pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir de ltar na gzhan gyi dngos po gyo mo med na bum pa la bdag gi dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Also, those shards do not have the thing of themselves because they depend on gravel.üîΩTherefore, in that case, without the thing of another, the shards, the pot does not have the thing of itself.

original: de bzhin du gyo mo dag las gyo mo'i bdag gi dngos po med na gyo mo dag la bum pa la ltos nas gzhan pa nyid du'ang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gyo mo dag las gyo mo'i bdag gi dngos po med na gyo mo dag la bum pa la ltos nas gzhan pa nyid du'ang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, without the thing of itself, the shards, the shards do not have the otherness in dependence on the pot.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bdag gi dngos po med par 'ga' yang gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir gnyis ka la skye ba mi srid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bdag gi dngos po med par 'ga' yang gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir gnyis ka la skye ba mi srid de /
translated: Because in that case, nothing would become different without the entity of self, therefore arising from both is impossible.

original: bdag dang @223b gzhan dag ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang @223b gzhan dag ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because self and other are impossible.

original: rang gi ngo bo med pas rang la skye ba mi srid la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo med pas rang la skye ba mi srid la /
translated: Since there is no intrinsic reality, arising from self is impossible.

original: gzhan yang rang gi ngo bos ma grub pa'i phyir gzhan las skye ba yang mi srid pas skye ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi ngo bos ma grub pa'i phyir gzhan las skye ba yang mi srid pas skye ba med do //
translated: Moreover, since there is no intrinsically real entity, arising from another is also impossible. Therefore there is no arising.

original: gzhan yang skye ba med pa 'di skye ba po'i snga rol lam phyis sam cig car rtog grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang skye ba med pa 'di skye ba po'i snga rol lam phyis sam cig car rtog grang na /
translated: Moreover, this nonarising is to be examined in terms of prior to the one who arises, subsequent to the one who arises, or simultaneous with the one who arises.

original: de la gal te snga rol du yin na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te snga rol du yin na ni /
translated: If it is prior to the one who arises,

original: mi rigs te rten med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rigs te rten med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is illogical, because there is no basis.

original: ci ste phyis yin na de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: ci ste phyis yin na de yang mi rigs te /
translated: But if it is subsequent to the one who arises, that is also illogical,

original: ma skyes pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / skye ba don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / skye ba don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which has not arisen does not exist and because arising would be pointless.

original: ci ste cig car yin na ni de'i tshe gnyi ga yang phan tshun ltos pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste cig car yin na ni de'i tshe gnyi ga yang phan tshun ltos pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is simultaneous, then in that case both would be independent of each other.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na /üîΩsngon dang phyis dang cig car zhes //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na / sngon dang phyis dang cig car zhes //
translated: Therefore,üîΩit is not possible to say

original: brjod pa nyid du mi nus pa //
analyzed: brjod pa nyid du mi nus pa //
translated: that they are sequential or simultaneous.

original: de'i phyir skye dang bum pa la //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye dang bum pa la //
translated: Therefore, arising and the pot

original: cig car 'byung ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: cig car 'byung ba yod ma yin //
translated: do not occur simultaneously.

original: gang gi phyir skye ba la rim pa 'di mi srid pa de'i phyir skye ba dang bum pa la cig car 'byung ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba la rim pa 'di mi srid pa de'i phyir skye ba dang bum pa la cig car 'byung ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because this sequence is not possible for arising, therefore arising and the pot do not occur simultaneously.

original: gang gi tshe yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe bum pa skye'o zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe bum pa skye'o zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: Since they do not occur simultaneously, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúThe pot arises.‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: bum pa'i skye ba yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: bum pa'i skye ba yod pa nyid de /
translated: The arising of the pot exists.

original: gal te 'di skye bar mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di'i rnying pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te 'di skye bar mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di'i rnying pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it did not arise, then at that time its old age would not exist.

original: 'di la gog pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can rnying pa'i ngo bor yod par mthong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di la gog pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can rnying pa'i ngo bor yod par mthong ba yang yin no //
translated: But its old age, which is characterized by deterioration, is seen to exist.

original: de'i phyir rnying ba'i ngo bo yod pas skye ba yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnying ba'i ngo bo yod pas skye ba yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since old age exists, arising exists.

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: gal te 'ga' zhig la rnying pa nyid yod na ni skye ba yod par 'gyur na srid pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig la rnying pa nyid yod na ni skye ba yod par 'gyur na srid pa yang ma yin no //
translated: If something were to exist as old, then arising would exist, but it does not.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di na gal te rnying pa zhes bya ba cung zad cig yod na ni sngar skyes pa nyid dam phyis skyes pa zhig yin grang na gnyi ga ltar yang mi skye'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di na gal te rnying pa zhes bya ba cung zad cig yod na ni sngar skyes pa nyid dam phyis skyes pa zhig yin grang na gnyi ga ltar yang mi skye'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Here, if something called ‚Äúold‚Äù were to exist, then it would have arisen previously or it would arise later. But it is explained that it does not arise in either way:

original: sngar skyes pa yi phyir na ni //
analyzed: sngar skyes pa yi phyir na ni //
translated: Because it has arisen previously,

original: sngar skyes rnying par mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: sngar skyes rnying par mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: the old does not become old.

original: phyi nas kun tu skyes pa yang //
analyzed: phyi nas kun tu skyes pa yang //
translated: Also, that which is completely arisen later

original: phyi nas skyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi nas skyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: does not become old later.

original: rnying pa'i rnying pa nyid gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten gyi dngos po sngar skyes pa la rtog na /
analyzed: rnying pa'i rnying pa nyid gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten gyi dngos po sngar skyes pa la rtog na /
translated: If the old itself were to exist, then it would be the old of a thing that has arisen previously in the world.

original: bum pa'i sngar skyes pa'i gnas skabs ni rnying pa nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: bum pa'i sngar skyes pa'i gnas skabs ni rnying pa nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: But it is not tenable that the state of having arisen previously is the old of a vase,

original: de'i tshe de la sar pa zhes bsnyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de la sar pa zhes bsnyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time it is called new.

original: phyis skye ba'i gnas skabs khe tshad ma la yang phyis skyes pa'i phyir sar pa yin pas rnying pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: phyis skye ba'i gnas skabs khe tshad ma la yang phyis skyes pa'i phyir sar pa yin pas rnying pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /
translated: Also, in the later period of its existence, it is new because it is born later, so how could it be old?

original: gal te gang sngar skyes pa de da tar stong pa yin no zhes na /üîΩci ste de nyid @224a * //
analyzed: gal te gang sngar skyes pa de da tar stong pa yin no zhes na / ci ste de nyid @224a * //
translated: If you say that what was born earlier is now empty,

original: yin nam / gzhan yin /
analyzed: yin nam / gzhan yin /
translated: is it the same or different?

original: gal te de de nyid yin na ni de'i tshe sar pa'i gnas skabs ma nyams pa'i phyir de rnying pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de de nyid yin na ni de'i tshe sar pa'i gnas skabs ma nyams pa'i phyir de rnying pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is the same, then it is not old because the state of being new has not deteriorated.

original: ci ste gzhan yin na ni de yang de ltar skyes pa'i phyir sar pa kho nar 'gyur bas de rnying pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste gzhan yin na ni de yang de ltar skyes pa'i phyir sar pa kho nar 'gyur bas de rnying pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is different, then it is only new because it is born in that way, so it is not old.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na stong pa nyid med pas de yod pas mtshon pa'i skye ba mi srid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na stong pa nyid med pas de yod pas mtshon pa'i skye ba mi srid do //
translated: Thus, since emptiness does not exist, birth characterized by its existence is impossible.

original: de ltar rnam par dpyad pa grub pa yin dang / dus ches yun ring bar ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pas rga ba dang / 'khor ba rnying par byed cing pham par byed la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa bsgoms pas kyang /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dpyad pa grub pa yin dang / dus ches yun ring bar ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pas rga ba dang / 'khor ba rnying par byed cing pham par byed la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa bsgoms pas kyang /
translated: And, through the bodhisattvas‚Äô cultivation of the absence of intrinsic existence of all phenomena,

original: 'chi ba'i mi dga' ba 'joms shing pham par byed do //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i mi dga' ba 'joms shing pham par byed do //
translated: the unpleasantness of death is defeated and destroyed.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de'i tshe rga pa rgya chen ni //
analyzed: de'i tshe rga pa rgya chen ni //
translated: At that time, aging is not extensive,

original: med cing sdug bsngal 'chi ba med //
analyzed: med cing sdug bsngal 'chi ba med //
translated: and there is no suffering or death.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: gang zhig rtag tu skye ba skye med par //
analyzed: gang zhig rtag tu skye ba skye med par //
translated: One who always knows birth as birthless

original: shes te 'chi bdag pha rol 'da' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: shes te 'chi bdag pha rol 'da' bar 'gyur //
translated: will transcend the lord of death.

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: This is stated extensively.

original: 'di las kyang skye ba mi srid do //
analyzed: 'di las kyang skye ba mi srid do //
translated: Here also, birth is impossible.

original: dus gsum char du yang de mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum char du yang de mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable in any of the three temporal periods.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: da ltar ba yi dngos po ni //
analyzed: da ltar ba yi dngos po ni //
translated: The present thing

original: de nyid las byung ma yin zhing //üîΩma 'ongs las byung yod min la //
analyzed: de nyid las byung ma yin zhing // ma 'ongs las byung yod min la //
translated: It does not arise from itself,üîΩNor does it arise from something other than itself,

original: 'das pa las kyang yod ma yin //üîΩda ltar ba'i don 'di nyid las /
analyzed: 'das pa las kyang yod ma yin // da ltar ba'i don 'di nyid las /
translated: Nor does it arise from both,

original: de nyid 'byung ba ni med de /üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bu dag cig car med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de nyid 'byung ba ni med de / rgyu dang 'bras bu dag cig car med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Nor does it arise without a cause.

original: cig car ba nyid du yod na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩma 'ongs pa las byung ba yod min la ste /
analyzed: cig car ba nyid du yod na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro // ma 'ongs pa las byung ba yod min la ste /
translated: It does not arise from itself, because an existent thing does not need to arise again.

original: ma 'ongs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not arise from something other than itself, because if something other than itself does not exist, how could it arise from that?üîΩIt does not arise from both itself and something other than itself, because each error would apply to both.üîΩIt does not arise without a cause, because it is not tenable that anything arises without a cause.

original: 'das pa las kyang 'byung ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa las kyang 'byung ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it arise from the future, because the future does not exist.

original: 'das pa yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor does it arise from the past, because the past does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe dus gsum char du yang 'byung ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rang bzhin gyis skye ba med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dus gsum char du yang 'byung ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rang bzhin gyis skye ba med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: When it does not arise in any of the three temporal periods, then it is established that it does not arise intrinsically.

original: gzhan yang gal te dngos po de dag la rang gi ngo bos yod na ni de'i tshe rang bzhin la ldog pa med pas dngos po skyes pa'i rang bzhin la ma byung ba las 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ga shed nas 'ongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te dngos po de dag la rang gi ngo bos yod na ni de'i tshe rang bzhin la ldog pa med pas dngos po skyes pa'i rang bzhin la ma byung ba las 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ga shed nas 'ongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if things existed essentially, then since their nature would be immutable, since the nature of a thing that has arisen would not have arisen previously, it would not come from somewhere else.üîΩAnd since the nature of a thing that has ceased would not have been destroyed, it would not go anywhere.

original: 'gags pa'i rang bzhin la yang byung nas med pa med pa'i phyir ga shed du 'gro bar 'gyur @224b na 'di ni srid pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gags pa'i rang bzhin la yang byung nas med pa med pa'i phyir ga shed du 'gro bar 'gyur @224b na 'di ni srid pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But this is not possible.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag de ltar na mig ni skye ba na gang nas kyang 'ongs pa ma yin la 'gag pa na gar yang 'gro ba ma yin no zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag de ltar na mig ni skye ba na gang nas kyang 'ongs pa ma yin la 'gag pa na gar yang 'gro ba ma yin no zhes gsungs la /
translated: The Bhagavat has said, ‚ÄúMonks, in that case, when the eye arises, it does not come from anywhere, and when it ceases, it does not go anywhere.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa glang po'i rtsal gyi mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa glang po'i rtsal gyi mdo las /
translated: And similarly, the noble Sthavira ƒÄnanda says,

original: gal te chos rnams rang bzhin yod 'gyur na ;
analyzed: gal te chos rnams rang bzhin yod 'gyur na ;
translated: If phenomena had essential existence,

original: / rgyal ba nyan thos bcas pas de mkhyen 'gyur //
analyzed: / rgyal ba nyan thos bcas pas de mkhyen 'gyur //
translated: The Victor and his disciples would know it.

original: ther zug chos ni mya ngan 'da' mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ther zug chos ni mya ngan 'da' mi 'gyur //
translated: An unchangeable phenomenon does not attain nirvana.

original: mkhas rnams nam yang spros dang bral mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhas rnams nam yang spros dang bral mi 'gyur //
translated: The wise are never free from elaborations.

original: zhes gsungs so //üîΩde'i phyir de ltar na don gang zhig / skyes pa la ni 'ong ba dang // de bzhin 'gags la 'gro ba med //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // de'i phyir de ltar na don gang zhig / skyes pa la ni 'ong ba dang // de bzhin 'gags la 'gro ba med //
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩThat which is arisen does not come,üîΩand that which has ceased does not go.

original: de las nges par rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: de las nges par rang bzhin med do //
translated: Therefore, it is ascertained that they are essenceless.

original: gal te de la rang bzhin med na /
analyzed: gal te de la rang bzhin med na /
translated: If they are essenceless,

original: ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: what is there?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyur byas pa'i ngo bo rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de yod la /
analyzed: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyur byas pa'i ngo bo rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de yod la /
translated: That which is the dependent origination that is the basis of the cause of affliction and purification exists.üîΩAnd that is like an illusory elephant, horse, and so on.

original: sgyu mar byas pa'i glang po che dang rta la sogs pa dang 'dra ba de yang byis pa phyin ci log pa dag gis rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du yongs su rtog go //
analyzed: sgyu mar byas pa'i glang po che dang rta la sogs pa dang 'dra ba de yang byis pa phyin ci log pa dag gis rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du yongs su rtog go //
translated: And the childish, who are mistaken, conceive it to be truly existent.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa ltar rang bzhin med par don ji lta ba bzhin yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa ltar rang bzhin med par don ji lta ba bzhin yongs su gcod do //
translated: But the ƒÅryas, like an illusion, a mirage, and so on, ascertain the meaning just as it is, as essenceless.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a s≈´tra says:

original: sems can mi dang shed skyes kyang rung ste //
analyzed: sems can mi dang shed skyes kyang rung ste //
translated: No sentient being, human or animal,

original: 'dir skye shi ba 'ga' yang skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dir skye shi ba 'ga' yang skye mi 'gyur //
translated: will be born here again after death.

original: chos kun rang bzhin sgyu 'dra stong pa ste //üîΩmu stegs can gyis shes par nus ma yin //
analyzed: chos kun rang bzhin sgyu 'dra stong pa ste // mu stegs can gyis shes par nus ma yin //
translated: All phenomena are empty, like an illusion,

original: zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: zhes gsungs la /
translated: but this cannot be understood by the tƒ´rthikas.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: chos kun sgyu ma 'dra zhing de bzhin du //
analyzed: chos kun sgyu ma 'dra zhing de bzhin du //
translated: All phenomena are like an illusion,

original: rmi lam dang mtshungs sprin ltar blta byas nas //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mtshungs sprin ltar blta byas nas //
translated: like a dream, and like a cloud.

original: 'di 'dra'i chos kyi tshul la rnam dpyad pa//
analyzed: 'di 'dra'i chos kyi tshul la rnam dpyad pa//
translated: Those who analyze the way of such phenomena

original: rdzogs par gnas shing chos la legs gnas sgom //
analyzed: rdzogs par gnas shing chos la legs gnas sgom //
translated: are fully present and meditate well on the Dharma.

original: gang zhig bdag dang bdag gi snyam sems shing //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag dang bdag gi snyam sems shing //
translated: Those who think in terms of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù

original: dngos po phra mo de bzhin du zhen pa //
analyzed: dngos po phra mo de bzhin du zhen pa //
translated: and similarly cling to subtle entities

original: 'dzin gnas mi mkhas de ni 'jigs 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'dzin gnas mi mkhas de ni 'jigs 'gyur te //
translated: are unskilled in apprehending and abiding, and they will be frightened.

original: chags shing sdang la de bzhin rmongs par 'gyur //
analyzed: chags shing sdang la de bzhin rmongs par 'gyur //
translated: They will be attached, hostile, and similarly confused.

original: sh'akya'i sras po rang bzhin med pa'i chos //
analyzed: sh'akya'i sras po rang bzhin med pa'i chos //
translated: The son of the ≈öƒÅkyas understands the Dharma of no nature

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs 'gyur te //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs 'gyur te //
translated: and dependent origination.

original: nam mkha' lta bu'i sems dang ldan pa ni //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu'i sems dang ldan pa ni //
translated: He has a space-like mind.

original: legs par mthong nas mi 'khor grol mi 'gyur //
analyzed: legs par mthong nas mi 'khor grol mi 'gyur //
translated: Having seen well, one is not turned back, not liberated.üîΩ

original: zhes gsungs so //üîΩslob dpon yang 'phags pa'i ye shes la ltes nas rnam par dpyod pa'i @225a * //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // slob dpon yang 'phags pa'i ye shes la ltes nas rnam par dpyod pa'i @225a * //
translated: Having seen it well, one is not turned around, one is not liberated.

original: 'bras bu brjod pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu brjod pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: The Master, having seen the knowledge of the Noble Ones, has spoken in order to express the result of the analysis:

original: de ltar yin na ji lta bur //üîΩsrid pa sgyu ma 'dra ma yin //
analyzed: de ltar yin na ji lta bur // srid pa sgyu ma 'dra ma yin //
translated: If it is so, how is it that

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: existence is not like an illusion?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba na sgyu ma byas pa lta bur 'gyur gyi mo gsham gyi bu lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba na sgyu ma byas pa lta bur 'gyur gyi mo gsham gyi bu lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: When one sees dependent origination as it is, it is like a magical creation, not like the son of a barren woman.

original: gal te rnam par dpyod pa 'dis skye ba rnam pa thams cad du bkag pa las 'dus byas skye ba med par bstan par 'dod na ni de'i tshe sgyu ma lta bu nyid du mi 'gyur gyi mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dag gis nye bar gzhalüîΩbar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par dpyod pa 'dis skye ba rnam pa thams cad du bkag pa las 'dus byas skye ba med par bstan par 'dod na ni de'i tshe sgyu ma lta bu nyid du mi 'gyur gyi mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dag gis nye bar gzhalüîΩbar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If, by this analysis, one wishes to demonstrate that the conditioned is unoriginated, because origination is completely negated, then at that time it is not like an illusion, but is comparable to the son of a barren woman, etc.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pas de dag dang bstun par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pas de dag dang bstun par mi byed kyi /
translated: Because of the fear of the consequence of the nonexistence of dependent origination, one does not accord with those who deny dependent origination.

original: de dang mi 'gal ba sgyu ma la sogs pa dag dang ni mi byed do //
analyzed: de dang mi 'gal ba sgyu ma la sogs pa dag dang ni mi byed do //
translated: But one does not accord with those who deny dependent origination, because one does not contradict dependent origination.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa ni sgyu ma byas pa lta bu'i srid pa snying po med pa nyid du gzigs pa na snying po med pa'i 'khor ba la chags pa thams cad yongs su zad pas rnam par grol bar 'gyur bas 'di la mi rigs pa ci yang med
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa ni sgyu ma byas pa lta bu'i srid pa snying po med pa nyid du gzigs pa na snying po med pa'i 'khor ba la chags pa thams cad yongs su zad pas rnam par grol bar 'gyur bas 'di la mi rigs pa ci yang med
translated: Therefore, when the noble ones see that existence is like a magical creation, devoid of essence, they become liberated by the complete cessation of all attachment to the essenceless cyclic existence.üîΩThere is nothing unreasonable about this.

original: do // 'di rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar 'gyur pa la skur pa ma btab bas 'jig rten pa'i rnam par gzhag pa thams cad mi 'jig la /
analyzed: do // 'di rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar 'gyur pa la skur pa ma btab bas 'jig rten pa'i rnam par gzhag pa thams cad mi 'jig la /
translated: Since one does not deny dependent origination, all mundane conventions are not destroyed.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin khong du chud par thar pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin khong du chud par thar pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: And since one realizes the way things really are, one achieves liberation.

original: / de ltar 'dus byas sgyu ma byas pa lta bur brjod nas de'i mtshan nyid rnams kyang yod pa'i ngo bo ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: / de ltar 'dus byas sgyu ma byas pa lta bur brjod nas de'i mtshan nyid rnams kyang yod pa'i ngo bo ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Having thus described the conditioned as being like a magical creation, he explains that its characteristics also do not exist in reality:

original: skye dang gnas dang 'jig pa rnams //üîΩcig car 'byung ba yod min zhing //
analyzed: skye dang gnas dang 'jig pa rnams // cig car 'byung ba yod min zhing //
translated: Arising, enduring, and ceasingüîΩDo not occur all at once.

original: rim gyis 'byung ba yod min na //
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung ba yod min na //
translated: Nor do they occur sequentially.

original: nam zhig 'byung ba yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: nam zhig 'byung ba yod par 'gyur //
translated: When, then, do they occur?

original: re zhig phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa rnams skad cig ma gcig la 'byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: re zhig phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa rnams skad cig ma gcig la 'byung ba ni med do //
translated: First, arising, enduring, and ceasing do not occur in a single moment, because they are mutually contradictory.

original: rim gyis kyang 'byung ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rim gyis kyang 'byung ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor do they occur sequentially.

original: gnyis gnyis dag med par re re 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis dag med par re re 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without a pair, a single one does not occur.

original: rim dang cig car ma gtogs par grub pa'i rgyu gzhan ma gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim dang cig car ma gtogs par grub pa'i rgyu gzhan ma gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And apart from sequential and simultaneous, no other cause of establishment is seen.

original: nam zhig 'byung ba yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: nam zhig 'byung ba yod par 'gyur //
translated: When, then, do they occur?

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is stated.

original: gzhan yang skye ba la sogs pa 'di rnams 'du byed kyi phung po'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir 'dus byas nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang skye ba la sogs pa 'di rnams 'du byed kyi phung po'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir 'dus byas nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, since arising and so on are included in the aggregate of formation, they are conditioned phenomena.

original: de'i phyir nges par de rnams la yang 'dus byas kyi @225b mtshan nyid gzhan dag cig 'gyur bar bya dgos so zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir nges par de rnams la yang 'dus byas kyi @225b mtshan nyid gzhan dag cig 'gyur bar bya dgos so zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is definitely necessary to state that they have other characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: skye ba la sogs thams cad la //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs thams cad la //
translated: Arising and so on

original: slar yang thams cad 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: slar yang thams cad 'byung ba ste //
translated: arise again.

original: de las 'jig pa skye 'dra zhing //
analyzed: de las 'jig pa skye 'dra zhing //
translated: Like arising, disintegration

original: gnas pa 'jig dang 'dra bar snang //
analyzed: gnas pa 'jig dang 'dra bar snang //
translated: appears to be enduring.

original: skye ba la sogs te skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa 'dus byas nyid du khas blangs pa rnams la slar yang thams cad 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs te skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa 'dus byas nyid du khas blangs pa rnams la slar yang thams cad 'byung ba ste /
translated: Arising, enduring, and disintegrating, which are asserted to be conditioned phenomena, arise again.

original: yang 'byung ba yin na ni skye ba la skye ba gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba yin na ni skye ba la skye ba gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they arise again, then arising would have another arising.

original: ji ltar skye ba la skye ba gzhan yin pa'i tshul de las 'jig pa skye 'dra zhing ste /
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba la skye ba gzhan yin pa'i tshul de las 'jig pa skye 'dra zhing ste /
translated: Like arising, disintegration would arise.

original: 'jig pa la yang 'dus byas yin pas mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'jig pa la yang 'dus byas yin pas mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan no //
translated: And since disintegration is also a conditioned phenomenon, it has three characteristics.

original: de'i phyir 'jig pa la yang 'jig pa gzhan yod pas 'jig pa'i 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa la yang 'jig pa gzhan yod pas 'jig pa'i 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since disintegration also has disintegration, there would be an infinite regress of disintegration.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa la yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum yod pa dang / gnas pa'i gnas par 'gyur bas gnas pa 'jig pa dang 'dra bar snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa la yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum yod pa dang / gnas pa'i gnas par 'gyur bas gnas pa 'jig pa dang 'dra bar snang ngo //
translated: In the same way, since endurance also has the three characteristics of conditioned phenomena, and since endurance would endure, endurance would appear to be similar to disintegration.

original: de dag la yang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir gzhan dag tu 'gyur bar bya dgos la /
analyzed: de dag la yang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir gzhan dag tu 'gyur bar bya dgos la /
translated: And since they also are conditioned phenomena, they would have to be made into something else.

original: de dag la yang gzhan dag yin zhing /
analyzed: de dag la yang gzhan dag yin zhing /
translated: And since they also would have something else,

original: de la yang gzhan dag tu 'gyur bas thug pa med do //
analyzed: de la yang gzhan dag tu 'gyur bas thug pa med do //
translated: and that also would have something else, there would be an infinite regress.

original: thug pa med pa yin na yang dngos po thams cad mi 'grub pas 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams rang bzhin gyis med do //
analyzed: thug pa med pa yin na yang dngos po thams cad mi 'grub pas 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams rang bzhin gyis med do //
translated: And if there were an infinite regress, since all things would not be established, the characteristics of conditioned phenomena would not exist essentially.

original: gzhan yang mtshan nyid 'di rnams 'byung ba na mtshan gzhi las tha dad pa'i ngo bo can zhig gam tha mi dad pa zhig mtshan nyid kyi las la 'jug grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang mtshan nyid 'di rnams 'byung ba na mtshan gzhi las tha dad pa'i ngo bo can zhig gam tha mi dad pa zhig mtshan nyid kyi las la 'jug grang na /
translated: Moreover, when these characteristics arise, do they engage in the action of a characteristic as entities that are different from the basis of those characteristics or not different?

original: de la re zhig / mtshan las mtshan gzhi gzhan zhe na //
analyzed: de la re zhig / mtshan las mtshan gzhi gzhan zhe na //
translated: If the basis of those characteristics is different from the characteristics,

original: mtshan gzhi mi rtag nyid ga las ;
analyzed: mtshan gzhi mi rtag nyid ga las ;
translated: how could the impermanent be the basis of those characteristics?

original: / ji ltar tsha ba dang grang ba dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa dag gcig la gcig med par 'gyur bas gzhan nyid du gnas pa de bzhin du mtshan gzhi yang mtshan nyid las tha dad par 'jug pa ni mi rtag pa nyid medüîΩpar yang 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: / ji ltar tsha ba dang grang ba dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa dag gcig la gcig med par 'gyur bas gzhan nyid du gnas pa de bzhin du mtshan gzhi yang mtshan nyid las tha dad par 'jug pa ni mi rtag pa nyid med par yang 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: Just as heat, cold, pleasure, pain, and so on are established as different because they are mutually absent in one basis, so too the basis of those characteristics would engage as different from the characteristics, and the impermanent would arise without impermanence.

original: 'dus byas ni mi rtag pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid med par 'byung ba ma yin pas 'di'i gzhan nyid mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni mi rtag pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid med par 'byung ba ma yin pas 'di'i gzhan nyid mi rigs so //
translated: But since conditioned states arise as impermanent because they are impermanent, their difference is not tenable.

original: ci ste nyes pa 'di spang bar 'dod nas mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rtog na ni de'i tshe skyon gzhan 'di yin te /
analyzed: ci ste nyes pa 'di spang bar 'dod nas mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rtog na ni de'i tshe skyon gzhan 'di yin te /
translated: But if you think that the characteristic and the characterized are not different from each other in order to avoid this error, then there is another fault.üîΩIf the three characteristicsüîΩare not different from the characterized,

original: 'di ltar / yang na bzhi g-yang yod pa'i //
analyzed: 'di ltar / yang na bzhi g-yang yod pa'i //
translated: then either the four do not exist

original: @226a * // ngo bor gsal bar yod ma yin //
analyzed: @226a * // ngo bor gsal bar yod ma yin //
translated: or they are not manifest entities.

original: gal te mtshan nyid gsum dang mtshan gzhi gcig nyid du khas len na /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid gsum dang mtshan gzhi gcig nyid du khas len na /
translated: If you accept that the three characteristics and the characterized are the same,

original: de'i tshe mtshan nyid gsum dang mtshan gzhi ste bzhi char yang dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshan nyid gsum dang mtshan gzhi ste bzhi char yang dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the four‚Äîthe three characteristics and the characterized‚Äîwould not exist.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'dir gcig nyid du khas blangs pa yin na ni mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir la mtshan gzhi yang mtshan nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir bzhi char yang med par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'dir gcig nyid du khas blangs pa yin na ni mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir la mtshan gzhi yang mtshan nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir bzhi char yang med par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If you accept that they are the same, it would not be tenable that the characteristics are the characterized. And since the characterized would not be the characteristics, the four would not exist.

original: yang na rang gi ngo bos ma grub pa'i phyir de nyid dang gzhan nyid du khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rang gi ngo bos ma grub pa'i phyir de nyid dang gzhan nyid du khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Or, because they do not exist by way of their own entities, you should not accept that they are the same or different.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: Arising and so on do exist.üîΩ

original: de dag gi rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Arising and so on do exist because the causes of their signs exist.

original: 'di myu gu la sogs pa rnams rgyu'i tshogs pa de dang de la brten nas 'byung bar de la mkhas pa rnams 'chad do //
analyzed: 'di myu gu la sogs pa rnams rgyu'i tshogs pa de dang de la brten nas 'byung bar de la mkhas pa rnams 'chad do //
translated: The wise explain that things such as sprouts arise in dependence on the assembly of their causes and conditions.

original: gal te skye ba la sogs pa rnams med na ni rgyu'i tshogs pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba la sogs pa rnams med na ni rgyu'i tshogs pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If arising and so on do not exist, then the assembly of causes would be meaningless.

original: don med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: don med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not meaningless.

original: de'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa rnams yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa rnams yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, arising and so on do exist.

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:üîΩIf something arose from something,üîΩarising and so on would exist.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig las 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur na ni skye ba la sogs pa dag tu 'gyur na srid pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩdngos po dngos las mi skye ste //üîΩdngos po dngos med las mi skye //
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig las 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur na ni skye ba la sogs pa dag tu 'gyur na srid pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa / dngos po dngos las mi skye ste // dngos po dngos med las mi skye //
translated: But that is impossible.üîΩAn entity does not arise from an entity.

original: dngos po dngos med mi skye ste //
analyzed: dngos po dngos med mi skye ste //
translated: An entity does not arise from a nonentity.üîΩAn entity does not arise from an entity and a nonentity.

original: dngos med dngos las mi skye'o //
analyzed: dngos med dngos las mi skye'o //
translated: A nonentity does not arise from a nonentity.

original: re zhig dngos po myu gu grub pa'i ngo bo ni dngos po sa bon rnam par ma gyur pa las skye ba mi srid de rnam par 'gyur bzhin pa ma yin pa'i sa bon skyed par byed pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: re zhig dngos po myu gu grub pa'i ngo bo ni dngos po sa bon rnam par ma gyur pa las skye ba mi srid de rnam par 'gyur bzhin pa ma yin pa'i sa bon skyed par byed pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir la /
translated: First, it is impossible for an established thing, such as a sprout, to arise from a thing, such as a seed, that has not transformed, because it is illogical that a seed that is not transforming would be a producer.

original: grub pa'i dngos po myu gu dngos po'i ngo bo slar yang skye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir dngos po dngos las mi skye'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i dngos po myu gu dngos po'i ngo bo slar yang skye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir dngos po dngos las mi skye'o //
translated: And it is illogical for an established thing, such as a sprout, to arise again from the entity of a thing, such as a seed. Therefore a thing does not arise from a thing.

original: dngos po dngos po med pa las kyang mi skye ste /
analyzed: dngos po dngos po med pa las kyang mi skye ste /
translated: A thing does not arise from a nonthing.

original: dngos po med pa mes tshig pa'i sa bon la ni 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa med la skye ba'i ngo bo can gyi dngos po la yang slar skye ba med pas dngos po 'ga' yang med pa las mi skye'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa mes tshig pa'i sa bon la ni 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa med la skye ba'i ngo bo can gyi dngos po la yang slar skye ba med pas dngos po 'ga' yang med pa las mi skye'o //
translated: A seed burned by fire does not have the ability to produce a result. And since a thing that has the nature of arising does not arise again, no thing arises from a nonthing.

original: dngos po med pa dang dngos po med pa las kyang mi skye ste /üîΩdngos po med pa las cung zad kyang skye ba'i nus pa med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang dngos po med pa las kyang mi skye ste /üîΩdngos po med pa las cung zad kyang skye ba'i nus pa med pa'i phyir la /
translated: A nonthing does not arise from a thing or a nonthing.üîΩA nonthing does not have the ability to arise from a thing or a nonthing.

original: dngos po med pa la mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa ltar skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir @226b dngos po med pa las kyang dngos po med pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa ltar skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir @226b dngos po med pa las kyang dngos po med pa mi skye'o //
translated: Because it is impossible for a nonthing to arise, like the son of a barren woman, a nonthing does not arise from a nonthing.

original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po las kyang mi skye ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po las kyang mi skye ste /
translated: A nonthing does not arise from a thing,

original: bshad zin pa'i nyes pa thog tu 'bab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i nyes pa thog tu 'bab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the previously explained errors would ensue.

original: de ltar na dngos po las kyang dngos po med pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po las kyang dngos po med pa mi skye'o //
translated: Thus, a nonthing does not arise from a thing.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po dang dngos po med pa las dngos po dang dngos po med pa skye ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe skye ba mi srid pas rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pas dngos po dgos pa ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po dang dngos po med pa las dngos po dang dngos po med pa skye ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe skye ba mi srid pas rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pas dngos po dgos pa ci zhig yod de /
translated: When a thing and a nonthing do not arise from a thing and a nonthing, then since arising is impossible, what is the use of a collection of causes and conditions for the sake of a thing?

original: 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: This is absurd.

original: 'di las kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is also not the case,

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because arising and destruction are not tenable.

original: 'dir skye ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi don nam dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin la rtog grang na /
analyzed: 'dir skye ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi don nam dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin la rtog grang na /
translated: Here, one might think that the meaning of the nature of a thing that arises or the nature of a nonthing that arises is imagined.

original: de bzhin du 'jig pa yang rtog pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig pa yang rtog pa na /
translated: Likewise, when one conceives of destruction,

original: dngos po'am dngos po med pa zhig la rtog grang na /
analyzed: dngos po'am dngos po med pa zhig la rtog grang na /
translated: one conceives of it as either an entity or a nonentity.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩdngos po dngos por mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa / dngos po dngos por mi 'gyur te //
translated: But it is impossible in any way, as has been explained.üîΩAn entity does not become an entity.

original: dngos med dngos por mi 'gyur ro ;üîΩ/ dngos med dngos med mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: dngos med dngos por mi 'gyur ro ; / dngos med dngos med mi 'gyur te //
translated: A nonentity does not become an entity.üîΩAn entity does not become a nonentity.

original: dngos yod dngos med mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos yod dngos med mi 'gyur ro //
translated: A nonentity does not become a nonentity.

original: de la dngos po zhes bya ba ni skyes shing bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnyed pa'i don te /
analyzed: de la dngos po zhes bya ba ni skyes shing bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnyed pa'i don te /
translated: Here ‚Äúentity‚Äù means that which has arisen and has obtained its own nature.

original: de slar yang dngos por mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de slar yang dngos por mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: That does not become an entity again.

original: slar yang skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: slar yang skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It does not arise again,

original: yod pa skye ba don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa skye ba don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the arising of that which exists is meaningless.

original: de ltar na yang dngos po dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dngos po dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, an entity does not become an entity.

original: dngos po med pa yang dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: A nonentity also does not become an entity.

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa ji ltar dngos por 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa ji ltar dngos por 'gyur te /
translated: How could that which is called a ‚Äúnonentity,‚Äù which is nonexistent, become an entity?

original: mo gsham gyi bu yang skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu yang skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the son of a barren woman would also be born.

original: de ltar na dngos po med pa yang dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po med pa yang dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, a non-thing also would not become a thing.

original: de ltar na re zhig dngos po'am dngos po med pa dang dngos por mi 'gyur bas skye ba mi srid do //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig dngos po'am dngos po med pa dang dngos por mi 'gyur bas skye ba mi srid do //
translated: Thus, first, since a thing or a non-thing would not become a thing, arising is impossible.

original: da ni 'jig pa yang mi srid do //
analyzed: da ni 'jig pa yang mi srid do //
translated: Now, destruction also is impossible.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: re zhig dngos po med pa ni dngos po med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig dngos po med pa ni dngos po med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: First, a non-thing does not become a non-thing,

original: yod pa ma yin pa la ni ri bong gi rva ltar yang dngos po med pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la ni ri bong gi rva ltar yang dngos po med pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because, like the horn of a rabbit, a non-thing does not exist.

original: / de'i phyir dngos po med de dngos po med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de'i phyir dngos po med de dngos po med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, a non-thing does not become a non-thing.

original: dngos po yang dngos po med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po yang dngos po med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Also, a thing does not become a non-thing,

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are mutually exclusive.

original: dngos po med pa med na ni 'jig pa med la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa med na ni 'jig pa med la /
translated: If a non-thing does not exist, destruction does not exist.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa med na yang 'dus byas med do zhes bya bar grub bo //üîΩji skad @227a * //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa med na yang 'dus byas med do zhes bya bar grub bo // ji skad @227a * //
translated: And if arising and destruction do not exist, then also the conditioned does not exist.üîΩThus, it is established.

original: du ; bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: du ; bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: As the Blessed One said:

original: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas kun rnam par dben //
analyzed: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas kun rnam par dben //
translated: All conditioned and unconditioned things are void.

original: drang srong de dag rnam rtog mi mnga' ste //
analyzed: drang srong de dag rnam rtog mi mnga' ste //
translated: Those sages are free from conceptualization.

original: 'gro ba kun la 'dus ma byas thob cing //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun la 'dus ma byas thob cing //
translated: They attain the unconditioned in all worlds.

original: rtag tu lta bar gyur pas rnam par dben //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtag tu lta bar gyur pas rnam par dben // zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are always free from the views.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: skyes pa mi skye la ma skyes pa yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: skyes pa mi skye la ma skyes pa yang mi skye ste /
translated: The arisen does not arise, nor does the non-arisen arise.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag la skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag la skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because arising is refuted for both things and non-things.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what?

original: skye bzhin pa'i don skye'o //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i don skye'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúarising‚Äù is that which is in the process of arising arises.

original: 'di yang mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To show that this is also unreasonable, it is said:

original: skye bzhin pa ni phyed skyes phyir //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa ni phyed skyes phyir //
translated: Because that which is in the process of arising is half-arisen,

original: skye bzhin pa ni skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa ni skye mi 'gyur //
translated: that which is in the process of arising does not arise.

original: gal te gang cung zad cig skyes shing cung zad cig ma skyes pa de skye bzhin pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gang cung zad cig skyes shing cung zad cig ma skyes pa de skye bzhin pa yin na /
translated: If that which is partly arisen and partly unarisen is that which is in the process of arising,

original: de ltar na ni 'o na skye bzhin pa de yod pa ma yin te skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag la rjes su zhugs pas gzhan gsum pa skye bzhin pa'i dus kyi rnam pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar na ni 'o na skye bzhin pa de yod pa ma yin te skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag la rjes su zhugs pas gzhan gsum pa skye bzhin pa'i dus kyi rnam pa med do //
translated: But if that is so, then that which is in the process of arising does not exist, because it is included in the arisen and the unarisen, and there is no third aspect of the time of arising.

original: de'i phyir med pa nyid kyis skye bzhin pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa nyid kyis skye bzhin pa mi skye'o //
translated: Therefore, because it does not exist, that which is in the process of arising does not arise.

original: gal te gnyi ga'i ngo bo skye bzhin pa yin na ni de'i phyir de'i gang cung zad cig skyes pa de ni skyes pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir mi skye ste /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga'i ngo bo skye bzhin pa yin na ni de'i phyir de'i gang cung zad cig skyes pa de ni skyes pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir mi skye ste /
translated: But if that which is in the process of arising has the nature of both, then that which is in the process of arising is not arising because that which is arising is included in the arisen.

original: dngos po ni mi skye'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni mi skye'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúA thing does not arise.‚Äù

original: de'i cung zad ma skyes pa gang yin pa de yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: de'i cung zad ma skyes pa gang yin pa de yang mi skye ste /
translated: And that which is in the process of arising and is not arisen does not arise.

original: dngos po med pa mi skye'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa mi skye'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúA nonthing does not arise.‚Äù

original: ci ste skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag la skye bzhin pa nyid du rtog na /
analyzed: ci ste skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag la skye bzhin pa nyid du rtog na /
translated: But if you imagine that that which is in the process of arising is both arisen and unarisen,

original: de lta yin na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis kyang skye bzhin pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩyang na thams cad skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: de lta yin na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis kyang skye bzhin pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa / yang na thams cad skye bzhin pa //
translated: To demonstrate this, the text says:üîΩOr else, it follows that everything

original: nyid ni yan par thal bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: nyid ni yan par thal bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Is in the process of arising.

original: skye ba'i bya ba thob par 'gyur ba skyes zin pa ni mi gnas pa'i phyir 'das pa kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: skye ba'i bya ba thob par 'gyur ba skyes zin pa ni mi gnas pa'i phyir 'das pa kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: That which has already arisen does not endure, because it has already obtained the activity of arising.

original: ma skyes pa ni ma 'ongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni ma 'ongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: That which has not yet arisen is future.

original: de'i phyir 'dir skye bzhin pa la skye bar rtog na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir skye bzhin pa la skye bar rtog na /
translated: Therefore, if you imagine that arising is in the process of arising,

original: yang na dus gsum po thams cad skye bzhin pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'am /
analyzed: yang na dus gsum po thams cad skye bzhin pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'am /
translated: then either all three times are included in the process of arising,

original: yang na skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba gang na yang med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: yang na skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba gang na yang med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: or else there is no such thing as the process of arising.

original: gzhan yang skye bzhin pa'i dngos por gnas pa yongs su brtag pa gang yin pa de ci skye bzhin pa'i bdag nyid du bya ba'am skye bzhin pa'i bdag nyid du bya ba ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang skye bzhin pa'i dngos por gnas pa yongs su brtag pa gang yin pa de ci skye bzhin pa'i bdag nyid du bya ba'am skye bzhin pa'i bdag nyid du bya ba ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: Moreover, the analysis of the state of the entity that is in the process of arising is this: Is it that which is in the process of being generated or is it that which is not in the process of being generated?

original: gnyi ga ltar @227b yang skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar @227b yang skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Both are faulty.

original: skye bzhin pa yi bdag nyid du //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa yi bdag nyid du //
translated: That which is in the process of being generated

original: bya ba skye bzhin par mi 'gyur //üîΩskye bzhin pa yi bdag nyid du //
analyzed: bya ba skye bzhin par mi 'gyur // skye bzhin pa yi bdag nyid du //
translated: is not in the process of being generated.üîΩThat which is not in the process of being generated

original: mi bya'ang skye bzhin par mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mi bya'ang skye bzhin par mi 'gyur //
translated: is not in the process of being generated.

original: skye bzhin pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de'i bdag nyid du rnam par gnas pa'i phyir bya ba ma yin la /üîΩgang zhig skye bzhin pa'i bdag nyid du mi bya ba de yang skye bzhin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de'i bdag nyid du rnam par gnas pa'i phyir bya ba ma yin la / gang zhig skye bzhin pa'i bdag nyid du mi bya ba de yang skye bzhin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which is the nature of that which is in the process of arising is not an action because it exists as its very nature.

original: skye bzhin pa'i bdag nyid du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i bdag nyid du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is not in the process of being generated as that which is in the process of arising is also not in the process of being generated because it does not exist as that which is in the process of arising.

original: gang zhig skye bzhin pa'i bdag nyid du bya ba de ni yang skye bzhin pa ma yin pa ltar skye bzhin par mi 'gyur bas skye bzhin pa med do //
analyzed: gang zhig skye bzhin pa'i bdag nyid du bya ba de ni yang skye bzhin pa ma yin pa ltar skye bzhin par mi 'gyur bas skye bzhin pa med do //
translated: That which is in the process of arising does not arise, just as that which is not in the process of arising does not arise.

original: skye bzhin pa med pas kyang skye bzhin pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa med pas kyang skye bzhin pa mi skye'o //
translated: Since that which is in the process of arising does not exist, that which is in the process of arising does not arise.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: skye bzhin pa'i don de ni yod pa nyid de 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bar na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i don de ni yod pa nyid de 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bar na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of that which is in the process of arising exists because it is situated between the past and future.

original: 'dir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bar na skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: 'dir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bar na skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: Here, that which is called ‚Äúin the process of arising‚Äù exists between the past and future.

original: gal te med na ni ci la ltos nas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnam par 'jog par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te med na ni ci la ltos nas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnam par 'jog par 'gyur /
translated: If it did not exist, then in dependence on what would the past and future be established?

original: de yod na ni ma 'ongs pa'i don de la ma 'ongs pa dang thal ba zhes bya ba de 'das pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de yod na ni ma 'ongs pa'i don de la ma 'ongs pa dang thal ba zhes bya ba de 'das pa zhes brjod do //
translated: When it exists, that future object is called ‚Äúfuture‚Äù and ‚Äúarisen‚Äù in dependence on that which is past.

original: de'i phyir skye bzhin pa la ltos pa nyid kyis dus gnyis po de rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye bzhin pa la ltos pa nyid kyis dus gnyis po de rigs so //
translated: Therefore, because it depends on that which is in the process of arising, these two times are reasonable.

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: In response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: gang gis gnyis po bar med par ;
analyzed: gang gis gnyis po bar med par ;
translated: The two are not without a middle.

original: / srid pa yod pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: / srid pa yod pa ma yin pa //
translated: If there is no existence of becoming,

original: de la skye bzhin pa med do //
analyzed: de la skye bzhin pa med do //
translated: there is no present becoming.

original: gang phyir de la'ang bar yod phyir //üîΩrgol ba gang gi ltar na bar med par te /
analyzed: gang phyir de la'ang bar yod phyir // rgol ba gang gi ltar na bar med par te /
translated: Because there is an interval there also.üîΩAccording to the opponent, if there is no interval between the past and future,

original: dkyil med par 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis srid pa yod pa ma yin pa de la skye bzhin pa med do //
analyzed: dkyil med par 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis srid pa yod pa ma yin pa de la skye bzhin pa med do //
translated: then there is no present becoming.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?
