original: gang phyir de la'ang bar yod phyir te /üîΩji ltar skye bzhin pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gi bar na gnas pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du skye bzhin pa skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin can de la yang gang la ltos nas skyes pa dang ma skyes par rnam par 'jog
analyzed: gang phyir de la'ang bar yod phyir te / ji ltar skye bzhin pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gi bar na gnas pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du skye bzhin pa skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin can de la yang gang la ltos nas skyes pa dang ma skyes par rnam par 'jog
translated: Because there is an interval there also.üîΩJust as there is an interval between the past and future of present becoming,

original: par 'gyur ba bar zhig tu 'gyur bar bya dgos na /
analyzed: par 'gyur ba bar zhig tu 'gyur bar bya dgos na /
translated: in the same way, there must be an interval in present becoming, in dependence on which one can posit the past and future.

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i bar du gzhan gsum pa skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba de rnam par gzhag par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i bar du gzhan gsum pa skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba de rnam par gzhag par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not possible to posit a third alternative, other than the past and future, called present becoming.

original: thams cad du skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i bar du skye bzhin par rtog pa thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i bar du skye bzhin par rtog pa thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that that now arising would be endless, since it would be arising in the interval between that which has arisen and that which has not yet arisen.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩgang la @228a * //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / gang la @228a * //
translated: Here, someone says:üîΩThat which is half arisen

original: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba phyed skyes pa ni skyes bzhin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba phyed skyes pa ni skyes bzhin pa ma yin no //
translated: is not now arising, because the error explained above would follow.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But what is it?

original: gang zhig 'gags pas dngos po skye bar 'gyur ba skyes pa'i snga rol gyi gnas skabs kyi ngo bo'i don de la skye bzhin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gags pas dngos po skye bar 'gyur ba skyes pa'i snga rol gyi gnas skabs kyi ngo bo'i don de la skye bzhin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is now arising is the entity that is in the process of arising, having ceased, that is to say, the entity that is in the process of arising is the state of the entity prior to its arising.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa ;
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa ;
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: gang gi phyir na skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: gang gi phyir na skye bzhin pa //
translated: Because that which is now arising

original: 'gags pas skyes pa skye 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 'gags pas skyes pa skye 'gyur ba //
translated: arises having ceased,

original: de yi phyir na skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: de yi phyir na skye bzhin pa //
translated: therefore that which is now arising

original: gzhan yang yod pa'i ngo bor snang //
analyzed: gzhan yang yod pa'i ngo bor snang //
translated: appears to have the nature of an existent.

original: gang gi phyir skye bzhin pa 'gags pas dngos po skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir skyes pa ma rtogs par skye bzhin pa'i dngos po yod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye bzhin pa 'gags pas dngos po skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir skyes pa ma rtogs par skye bzhin pa'i dngos po yod do //
translated: Because that entity which is now arising arises having ceased, therefore the entity that is now arising exists prior to the realization of the arisen.

original: 'di la bshad par bya ste /üîΩgang tshe skyes pa de yi tshe //
analyzed: 'di la bshad par bya ste / gang tshe skyes pa de yi tshe //
translated: This is explained:üîΩWhen it is born,

original: skye bzhin pa la srid pa med //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa la srid pa med //
translated: at that time, that which is in the process of being born does not exist.

original: re zhig gang gi tshe dngos po 'di skyes so zhes brjod pa de'i tshe skye bzhin pa med do //
analyzed: re zhig gang gi tshe dngos po 'di skyes so zhes brjod pa de'i tshe skye bzhin pa med do //
translated: When this thing is called ‚Äúborn,‚Äù at that time, that which is in the process of being born does not exist.

original: skye bzhin pa mi srid pas kyang gang las skyes pas gang zhig gis skye bzhin pa rjes su spobs par 'gyur ba skyes pa zhes bya ba nyid med do //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa mi srid pas kyang gang las skyes pas gang zhig gis skye bzhin pa rjes su spobs par 'gyur ba skyes pa zhes bya ba nyid med do //
translated: Since that which is in the process of being born is impossible, that which is called ‚Äúborn‚Äù does not exist, because of being born from that which is in the process of being born.

original: ci ste skyes pa yang skye bzhin par 'gyur na 'o na ni de la skye ba mi srid de skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: ci ste skyes pa yang skye bzhin par 'gyur na 'o na ni de la skye ba mi srid de skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: But if that which is born were also in the process of being born, then it would be impossible for it to be born, because it is born.

original: gang tshe skyes pa skye bzhin na //
analyzed: gang tshe skyes pa skye bzhin na //
translated: When that which is born is in the process of being born,

original: de tshe ci phyir skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe ci phyir skye bar 'gyur //
translated: at that time, why would it be born?

original: gang gi tshe skyes pa'i don kho na la skye bzhin pa zhes brjod na ni de'i tshe skye bzhin pa'i don skye'o zhes bya bar ci'i phyir rtogs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skyes pa'i don kho na la skye bzhin pa zhes brjod na ni de'i tshe skye bzhin pa'i don skye'o zhes bya bar ci'i phyir rtogs te /
translated: If that which is in the process of being born is called ‚Äúthat which is in the process of obtaining the state of being born,‚Äù then at that time, why would it be understood that that which is in the process of being born is born?

original: grub pa'i phyir 'di la skye ba brtag par mi rigs so snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: grub pa'i phyir 'di la skye ba brtag par mi rigs so snyam du dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to investigate the arising of that which is in the process of arising.

original: de'i phyir skye bzhin pa skye'o zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye bzhin pa skye'o zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Hence, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúThat which is in the process of arising arises.‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: skye bzhin pa'i don 'di ma skyes kyang skye ba la mngon du phyogs pas skyes so zhes brjod do //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i don 'di ma skyes kyang skye ba la mngon du phyogs pas skyes so zhes brjod do //
translated: Although the meaning of that which is in the process of arising has not arisen, it is said to have arisen because it is directed toward arising.

original: de'i phyir skyes pa kho na skyes bzhin pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes pa kho na skyes bzhin pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, that which has arisen is precisely that which is in the process of arising.

original: 'di'i skye ba don med pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i skye ba don med pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Moreover, its arising is not meaningless.

original: de ltar na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na yang /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: gal te / skye bzhin pa na mi skyes pa //
analyzed: gal te / skye bzhin pa na mi skyes pa //
translated: If that which is in the process of arisingüîΩWere to arise, it would be that which is in the process of arising.

original: kho na skyes zhes byas par grag / gal te gzhan gyis skye bzhin pa'i dngos po ma skyes pa kho na skye ba la mngon du phyogs pas skyes so zhes bya bar brtags te /
analyzed: kho na skyes zhes byas par grag / gal te gzhan gyis skye bzhin pa'i dngos po ma skyes pa kho na skye ba la mngon du phyogs pas skyes so zhes bya bar brtags te /
translated: If another person imagines that that which is in the process of arising has not arisen but is directed toward arising, then it is said to have arisen.

original: de lta yin na /üîΩskyes dang ma skyes pa dag la //
analyzed: de lta yin na / skyes dang ma skyes pa dag la //
translated: If that were the case,üîΩthen there would be no difference

original: khyad par med phyir de yi tshe //
analyzed: khyad par med phyir de yi tshe //
translated: between that which has arisen and that which has not arisen.

original: bum pa med pa cis mi rtog / skyes pa'i gnas skabs kyi dngos po kho na la bum pa zhes brjod la /
analyzed: bum pa med pa cis mi rtog / skyes pa'i gnas skabs kyi dngos po kho na la bum pa zhes brjod la /
translated: The entity that exists at the time of arising is called a vase.

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag kyang gcig pa nyid kyi phyir bum pa skyes pa yang sngar med pas dngos po @228b med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag kyang gcig pa nyid kyi phyir bum pa skyes pa yang sngar med pas dngos po @228b med par 'gyur na /
translated: Since that which has arisen and that which has not arisen are the same, then since the vase that has arisen is also not previously existent, it would be a nonentity.

original: 'di ni srid pa yang ma yin pas 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa yang ma yin pas 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: But since this is impossible, this is illogical.

original: ci ste yang skye bzhin pa dang ma skyes pa la khyad par med pa ma yin pa kho na ste skye bzhin pa ni skye ba'i bya ba dang 'brel pa'i dngos po yin no snyam na bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste yang skye bzhin pa dang ma skyes pa la khyad par med pa ma yin pa kho na ste skye bzhin pa ni skye ba'i bya ba dang 'brel pa'i dngos po yin no snyam na bshad par bya ste /
translated: But if you think that that now arising and that not yet arisen are not at all undifferentiated, and that that now arising is an entity related to the action of arising, then we shall explain this.

original: skye bzhin pa ni ma rdzogs kyang //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa ni ma rdzogs kyang //
translated: That now arising is not complete,

original: ma skyes pa pas phyi rol 'gyur //üîΩgal te yang skye bzhin pa'i dngos po ni ma rdzogs pa'i ngo bo yin yang ma 'ongs pa las phyi rol du rnam par gzhag mod kyi /
analyzed: ma skyes pa pas phyi rol 'gyur // gal te yang skye bzhin pa'i dngos po ni ma rdzogs pa'i ngo bo yin yang ma 'ongs pa las phyi rol du rnam par gzhag mod kyi /
translated: but it is external to that not yet arisen.üîΩEven though the entity that is now arising is incomplete in nature, it is still posited as external to the future.

original: de ltar gang phyir skyes pa las //
analyzed: de ltar gang phyir skyes pa las //
translated: But since that which has arisen is external to that not yet arisen,

original: phyi rol gyur phyir ma skyes skye //
analyzed: phyi rol gyur phyir ma skyes skye //
translated: Because it is external to the produced and the not yet produced, it is not produced.

original: ji ltar bya ba dang 'brel pas skye bzhin pa ma skyes pa las phyi rol du 'gyur ba de bzhin du skyes pa las kyang phyi rol du gyur pa nyid de ma rdzogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bya ba dang 'brel pas skye bzhin pa ma skyes pa las phyi rol du 'gyur ba de bzhin du skyes pa las kyang phyi rol du gyur pa nyid de ma rdzogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as the present is external to the not yet produced, which is being produced, so it is external to the produced, because it has the nature of not being completed.

original: de'i phyir ma skyes pa kho na skye'o zhes bya bar 'gyur bas skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma skyes pa kho na skye'o zhes bya bar 'gyur bas skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba med do //
translated: Therefore, only the not yet produced is produced, and so there is no such thing as what is being produced.

original: skyes pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir ma skyes pa nyid skye ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: skyes pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir ma skyes pa nyid skye ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it that only the not yet produced is produced, because it is external to the produced;

original: 'di las kyang ma skyes pa nyid skye'o //
analyzed: 'di las kyang ma skyes pa nyid skye'o //
translated: but also that which is not being produced is produced.üîΩFor example,

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi /üîΩskye bzhin pa sngar ma byung yang //üîΩphyi nas yod pa yin par grag / des kyang ma skyes pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi / skye bzhin pa sngar ma byung yang // phyi nas yod pa yin par grag / des kyang ma skyes pa skye'o //
translated: the other says:üîΩ‚ÄúWhat is being produced is not yet existent,üîΩbut later it is renowned as existent. Therefore, only the not yet produced is produced.

original: ma byung zhes bya ba ni byung ba yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma byung zhes bya ba ni byung ba yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúNot yet existent‚Äù means not yet arisen.

original: gang zhig da ltar skye bzhin pa nyid du bsnyad pa de ni skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs kyi sngar te gang du ma byung ngo //
analyzed: gang zhig da ltar skye bzhin pa nyid du bsnyad pa de ni skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs kyi sngar te gang du ma byung ngo //
translated: That which is called ‚Äúnow arising‚Äù is prior to the state of arising, that is, it does not occur anywhere.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na skye bzhin pa'i don de med kyang phyis skye bzhin par yang 'gyur bar grag go //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na skye bzhin pa'i don de med kyang phyis skye bzhin par yang 'gyur bar grag go //
translated: Even though the meaning of ‚Äúnow arising‚Äù does not exist in the future, it is still said that it will arise later.

original: de'i phyir yang skye ba'i bya ba dang 'brel pa'i dus na ma skyes pa kho nar skye bzhin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang skye ba'i bya ba dang 'brel pa'i dus na ma skyes pa kho nar skye bzhin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when it is related to the action of arising, it is now arising, but only as not yet arisen.

original: de'i phyir 'di ma skyes pa nyid kyis ma byung ba nyid yin la ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ma skyes pa nyid kyis ma byung ba nyid yin la ;
translated: Therefore, since it is not yet arisen, it is not yet occurred.

original: bdag gi dngos po ma thob pa'i ma byung ba la ni skye ba'i bya ba mi 'jug par mi bzod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ni /üîΩma byung zhes bya skye ma yin //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po ma thob pa'i ma byung ba la ni skye ba'i bya ba mi 'jug par mi bzod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ni / ma byung zhes bya skye ma yin //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the action of arising does not occur in that which has not yet occurred, that is, that which has not yet obtained its own nature, the root text states,üîΩ‚ÄúThat which has not yet occurred does not arise.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit does not arise‚Äù is stated.üîΩMoreover, the root text states,

original: gzhan yang / rdzogs pa yod ces byar 'gyur la //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rdzogs pa yod ces byar 'gyur la //
translated: ‚ÄúThe completed is said to exist;

original: ma byas pa ni med ces brjod //
analyzed: ma byas pa ni med ces brjod //
translated: the uncompleted is said not to exist.‚Äù

original: yod do zhes bya ba 'dis ni rdzogs par brjod do //
analyzed: yod do zhes bya ba 'dis ni rdzogs par brjod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúexists‚Äù refers to the completed.

original: rdzogs pa'i dngos po kho na yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i dngos po kho na yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow that only the completed thing exists.

original: yod do zhes bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod do zhes bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it exists.

original: med do zhes bya ba 'dis kyang ma byas shing ma rdzogs pa kho na brjod do //
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba 'dis kyang ma byas shing ma rdzogs pa kho na brjod do //
translated: And by saying that it does not exist, it is also said that it is not produced and not completed.

original: de'i phyir gnas skabs 'di gnyis dang bral nas //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas skabs 'di gnyis dang bral nas //
translated: Therefore, apart from these two states,

original: @229a * // gang gi tshe na skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: @229a * // gang gi tshe na skye bzhin pa //
translated: When it is in the process of arising,

original: med pa de tshe gang der brjod //
analyzed: med pa de tshe gang der brjod //
translated: at that time, what is it?

original: gang gi tshe dngos po 'di ni 'di ltar yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po 'di ni 'di ltar yin no //
translated: When it is said, ‚ÄúThis thing is like this,‚Äù

original: zhes bya bar skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs kyi dngos po bstan par mi nus pa de'i tshe de rang gi ngo bos nges par ma zin pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa nyid de de'i phyir nges par mi nus so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs kyi dngos po bstan par mi nus pa de'i tshe de rang gi ngo bos nges par ma zin pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa nyid de de'i phyir nges par mi nus so //
translated: it is not possible to indicate the thing that is in the process of arising. At that time, it does not exist by its own nature, because it is not ascertained. Therefore, it cannot be ascertained.

original: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis skye bzhin pa mi srid pa'i phyir /üîΩgang tshe rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis skye bzhin pa mi srid pa'i phyir / gang tshe rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Therefore, in this way, as has been explained, because it is impossible for something to be in the process of arising,

original: 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa //
translated: When the effect does not exist apart from the cause,üîΩat that time, what effect is there?

original: de yi tshe na 'jug pa dang // ldog pa 'thad pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi tshe na 'jug pa dang // ldog pa 'thad pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: At that time, engagement and disengagement would not be tenable.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par dpyad pa na rgyu las logs shig pa'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur pa de'i tshe rten med pa'i 'jug pa 'bras bu skye ba dang ldog pa rgyu 'jig pa med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par dpyad pa na rgyu las logs shig pa'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur pa de'i tshe rten med pa'i 'jug pa 'bras bu skye ba dang ldog pa rgyu 'jig pa med de /
translated: When analyzed, if the effect is not different from the cause, then there would be no effect arising, no engagement, and no disintegration of the cause, no disengagement.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: As the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: sems can mi dang shed skyes kyang rung ste //
analyzed: sems can mi dang shed skyes kyang rung ste //
translated: Whether sentient beings are human or born from a womb,

original: 'dir skyes shi ba 'ga' yang skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dir skyes shi ba 'ga' yang skye mi 'gyur //
translated: None who are born and die here will be born again.

original: chos kun rang bzhin sgyu 'dra stong pa ste //
analyzed: chos kun rang bzhin sgyu 'dra stong pa ste //
translated: All phenomena are empty, like an illusion,

original: mu stegs can gyis shes par nus ma yin //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis shes par nus ma yin //
translated: And cannot be known by tƒ´rthikas.

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs la /
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs la /
translated: This is stated extensively.

original: de bzhin du /üîΩskye ba dang ni 'chi 'pho'ang //
analyzed: de bzhin du / skye ba dang ni 'chi 'pho'ang //
translated: And similarly:üîΩBirth and death

original: skye ba med cing 'chi 'pho med //
analyzed: skye ba med cing 'chi 'pho med //
translated: Are neither born nor dead.

original: gang zhig 'di ni shes gyur pa //üîΩde yi ting 'dzin rnyed mi dka' //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di ni shes gyur pa // de yi ting 'dzin rnyed mi dka' //
translated: Whoever knows this

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Will easily attain meditative concentration.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su dpyad pa na dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin 'grub par mi 'gyur bas so so nas dngos po rnams la sgyu ma lta bu de nyid lhag ma lus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su dpyad pa na dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin 'grub par mi 'gyur bas so so nas dngos po rnams la sgyu ma lta bu de nyid lhag ma lus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when one analyzes in this way, the nature of things is not established. The illusion-like nature of things remains.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes skyes pas 'gro ba mtha' dag 'gyed par 'dod pas sgyu ma'i skye bo blun po rmongs par byed pa skye bo blun pa ma yin pa ya mtshan bskyed par rig cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes skyes pas 'gro ba mtha' dag 'gyed par 'dod pas sgyu ma'i skye bo blun po rmongs par byed pa skye bo blun pa ma yin pa ya mtshan bskyed par rig cing /
translated: Therefore, in this way, the one who wishes to liberate all transmigrating beings by generating the wisdom of omniscience should know that the one who creates the illusion of a person, who creates delusion for a foolish person, creates wonder for the non-foolish.

original: 'dir bden par mngon par zhen pas bslad pa'i dngos po la srid pa bsal la /
analyzed: 'dir bden par mngon par zhen pas bslad pa'i dngos po la srid pa bsal la /
translated: Here, one should eliminate existence that is polluted by the adherence to true existence of things.

original: 'gro ba yongs la phan gdags pa'i phyir bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'i snying rje chen po dang byang chub kyi sems dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba gsum mngon du byas te /
analyzed: 'gro ba yongs la phan gdags pa'i phyir bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'i snying rje chen po dang byang chub kyi sems dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba gsum mngon du byas te /
translated: In order to benefit all transmigrating beings, one should manifest three things: great compassion, the thought of awakening, and the wisdom called nondual.

original: mkhas pa srid par skye ba la bzo zhing ji lta ba bzhin nges pa'i 'khor ba'i rang bzhin gyi nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal gyi me 'bar ba'i phreng ba'i tshogs kyis bskor ba'i srid pa gsum gyi khang pa'i @229b dbus su chud pa'i 'gro ba skyob pa
analyzed: mkhas pa srid par skye ba la bzo zhing ji lta ba bzhin nges pa'i 'khor ba'i rang bzhin gyi nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal gyi me 'bar ba'i phreng ba'i tshogs kyis bskor ba'i srid pa gsum gyi khang pa'i @229b dbus su chud pa'i 'gro ba skyob pa
translated: The wise one, seeing that beings are without a protector in the middle of the house of the three worlds, which is surrounded by the blazing garland of the fires of the afflictions and suffering that are the nature of cyclic existence,

original: med par lta zhing 'gro bar 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal ma lus par bsdoms pa lhags pa /
analyzed: med par lta zhing 'gro bar 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal ma lus par bsdoms pa lhags pa /
translated: and seeing that they are going to the lower realms, which is the complete collection of all suffering,

original: 'khor ba'i bar du skad cig dang skad cig la rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du lus dang sems dag la gnod pa dag gis kyang bred par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i bar du skad cig dang skad cig la rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du lus dang sems dag la gnod pa dag gis kyang bred par mi 'gyur la /
translated: he is not frightened by the harm to body and mind in the various forms that occur from moment to moment in cyclic existence.üîΩAnd he is not discouraged by the sudden onslaught of the suffering of beings, but he is inspired to continue in cyclic existence.

original: 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal cig car lhags pa dag gis 'khor ba'i bar du spro bar byas pa'i brtson 'grus kyi skad cig re re ni 'gro ba mtha' dag gi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi nor gyi tshogs mtha' yas pa skye ba'i rgyur rig par byas
analyzed: 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal cig car lhags pa dag gis 'khor ba'i bar du spro bar byas pa'i brtson 'grus kyi skad cig re re ni 'gro ba mtha' dag gi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi nor gyi tshogs mtha' yas pa skye ba'i rgyur rig par byas
translated: Each moment of his diligence produces the cause for the infinite wealth of omniscience for all beings.

original: nas slar yang srid pa brgya phrag blang bar rigs te /
analyzed: nas slar yang srid pa brgya phrag blang bar rigs te /
translated: It is fitting to take up hundreds of existences again and again.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: As the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: de yi lhag bsam 'khor bar gtogs pa ste //
analyzed: de yi lhag bsam 'khor bar gtogs pa ste //
translated: Their superior intention belongs to sa·πÉsƒÅra,

original: sbyor ba mya ngan 'das par gtogs pa yin //
analyzed: sbyor ba mya ngan 'das par gtogs pa yin //
translated: Their practice belongs to nirvƒÅ·πáa.üîΩThrough generosity, they ripen sentient beings

original: sbyin pas sems can yongs su smin phyir dang // rnam par smin la re ba med pa nyid //
analyzed: sbyin pas sems can yongs su smin phyir dang // rnam par smin la re ba med pa nyid //
translated: And have no hope for the fruitions.üîΩAnd so on.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdo las /
translated: Similarly, in the S≈´tra on the Secrets of the TathƒÅgata,

original: rgyal po chen po yang de'i tshe de'i dus na 'khor der byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpa' ba'i stobs zhes bya ba zhig lhags par gyur nas 'khod de /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po yang de'i tshe de'i dus na 'khor der byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpa' ba'i stobs zhes bya ba zhig lhags par gyur nas 'khod de /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat King, at that time, in that retinue, a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva named ≈ö≈´radas came and sat down.

original: des bcom ldan 'das de la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: des bcom ldan 'das de la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He said this to that BhagavƒÅn:

original: bcom ldan 'das de de lta lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de de lta lags so //
translated: ‚ÄòBhagavƒÅn, that is so.

original: bde bar gshegs pa de de lta lags so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa de de lta lags so //
translated: Sugata, that is so.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis brtson 'grus brtsams shing lus dang srog dor bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis brtson 'grus brtsams shing lus dang srog dor bar bgyi'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas will undertake perseverance and will give up their bodies and lives.

original: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad gsungs pa'i don 'tshal te /
analyzed: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad gsungs pa'i don 'tshal te /
translated: I understand the meaning of what the Lord has said.

original: gang zhig 'di snyam du myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o snyam du sems pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni le lor ltung ba lags par kho bo la snang ngo //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di snyam du myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o snyam du sems pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni le lor ltung ba lags par kho bo la snang ngo //
translated: I see that the bodhisattva who thinks, ‚ÄúI will quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,‚Äù falls into laziness.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'khor ba la yongs su skyo ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'khor ba la yongs su skyo ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Lord, for bodhisattvas who have undertaken perseverance, weariness with sa·πÉsƒÅra does not occur.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can yongs su smin pa nyid nye bar bzung nas 'khor ba la phan yon du lca ba de ltar ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ni ma lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can yongs su smin pa nyid nye bar bzung nas 'khor ba la phan yon du lca ba de ltar ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ni ma lags so //
translated: Blessed One, bodhisattvas, taking up the task of bringing sentient beings to full maturity, consider sa·πÉsƒÅra to be beneficial. But that is not the case with great nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: bcom ldan 'das @230a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @230a * //
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi don la mngon par brtson pa lags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi don la mngon par brtson pa lags so //
translated: bodhisattvas are dedicated to the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'khor ba ches bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ni ma lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'khor ba ches bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ni ma lags so //
translated: Blessed One, for bodhisattvas, sa·πÉsƒÅra is more blissful than great nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad kyi don la brtson pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad kyi don la brtson pa ste /
translated: Blessed One, bodhisattvas are dedicated to the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: de rnams ji lta ji ltar sems can gyi don byed pa de lta de ltar bde bar 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: de rnams ji lta ji ltar sems can gyi don byed pa de lta de ltar bde bar 'gyur lags so //
translated: The more they work for the welfare of sentient beings, the more blissful they become.

original: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni slar ci zhig bgyid par 'gyur /üîΩbcom ldan 'das de'i slad du byang chub sems dpas ni 'khor ba'i bde ba'i ro mi myang bar 'khor ba'i spyod yul can du bgyi'i /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni slar ci zhig bgyid par 'gyur / bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du byang chub sems dpas ni 'khor ba'i bde ba'i ro mi myang bar 'khor ba'i spyod yul can du bgyi'i /
translated: What will the Blessed One do when he has passed into parinirvƒÅ·πáa?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i spyod yul can du ni ma lags so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i spyod yul can du ni ma lags so //
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, the bodhisattva should be one whose domain is cyclic existence, not one whose domain is nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i spyod yul can 'khor ba'i bde ba'i ro mi myang bar sems can gyi don la brtson pas ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa khums shing chos dpag tu med pa khums la sems can dpag tu medüîΩpa yongs su smin par bgyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i spyod yul can 'khor ba'i bde ba'i ro mi myang bar sems can gyi don la brtson pas ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa khums shing chos dpag tu med pa khums la sems can dpag tu med pa yongs su smin par bgyid do //
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva whose domain is cyclic existence, who does not taste the pleasures of cyclic existence, who strives for the welfare of sentient beings, will serve countless blessed buddhas, will hear countless teachings, and will bring countless sentient beings to full maturity.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'khor ba'i spyod yul can gyi byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gyi spyod yul gyi rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'khor ba'i spyod yul can gyi byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gyi spyod yul gyi rjes su 'jug go //
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva whose domain is cyclic existence follows the domain of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i spyod yul can gyi byang chub sems dpa' ni btang snyoms su ltung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i spyod yul can gyi byang chub sems dpa' ni btang snyoms su ltung ngo //
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva who has the domain of nirvƒÅ·πáa falls into indifference.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i spyod yul la skrag na ni spyod yul ma lags par ltung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i spyod yul la skrag na ni spyod yul ma lags par ltung ngo //
translated: Blessed One, if the bodhisattva is afraid of the domain of sa·πÉsƒÅra, he falls into a non-domain.

original: spyod yul ma lags par ltung na phyis sems can gyi don mi bgyid do /
analyzed: spyod yul ma lags par ltung na phyis sems can gyi don mi bgyid do /
translated: If he falls into a non-domain, he will not later benefit sentient beings.

original: des ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul la dgod par mi nus shing /
analyzed: des ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul la dgod par mi nus shing /
translated: He will not be able to lead them into the domain of the TathƒÅgatas.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho bar mi 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho bar mi 'gyur lags so //
translated: He will not become a support for all sentient beings.

original: yang de'i spyod yul ma lags pa gang zhe na gang di nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la dga' ba nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba btang snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: yang de'i spyod yul ma lags pa gang zhe na gang di nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la dga' ba nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba btang snyoms pa'o //
translated: What is his non-domain? It is delighting in the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and being indifferent to bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das nyan thos rnams kyi spyod yul gang lags pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul ma lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyan thos rnams kyi spyod yul gang lags pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul ma lags so //
translated: Blessed One, the domain of the ≈õrƒÅvakas is not the domain of the bodhisattva.

original: bcom @230b ldan 'das nyan thos rnams ni 'khor ba'i spyod yul la skrag par 'gyur lags kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni slar 'khor ba dpag tu med pa yongs su 'dzin par byed par 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: bcom @230b ldan 'das nyan thos rnams ni 'khor ba'i spyod yul la skrag par 'gyur lags kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni slar 'khor ba dpag tu med pa yongs su 'dzin par byed par 'gyur lags so //
translated: Blessed One, the ≈õrƒÅvakas are frightened by the domain of cyclic existence, but the bodhisattvas embrace immeasurable cyclic existence.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' ni spyod yul la gnas par 'gyur bar bgyi 'tshal lo zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' ni spyod yul la gnas par 'gyur bar bgyi 'tshal lo zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva should remain in the domain.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bzhi brgya pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bzhi brgya pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: ƒÄcƒÅrya ƒÄryadeva says in his Catu·∏•≈õataka:

original: 'dus byas kyi don dgag pa bsgom pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bco lnga pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi don dgag pa bsgom pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bco lnga pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary to the fifteenth chapter on the meditation that refutes conditioned things, from the commentary on the Catu·∏•≈õataka.

original: // / da ni thal zin pa'i rab tu byed pa bco lngas bstan bcos kyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs par byas nas bstan bcos rtsom pa'i dgos pa dang / rgol ba ngan pa'i lhag ma spangs par bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa bcu drug pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: // / da ni thal zin pa'i rab tu byed pa bco lngas bstan bcos kyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs par byas nas bstan bcos rtsom pa'i dgos pa dang / rgol ba ngan pa'i lhag ma spangs par bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa bcu drug pa rtsom mo //
translated: Now, having completed the work of the treatise by means of the fifteen chapters, the sixteenth chapter is composed in order to demonstrate the purpose of composing the treatise and to refute the remaining objections.

original: rgyu 'ga' zhig gis stong pa yang //
analyzed: rgyu 'ga' zhig gis stong pa yang //
translated: Even though it is empty of any cause,

original: stong pa min pa lta bur snang ;üîΩ/ rab tu byed pa thams cad kyis //
analyzed: stong pa min pa lta bur snang ; / rab tu byed pa thams cad kyis //
translated: it appears as if it were not empty.üîΩEach of the chapters

original: de ni so so 'gog par byed //
analyzed: de ni so so 'gog par byed //
translated: refutes that.

original: stong pa nyid kyi don ji lta ba bzhin nges par ma byas par ni 'gas kyang 'khor ba la chags pa spangs nas mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' ba bskyed par mi nus so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi don ji lta ba bzhin nges par ma byas par ni 'gas kyang 'khor ba la chags pa spangs nas mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' ba bskyed par mi nus so //
translated: Without ascertaining the meaning of emptiness just as it is, no one can abandon attachment to cyclic existence and generate delight in nirvana.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de yang 'gro ba mtha' dag dang bdag gi ba la mngon par zhen pa'i zhags pas dbang du byas pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa rnams ha cang skrag par byed pa yin pas mkhas pas mi snyan pa gleng
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de yang 'gro ba mtha' dag dang bdag gi ba la mngon par zhen pa'i zhags pas dbang du byas pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa rnams ha cang skrag par byed pa yin pas mkhas pas mi snyan pa gleng
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is very frightening to those who are not learned, for they are bound by the noose of clinging to the whole of cyclic existence and to their own selves.

original: ba la mkhas pa'i skyes bus rgyal po la btsun mo phangs ba shi ba'i tshul gsol bas thugs bde ba bskyed pa bzhin du rigs pa 'ga' zhig gis gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: ba la mkhas pa'i skyes bus rgyal po la btsun mo phangs ba shi ba'i tshul gsol bas thugs bde ba bskyed pa bzhin du rigs pa 'ga' zhig gis gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the wise should introduce them to emptiness gradually, just as a skilled person would introduce a king to his beloved queen who has died.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i 'dzin pas phyin ci log pa'i 'jig rten gyis ni dngos po mi rtag pa nyid la skad cig mar 'jig pa ma mthong bas 'du byed tsam gyi rgyun gyi don yang dag par ma nges pa las stong pa nyid
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i 'dzin pas phyin ci log pa'i 'jig rten gyis ni dngos po mi rtag pa nyid la skad cig mar 'jig pa ma mthong bas 'du byed tsam gyi rgyun gyi don yang dag par ma nges pa las stong pa nyid
translated: The world, which is mistaken due to the clinging of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the conception of ‚Äúmine,‚Äù does not see the impermanence of things as momentary disintegration. Therefore, they do not ascertain the meaning of the continuum of mere conditioning.

original: du lta ba'i gegs su 'gyur ba rtag pa nyid du nges par byas nas phyir 'jil bar byed pa na 'gro ba mi stong pa kho nar rtogs te /
analyzed: du lta ba'i gegs su 'gyur ba rtag pa nyid du nges par byas nas phyir 'jil bar byed pa na 'gro ba mi stong pa kho nar rtogs te /
translated: Having ascertained that the view of emptiness is an obstacle to the view of non-emptiness, when one is refuted, one realizes that the world is non-empty.

original: de'i phyir de'i stong pa nyid ma yin pa nyid du lta ba dgag pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa dang po brtsoms  so zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i stong pa nyid ma yin pa nyid du lta ba dgag pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa dang po brtsoms  so zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to refute the view that it is not emptiness, the first chapter is composed, and so on.

original: @231a * // 'dir stong pa nyid kyi don rang bzhin dang bral ba'i don yin no zhes ni lan cig ma yin par bstan zin to //üîΩde'i phyir de ltar na dngos po'i rnam pa rang bzhin dang bral ba yin yang rgyu 'ga' zhig gis stong pa ma yin par gang dag la snang ba de dag gi yod pa ma yin pa'i 'dzin pa'i rgyu de rab tu byed pa bco lnga po thams cad
analyzed: @231a * // 'dir stong pa nyid kyi don rang bzhin dang bral ba'i don yin no zhes ni lan cig ma yin par bstan zin to // de'i phyir de ltar na dngos po'i rnam pa rang bzhin dang bral ba yin yang rgyu 'ga' zhig gis stong pa ma yin par gang dag la snang ba de dag gi yod pa ma yin pa'i 'dzin pa'i rgyu de rab tu byed pa bco lnga po thams cad
translated: Here, the meaning of emptiness is the meaning of being devoid of intrinsic nature, as has been explained more than once.

original: kyis 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: kyis 'gog par byed do //
translated: Therefore, in that case, although the aspect of an entity is devoid of intrinsic nature, it is not empty due to some cause. The cause for the apprehension of those that appear is refuted by all fifteen chapters.

original: gal te de lta bu'i don du rab tu byed pa de rnams brtsams na /
analyzed: gal te de lta bu'i don du rab tu byed pa de rnams brtsams na /
translated: If those chapters are composed for such a meaning,

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po rnams stong pa ma yin pa nyid du 'grub pa ma yin nam 'di ltar rab tu byed pa de rnams kyi smra ba po ni re zhig khyod yod la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po rnams stong pa ma yin pa nyid du 'grub pa ma yin nam 'di ltar rab tu byed pa de rnams kyi smra ba po ni re zhig khyod yod la /
translated: Therefore, are not things established as not empty?

original: rab tu byed pa brjod par bya ba'i don stong pa ma yin pa'i rgyu zlog par byed pa'i rgyu yang yod cing don khyad par du 'phags pas mtshams byas pas sgra'i tshogs kyi ngo bo can gyi tshig rab tu byed pa bco lnga'i bdag nyid can 'di yang
analyzed: rab tu byed pa brjod par bya ba'i don stong pa ma yin pa'i rgyu zlog par byed pa'i rgyu yang yod cing don khyad par du 'phags pas mtshams byas pas sgra'i tshogs kyi ngo bo can gyi tshig rab tu byed pa bco lnga'i bdag nyid can 'di yang
translated: The author of those chapters exists, and the cause of the refutation of the empty meaning of the expressed object of the chapters also exists. Since the meaning is distinguished by the boundary, this collection of words, which has the nature of a collection of sounds, has the nature of fifteen chapters.

original: yod pas smra ba po dang brjod par bya ba dang / tshig rnams yod pa las dngos po rnams stong pa nyid ma yin par grub ste /
analyzed: yod pas smra ba po dang brjod par bya ba dang / tshig rnams yod pa las dngos po rnams stong pa nyid ma yin par grub ste /
translated: Since the author, the expressed object, and the words exist, it is established that things are not empty.

original: de'i phyir khyod kyi rab tu byed pa thams cad rtsom pa'i ngal ba'i tshogs don med pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyi rab tu byed pa thams cad rtsom pa'i ngal ba'i tshogs don med pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that all of your efforts to compose chapters are meaningless, it is said:

original: gang tshe smra ba brjod bya na'ang //
analyzed: gang tshe smra ba brjod bya na'ang //
translated: When the author and the expressed object

original: de'i tshe stong pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe stong pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: At that time, it is not tenable to say ‚Äúemptiness.‚Äù

original: 'ang gi sgra ni tshig bsdu ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra ni tshig bsdu ba'i don du'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means ‚Äúin addition.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe khyod smra ba po yod cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyod smra ba po yod cing /
translated: When you, the speaker, exist,

original: brjod par bya ba rab tu byed pa bco lngas bstan par bya ba'i don yod la khyod kyi tshig stong pa nyid kyi don rab tu sgrub par byed pa yang yod pa de'i tshe dngos po thams cad grub po //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba rab tu byed pa bco lngas bstan par bya ba'i don yod la khyod kyi tshig stong pa nyid kyi don rab tu sgrub par byed pa yang yod pa de'i tshe dngos po thams cad grub po //
translated: and the object that is expressed exists, and your words also exist to establish the meaning of emptiness, at that time all things would be established.

original: mo gsham gyi bu yod pa ma yin pa ni don gang gi yang smra ba por mi rigs shing /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu yod pa ma yin pa ni don gang gi yang smra ba por mi rigs shing /
translated: It is not tenable for a nonexistent son of a barren woman to be a speaker of any object.

original: de'i tshe tshig kyang yod pa ma yin la de'i tshig gis bstan par bya ba'i don yang med na 'di gsum ni yod pa yang yin pas dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshig kyang yod pa ma yin la de'i tshig gis bstan par bya ba'i don yang med na 'di gsum ni yod pa yang yin pas dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du grub po //
translated: At that time, words also would not exist, and the object that is expressed by those words would not exist. Since these three exist, things would have intrinsic reality.

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:

original: 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: This is also illogical.üîΩWhy?

original: gang las she na 'di ltar /
analyzed: gang las she na 'di ltar /
translated: Because:

original: gang zhig brten nas kun 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang zhig brten nas kun 'byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises dependently

original: de ni gsum la'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de ni gsum la'ang yod ma yin //
translated: It does not exist in any of the three ways.

original: rang bzhin bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúnature‚Äù is a verbal suffix.

original: 'di na smra ba po gang yin pa de yang kho bo cag gi ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin dang smra ba po nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'di na smra ba po gang yin pa de yang kho bo cag gi ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin dang smra ba po nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Here, the speaker is dependently arisen, according to us, and is posited as a speaker.

original: tshig dang brjod par bya ba la brten nas smra ba por 'dogs kyi mi smra ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig dang brjod par bya ba la brten nas smra ba por 'dogs kyi mi smra ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The speaker is imputed in dependence on speech and the object spoken about, but not as a non-speaker.

original: gang gi @231b tshe de lta yin pa de'i tshe smra ba po la smra ba'i rang bzhin med la tshig dang brjod par bya ba la yang smra ba po'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi @231b tshe de lta yin pa de'i tshe smra ba po la smra ba'i rang bzhin med la tshig dang brjod par bya ba la yang smra ba po'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When that is so, the speaker does not have the nature of a speaker, and the speech and the object spoken about do not have the nature of a speaker.

original: gal te yod na ni skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod na ni skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they did, then arising would be pointless.

original: de'i phyir smra ba po'i rang bzhin rang ngam de la med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir smra ba po'i rang bzhin rang ngam de la med de /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the speaker does not exist in itself or in that.

original: de'i phyir stong pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is empty.

original: de bzhin du brjod par bya ba yang smra ba po dang tshig la brten nas gdags kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du brjod par bya ba yang smra ba po dang tshig la brten nas gdags kyi /
translated: In the same way, the object spoken about is imputed in dependence on the speaker and the speech.

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang tshig la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang tshig la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And so on, and this should be applied to the words as well.

original: de'i phyir gsum po de dag gi rang bzhin ni gsum char la yang yod pa ma yin pas smra ba po dang / brjod par bya ba dang tshig rnams rang bzhin stong pa nyid du grub pa kho na ste de'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsum po de dag gi rang bzhin ni gsum char la yang yod pa ma yin pas smra ba po dang / brjod par bya ba dang tshig rnams rang bzhin stong pa nyid du grub pa kho na ste de'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, since the nature of these three does not exist in any of the three, the speaker, the object of expression, and the words are established as empty of essence. Therefore, there is no error.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: gal te 'di thams cad stong pa yin na de'i tshe dbang po dang don dag rnam pa thams cad du med pas 'gro ba bong bu'i rva dang 'dra bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'di thams cad stong pa yin na de'i tshe dbang po dang don dag rnam pa thams cad du med pas 'gro ba bong bu'i rva dang 'dra bar 'gyur na /
translated: If all of this were empty, then since the faculties and objects would not exist in any way, the world would be like a rabbit‚Äôs horns.

original: dbang po dang don bden pa'i ngo bo 'di yod pa yang yin pas dngos po thams cad rang bzhin dang bcas pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang don bden pa'i ngo bo 'di yod pa yang yin pas dngos po thams cad rang bzhin dang bcas pa kho na yin no //
translated: But since these faculties and objects, which are real entities, do exist, all things have essences.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /üîΩgal te stong pa'i nyes pa yis //
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste / gal te stong pa'i nyes pa yis //
translated: To this we reply:üîΩIf nonemptiness were established

original: stong pa ma yin 'grub 'gyur na //
analyzed: stong pa ma yin 'grub 'gyur na //
translated: Because of the error of emptiness,

original: de lta yin dang de las bzlog pa'i sgo nas khyod la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang de las bzlog pa'i sgo nas khyod la /
translated: If that were so, then the opposite of that would be the case for you.

original: mi stong nyes pas stong pa ni //
analyzed: mi stong nyes pas stong pa ni //
translated: If the world were not empty,

original: ci ste 'grub par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: ci ste 'grub par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: then it would not be established as full.

original: gal te 'gro ba stong pa ma yin par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'gro ba ldog pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i phyir rtag par 'gyur zhing ma skyes pa dang mi 'gag par 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin te brten nas dmigs pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba stong pa ma yin par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'gro ba ldog pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i phyir rtag par 'gyur zhing ma skyes pa dang mi 'gag par 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin te brten nas dmigs pa'i phyir ro
translated: If the world were not empty, then at that time, because it would abide by the nature of not ceasing, it would be permanent and it would not arise and would not cease. But that is not the case, because it is observed in dependence.

original: // de ltar na stong pa ma yin pa'i nyes pas khyod la stong pa nyid kyi don 'grub par ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: // de ltar na stong pa ma yin pa'i nyes pas khyod la stong pa nyid kyi don 'grub par ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: So why would the meaning of emptiness not be established for you by the fault of not being empty?

original: stong pa nyid du smra ba bsal ba tsam gyis rang gi phyogs 'grub par rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du smra ba bsal ba tsam gyis rang gi phyogs 'grub par rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is also not right to establish one‚Äôs own position merely by refuting the proponent of emptiness.

original: phyogs gzhan khas blangs pa'i rgol bas ni gdon mi za bar /
analyzed: phyogs gzhan khas blangs pa'i rgol bas ni gdon mi za bar /
translated: The opponent who accepts the other position must

original: gzhan gyi phyogs ni bzlog pa dang // rang gi phyogs ni sgrub pa ste //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs ni bzlog pa dang // rang gi phyogs ni sgrub pa ste //
translated: refute the other‚Äôs position and establish one‚Äôs own position.

original: gnyis bya ba zhig na khyod ni stong pa nyid du smra ba gsal ba tsam la zhugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis bya ba zhig na khyod ni stong pa nyid du smra ba gsal ba tsam la zhugs pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe two are different,‚Äù then you are a proponent of emptiness, because you are engaged in mere clarity.üîΩIf you delight in one part of the refutation,

original: gal te sun 'byin byed phyogs gcig / dga' na sgrub byed la cis min //
analyzed: gal te sun 'byin byed phyogs gcig / dga' na sgrub byed la cis min //
translated: why not in the proof?

original: khyod sun 'byin par byed pa'i phyogs ltar sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs la yang dga' la rag go //üîΩde'i phyir gal te ril bsgrub par bya ba @232a * //
analyzed: khyod sun 'byin par byed pa'i phyogs ltar sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs la yang dga' la rag go // de'i phyir gal te ril bsgrub par bya ba @232a * //
translated: You should delight in the part of the proof just as you do in the part of the refutation.

original: dang mtshungs par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: dang mtshungs par mi 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, if you do not want to be similar to the one who is to be refuted,

original: rang gi phyogs sgrub pa'i phyir re zhig 'thad pa cung zad cig brjod dgos na /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs sgrub pa'i phyir re zhig 'thad pa cung zad cig brjod dgos na /
translated: you should state some slight tenable point in order to prove your own position.

original: stong pa nyid du smra ba la ni thams cad bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du smra ba la ni thams cad bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But for the proponent of emptiness, everything is similar to what is to be proven.

original: de'i phyir rang gi phyogs sgrub pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i phyogs yongs su 'dzin pa thong shig / phyogs su ma lhung zhing dbu ma'i lam nas zhugs pa khyod la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dang 'gal pa med pas 'gal  la yang 'jigs pa mi
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi phyogs sgrub pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i phyogs yongs su 'dzin pa thong shig / phyogs su ma lhung zhing dbu ma'i lam nas zhugs pa khyod la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dang 'gal pa med pas 'gal  la yang 'jigs pa mi
translated: You who are impartial and who follow the middle way have no contradictions in terms of what you see and do not see. Therefore, you have no fear of contradiction.

original: srid do /  / ci ste re zhig khyod kyis stong pa nyid du smra ba'i phyogs 'di yongs su brtags pa na mi rigs pas yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: srid do /  / ci ste re zhig khyod kyis stong pa nyid du smra ba'i phyogs 'di yongs su brtags pa na mi rigs pas yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If you think that, since this position of yours that advocates emptiness is unreasonable, it does not exist,

original: de'i phyir 'di med pa nyid du grub na phyogs gzhan med pas sel bar byed pa kho bo cag gi phyogs su grub par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di med pa nyid du grub na phyogs gzhan med pas sel bar byed pa kho bo cag gi phyogs su grub par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: and if you think that, since it is established as nonexistent, the other position is nonexistent, and therefore the position of us eliminators is established,

original: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: this is also not the case.
